Aang: (whispering in a weak voice) I need to ask you something. (still whispering) Please... come closer. (in a normal, even excited voice) Will you go penguin sledding with me? What's going on here? (batting the spear anway, absently) I'm not sure. Appa! Are you all right? Wake up, buddy. Haha! You're okay! This is Appa, my flying bison. Don't worry. It'll wash out. So, do you guys live around here? I'm A... aaaahhhh... ahhhhhh.... aaah aaah aaah AAAAAAACHOOOO! I'm Aang. (He sniffles and rubs his nose.)  Really? It felt higher that that. Sure am. Well, if you guys are stuck Appa and I can give you a lift. Okay. First time flyers, hold on tight! Appa, yip yip! (shaking the reigns again) Come on, Appa. Yip yip. Appa's just tired. A little rest and he'll be soaring through the sky. You'll see. Oh... I was smiling? Hey. Whatcha thinkin' about? (looking disconcerted) Uhh... no. I didn't know him... I mean, I knew people that knew him, but I didn't. Sorry. Sleep tight. Aaahhh! Whaaaa! Uh... why are they all looking at me like that? Did Appa sneeze on me? 'Extinct'? It's not for stabbing. (He creates a jet of air that sucks the staff back into his hand.) It's for airbending. Not magic, airbending. It lets me control the air currents around my glider and fly. Check again! (as he crashes) Oof! You're a waterbender! (slurring) Sthee? Now my tongue ith thuck to my sthaff. (gesturing over his shoulder at the toilet) Wow! Everything freezes in there! What war? (He hops down off of Appa) What are you talking about? PENGUIN! Haha! Hey, come on little guy. Wanna go sledding? Oof! Heh heh, I have a way with animals. (He puts his arms out and waddles in imitation of the four flippered penguins) Yarp! Yarp yarp! Yarp! Yarp yarp! Yarp! You got a deal! Just one little problem. I'm an airbender, not a waterbender. Isn't there someone in your tribe who can teach you? This isn't right. A waterbender needs to master water. What about the North Pole? There's another Water Tribe up there, right? Maybe they have waterbenders who could teach you. But you forget I have a flying bison. Appa and I can personally fly you to the North Pole. Katara, we're gonna find you a master! Well, you think about it. But in the meantime, can you teach me to catch one of these penguins? You still are a kid! Whoa... what is that? If you wanna be a bender, you have to let go of fear. Okay, back up. I have friends all over the world, even in the Fire Nation. I've never seen any war. I don't know... a few days, maybe? What? That's impossible. Do I look like a hundred-twelve year old man to you? A hundred years! I can't believe it. I did get to meet you. Huh? What's that you said about booby traps? Uh oh. Hold on tight!
Katara: Sokka, look! (trying to retain control of the globe of water) But Sokka! I caught one! Hey! It's not magic. It's waterbending, and it's- You're calling me weird? I'm not the one who makes muscles at myself every time I see my reflection in the water. and  Watch out! Go left! Go left! You call that left? So it's my fault? You are the most sexist, immature, nut brained... Ugh, I'm embarrassed to be related to you! Ever since Mom died I've been doing all the work around camp while you've been off playing soldier! I even wash all the clothes! Have you ever smelled your dirty socks? Let me tell you, NOT PLEASANT! No, that's it. I'm done helping you. From now on, you're on your own! You mean I did that? He's alive! We have to help. Stop it! What? What is it? Uh... sure. I guess. Oh, yeah, I'm sure he's a spy for the Fire Navy. You can tell by that evil look in his eye. The paranoid one is my brother, Sokka. You never told us your name. (gasping) You're an airbender! We'd love a ride! Thanks! (She gets on Appa.)  Are you hoping some other kind of monster will come along and give you a ride home? You know... before you freeze to death? Why are you smiling at me like that? Hey. I guess I was wondering – your being an airbender and all – if you had any idea what happened to the Avatar. Okay. Just curious. Goodnight. (voice over) Aang! Aang, wake up! (He wakes up, gasping) It's okay. We're in the village now. Come on, get ready. Everyone's waiting to meet you. Aang, this is the entire village. Entire village, Aang. Aang, this is my grandmother. That was amazing. Well... sort of. Not yet. I told you! He's the real thing, Gran Gran! I finally found a bender to teach me. But he's special. I can tell. I sense he's filled with much wisdom. Have you seen Aang? Gran Gran said he disappeared over an hour ago. Aang? (giggles) Hahaha... Aang, I'll help you catch a penguin if you teach me waterbending. (looking away in sadness) No. You're looking at the only waterbender on the whole South Pole. Maybe. But we haven't had contact with our sister tribe in a long time. It's not exactly 'turn right at the second glacier.' It's on the other side of the world. (happily) That's... (then uncertain) I mean, I don't know. I've never left home before. (mock teacherly tone) Okay, listen closely my young pupil. Catching penguins is an ancient and sacred art. Observe. I haven't done this since I was a kid! (deathly serious) A Fire Navy ship, and a very bad memory for my people. Aang, stop! We're not allowed to go near it. The ship could be booby trapped. This ship has haunted my tribe since Gran Gran was a little girl. It was part of the Fire Nation's first attacks. Aang, how long were you in that iceberg? I think it was more like a hundred years! Think about it. The war is a century old. You don't know about it because, somehow, you were in there that whole time. It's the only explanation. (kneeling next to him) I'm sorry, Aang. Maybe somehow there's a bright side to all this. (smiles) Come on. Let's get out of here. Aang? Let's head back. This place is creepy.
Sokka: It's not getting away from me this time. Watch and learn, Katara. This is how you catch a fish. (whispers) Shhh. Katara, you're gonna scare it away. Mmmm... I can already smell it cookin'! (very exasperated) Ugh! Why is it that every time you play with magic water I get soaked? Yeah, yeah, an ancient art unique to our culture, blah blah blah. Look, I'm just saying that if I had weird powers, I'd keep my weirdness to myself. Ahhh! You don't like my steering. Well, maybe you should have waterbended us out of the ice. I knew I should have left you home. Leave it to a girl to screw things up. (noticing the cracking iceberg) Uh... Katara? Katara! Settle down! Okay, you've gone from weird to freakish, Katara. Yup. Congratulations. Katara! Get back here! We don't know what that thing is! (raising his spear at the boy) Stop! Ahh! You tell us! How'd you get in the ice? (Poking Aang with his spear) And why aren't you frozen? What is that thing? Right. And this is Katara, my flying sister. Ewww! Aahh!!! Ugh! Don't answer that! Did you see that crazy bolt of light? He was probably trying to signal the Fire Navy. (incredulous) You just sneezed... and flew ten feet in the air. Giant light beams... flying bison... airbenders... I think I've got Midnight Sun Madness. I'm going home to where stuff makes sense. Oh, no... I am not getting on that fluffy snot monster. Wow. That was truly amazing. (disgusted) Uuuuugh. (grabbing Aang's staff) What is this, a weapon? You can't stab anything with this. You know, last time I checked, humans can't fly. (gasping) My watchtower! Great. You're an airbender, Katara's a waterbender, together you can just waste time all day long. Now men, it's important that you show no fear when you face a firebender. In the Water Tribe, we fight to the last man standing. For without courage, how can we call ourselves men? Listen! Until your fathers return from the war, they're counting on you to be the men of this tribe. And that means no potty breaks. (sighing) Okay... who else has to go? Ugh! Katara, get him out of here. This lesson is for warriors only. Stop! Stop it right now! (To Aang) What's wrong with you? We don't have time for fun and games with a war going on. You're kidding, right? He's kidding, right?
Zuko: Finally. (He turns to address someone o.c.) Uncle, do you realize what this means? It means my search - it's about to come to an end. That light came from an incredibly powerful source. It has to be him! (exploding in anger) I don't need any calming tea! I need to capture the Avatar. Helmsman, head a course for the light! Because their honor didn't hinge on the Avatar's capture. Mine does. This coward's hundred years in hiding are over. Ha! Heeya! Enough. I've been drilling this sequence all day. Teach me the next set. I'm more than ready. Grrrr... huh! (He blasts one of the guards backwards with a gout of fire.) The sages tell us that the Avatar is the last airbender. He must be over a hundred years old by now. He's had a century to master the four elements. I'll need more than basic firebending to defeat him. You WILL teach me the advanced set! (voice over) The last airbender. (Cut to a profile view of Zuko looking through his telescope) Quite agile for his old age. Wake my uncle! Tell him I found the Avatar... ...as well as his hiding place.

Aang: Yeh, we were on the ship and there was this booby trap and well... (putting his hand to his head as if trying to puzzle out the thought) ...we “boobied” right into it. Don't blame Katara! I brought her there. (Looking downcast) It's my fault. (smiling earnestly) You should try it sometime. (momentarily confused, then brightening) I am? Great! Katara, I don't want to come between you and your family. Thanks for penguin sledding with me. (putting a hand on Appa) Guess I'll go back home and look for the airbenders. (Thinking) Wow, I haven't cleaned my room in a hundred years. Not looking forward to that.  It was nice meeting everyone. Come on, Appa, you can do it! Yip! Yip!(sadly) I'll miss you too. Come on, boy. Yeh, I liked her too. The village! (He slides down off his perch) Appa, wait here! Hey Katara. Hey Sokka. Looking for me? Well, you're just a teenager. If I go with you, will you promise to leave everyone alone? Don't worry, Katara, it'll be okay. (They push him forward roughly) Take care of Appa for me until I get back. So... I guess you never fought an airbender before. I bet I can take you both with my hands tied behind my back. (panting) You haven't seen my staff around, have you?  Thanks anyway! (whispering) Sorry... My staff! Appa! (drained) Hey Katara. Hey Sokka. Thanks for coming. I dropped my staff. (sitting cross legged on the bridge of the saddle, a slightly sad expression on his face) I don't know. I just sort of... did it. Because... I never wanted to be. (looking down sadly) And how am I going to do that? That's what the monks told me. (now smiling) We can learn it together! (producing a scroll) All right, but before I learn waterbending, we have some serious business to attend to (he airbends himself over to them and opens the scroll to reveal a map) here, here, and here. Here (pointing to the eastern Earth Kingdom) we'll ride the hopping llamas. Then waaaay over here (pointing to a spot on the southern Air Nomad islands) we'll surf on the backs of giant koi fish. Then back over here we'll ride the hog-monkeys. They don't like people riding them, but that's what makes it fun!
Katara: Aang didn't do anything. It was an accident. (angrily) Sokka, you're making a mistake. (motioning to Aang) Aang is not our enemy! Don't you see? Aang's brought us something we haven't had in a long time. Fun. Grandmother, please, don't let Sokka do this. Then I'm banished too! C'mon, Aang, let's go! To find a waterbender! Aang is taking me to the North Pole! So, you're leaving the South Pole? This is goodbye? Where will you go? (cutting her off angrily) You happy now? There goes my one chance of becoming a waterbender! Sokka, get out of the way! Aang? No, Aang! Don't do this! We have to go after that ship, Sokka. Aang saved our tribe; now we have to save him. Why can't you realize that he's on our side? If we don't help him, no one will. I know you don't like Aang, but we owe him and I— (with a happy gasp) Sokka! He's not my— (turning to the canoe) There's no way we're gonna catch a war ship with a canoe.  Appa! Please, Appa, we need your help. Aang needs your help. Sokka doesn't believe you can fly, but I do, Appa. (Coaxingly) Come on. Don't you wanna save Aang? (ecstatic) You did it, Sokka! (hysterical) Aang! No! (voice-over as Aang sinks) Aang! Aang! AANG! (incredulously) Did you see what he just did?(worried) Aang! Are you okay? Hurry up, Sokka! How did you do that? With the water? It was the most amazing thing I've ever seen. Why didn't you tell us you were the Avatar? But Aang, the world's been waiting for the Avatar to return and finally put an end to this war. According to legend, you need to first master water, then earth, then fire, right? Well, if we go to the North Pole you can master waterbending. And Sokka, I'm sure you'll get to knock some firebender heads on the way. Then we're in this together. What's there?
Sokka: (pointing at Aang) I knew it! You signaled the Fire Navy with that flare! You're leading them straight to us, aren't you? Aha! The traitor confesses! Warriors, away from the enemy! (The children walk away from Aang and towards Sokka and Gran Gran.) The foreigner is banned from our village! No! I'm keeping my promise to Dad. I'm protecting you from threats like him! Fun? We can't fight firebenders with fun! Get out of our village. Now! (pointing at Katara) Where do you think you're going? Katara! (She stops) Would you really choose him over your tribe? Your own family? Let's see your bison fly now, air boy. Yeh, I thought so. All right! Ready our defenses! The Fire Nation could be on our shores any moment now! (cutting him off forcefully and pointing to the fortifications) And no potty breaks! (disappointed at the tower's collapse) Oh man! Ohhh, man! (dryly) Hi...Aang. Thanks for comin'. No way. Katara, I— Katara! Are you gonna talk all day or are you comin' with me? Get in. We're going to save your boyfriend. Whatever. Yeah... okay, Gran. You just love taking me out of my comfort zone, don't ya? (drearily) Go. Fly. Soar. Up. Ascend. Elevate. What was it that kid said? Yee-ha? Hup hup? Wahoo? Uh... yip yip? He's flying! He's flying! Katara, he's—! (Katara gives him a smug look. Then, nonchalantly) I mean, big deal, he's flying. Now that was some waterbending! Well, I couldn't let you have all the glory. Got it! Ha! That's from the Water Tribe! Katara! (to himself) I'm just a guy with a boomerang; I didn't ask for all this flying and magic. Yip yip! Yip yip! (somewhat dreamily) I'd like that. I'd really like that.
Zuko: Where are you hiding him? He'd be about this age? Master of all elements? I know you're hiding him! (incredulous) You're the airbender? You're the Avatar? I've spent years preparing for this encounter. Training. Meditating. You're just a child! Head a course to the Fire Nation. I'm going home. This staff will make an excellent gift for my father. I suppose you wouldn't know of fathers, being raised by monks. Take the Avatar to the prison hold. And (shoving the staff in Iroh's direction) take this to my quarters. Looks like I underestimated you. What is that? Shoot them down! That kid, Uncle, just did this. (Shot widens to show the prow buried in ice) I won't underestimate him again. Dig this ship out and follow them! (In the background, some soldiers are using controlled firebending to thaw out their compatriots frozen by Katara) As soon as you're done with that.

Aang: (while adjusting Appa's reins) Wait 'til you see it, Katara. The Air Temple is one of the most beautiful places in the world. That's why I'm so excited! I know, but I need to see it for myself. Wake up, Sokka! Air Temple here we come! Sokka! Wake up! (He begins to run the stick up and down Sokka's sleeping bag.) There's a prickle snake in your sleeping bag! (pokes his head out from behind Sokka.) Great! You're awake. Let's go. Oh, that was food? I used it to start the campfire last night. Sorry. The Batola mountain range! We're almost there! What about 'em? (close-up of Aang's face, which relaxes into hopeful optimism) Just because no one has seen an airbender doesn't mean the Fire Nation killed them all. (Cut to a front view of both, sitting up front.) They probably escaped. You don't understand, Katara. The only way to get to an airbender temple is on a flying bison, and I doubt the Fire Nation has any flying bison. Right, Appa? (voice-over) Yip yip!  There it is... the Southern Air Temple. (to Appa) We're home, buddy. We're home. So that's where my friends and I would play airball! And... over there would be where the bison would sleep... and...  This place used to be full of monks and lemurs and bison. Now there's just a bunch of weeds.  I can't believe how much things have changed. Hahaha! Aang seven, Sokka zero!  (approaching happily with the ball) Okay! What is it? Nice one. But enough practicing. We have a whole temple to see!  (calls from o.c.) Hey guys!  I want you to meet somebody. Monk Gyatso, the greatest airbender in the world. He taught me everything I know.  Hmm... This whole Avatar thing... maybe the monks made a mistake. (o.c.) But Gyatso, how do I know if I'm ready for this? (excitedly as he jumps up to turn and face Gyatso fully) Who is it? (smiling) All right. and  Yeah. (moves forward to go into the Temple)  (climbing the steps.) The Air Temple Sanctuary. There's someone I'm ready to meet.  It's not impossible. I survived in the iceberg for that long. Katara, whoever's in there might help me figure out this Avatar thing! The key, Sokka, is airbending. (calling inside) Hello? Anyone home?  (uncertain) I'm not sure, but it feels like I know them somehow. Look! (He points to a statue.) That one's an airbender! That's the Avatar cycle. Wow! There's so many! (dazed) Huh? That's Avatar Roku, the Avatar before me. I'm not sure... I just know it somehow. and  Lemur! Don't listen to him! You're going to be my new pet. (calling) Wait! Come back! Hey! Come back!  Come on out, little lemur. That hungry guy won't bother you anymore. (surprised) Firebenders? They were here? Gyatso...  (tired) I'm sorry. (sadly) But you were right. And if firebenders found this temple that means they found the other ones, too. I really am the last airbender.  (still looking at the statue) How is Roku supposed to help me if I can't talk to him? Looks like you made a new friend, Sokka. (as the lemur scurries up his chest to perch on his head.) Hey little guy. You, me, and Appa. (View switches to frontal shot of the three.) We're all that's left of this place. We have to stick together. Katara, Sokka...   (Camera switches to Katara and Sokka, the latter's mouth still full, a fruit in his hand.)  ... say hello to the newest member of our family.  (surprised as the lemur jumps off camera and returns a second later with a fruit.) Momo.
Katara: (cautious) Aang, I know you're excited, but it's been a hundred years since you've been home. It's just that a lot can change in all that time. (uneasy) Aang? Before we get to the temple, I want to talk to you about the airbenders. (close-up of Katara's face.) Well, I just want you to be prepared for what you might see. The Fire Nation is ruthless. They killed my mother and they could have done the same to your people. I know it's hard to accept. Aang, it's amazing! You're lucky enough to be one of the first outsiders to ever visit an airbender temple and all you can think about is food? (Camera cuts to follow them from above and behind.)  What's wrong? (seeing the helmet, accusingly) Fire Nation. (turning to call to Aang) Aang, there's something you need to see. (uncertainly) Uh... just a new waterbending move I learned. (walking away from him) I can for Aang's sake.  If he finds out that the Fire Nation invaded his home, he'll be devastated. (coming forward and placing a hand on Aang's shoulder.) You must miss him. Where are you going? But Aang... no one could have survived in there for a hundred years. Good point. Who are all these people? (pointing) And this one's a waterbender. They're lined up in a pattern. Air, water, earth and fire. Of course! They're Avatars. All these people are your past lives, Aang. It's true. When the Avatar dies he's reincarnated into the next nation in the cycle. Aang, snap out of it! Who is that? There's no writing. How do you know his name? (exasperated) You're making a sound! (worried) Aang! What happened? Oh no, it's his avatar spirit! He must have triggered it! I'm gonna try and calm him down. (shouting calmly) Aang, I know you're upset...  ... and I know how hard it is to lose the people you love. I went through the same thing when I lost my mom. Monk Gyatso and the other airbenders may be gone, but you still have a family. Sokka and I, we're your family now. It's okay. It wasn't your fault. Everything's packed. You ready to go? Maybe you'll find a way. What are you going to name him?
Sokka: Sleep now... temple later... (startled) Aaahhh! Get it off! Get it off! Aaahhh!  (annoyed) Hey, stomach, be quiet, all right? I'm trying to find us some food.  Hey! Who ate all my blubbered seal jerky? (incredulous) You WHAT? Awww, no wonder the flames smelled so good. So where do I get something to eat?  I'm just a simple guy with simple needs. So, uh, this airball game? How do you play?  (getting up painfully) Making him feel better is putting me in a world of hurt. Katara, check this out. We should tell him. You know, you can't protect him forever. Katara, firebenders were here. You can't pretend they weren't. Who's that? (Pops out from behind Aang eagerly.) And whoever's in there might have a medley of delicious, cured meats! I don't suppose you have a key? Statues?! That's it? Where's the meat?  (skeptical) Past lives? Katara, you really believe in that stuff? You were a firebender? No wonder I didn't trust you when we first met. (growls in frustration) You just couldn't get any weirder! (whispering) Firebender. Nobody make a sound. Shhhh! (whispering, ready with his weapon) That firebender won't know what hit 'em. (cut to Sokka, drooling) Dinner... Not if I get him first! I wanna eat you! Oof!  Hey! No Fair! (pulling back the curtain) Hey Aang, you find my dinner yet?  Aang, I wasn't really going to eat the lemur, okay? (He sees the skeleton and does a doubletake.) Oh, man... come on, Aang, everything will be all right. Let's get out of here. Aang! Come on, snap out of it! Aaahhh! He found out firebenders killed Gyatso. (Hanging onto the rubble, trying not to get blown away.) Well, do it before he blows us off the mountain!  (gently) Katara and I aren't going to let anything happen to you. Promise. (mouth full) Can't talk. Must eat.
Zuko: Uncle, I want the repairs made as quickly as possible. I don't want to stay too long and risk losing his trail. (turning on his uncle angrily) Don't mention his name on these docks! Once word gets out that he's alive every firebender will be out looking for him and I don't want anyone getting in the way. (with distaste) Captain Zhao. Yes... you wouldn't believe what happened. (He gives his uncle a sideways glance and immediately passes the buck.) Uncle! Tell Commander Zhao what happened. (uncomfortable) Uh, yes! Right into an Earth Kingdom ship. Sorry, but we have to go. (Cut to Zuko's upper body.) If my father thinks the rest of the world will follow him willingly, then he is a fool.  (cut to Zuko.) We haven't found him yet. (still looking away) No. Nothing. (defiantly) I haven't found anything. It's like you said. The Avatar probably died a long time ago. Come on, Uncle, we're going. I underestimated him once, but it will not happen again. (alarmed) Commander Zhao, I've been hunting the Avatar for two years and I... Why? Are you worried I'm going to try and stop you? (Zuko stands in defiance.) Don't underestimate me, Zhao. I will capture the Avatar before you.  You're wrong. Once I deliver the Avatar to my father he will welcome me home with honor and restore my rightful place on the throne. That's not true. (With a cry of indignation, launches himself to his feet, bringing his face within inches of Zhao's.) Maybe you'd like one to match! An agni kai. At sunset. I will never forget.  (standing up) I refuse to let him win.  Next time you get in my way, I promise I won't hold back. (quietly) Did you really mean that, Uncle?

Aang: (turning his head back to answer Sokka) Weeelll, I know it's near water... Momo, marbles please. (smiling eagerly and cupping the marble in his two hands) Hey Katara! Check out this airbending trick! (crushed that she did not notice) You didn't even look. But I'm not doing it now. Don't worry, Sokka. Where we're going, you won't need any pants! (shading his face and looking out over the water) But Appa's tired already, aren't you boy? I said, aren't you boy?  (gasps excitedly and points out towards the water) LOOK! (A giant koi fish jumps out of the water.) That's why we're here... (Aang strips down to his underwear.)... elephant koi. And I'm going to ride it. Katara, you've gotta watch me! (Aang dives into the water. A second later he leaps out again with a shocked expression on his face.) COLD! Yeeaaaah! Woohoo! (Aang is laughing, ecstatic as he rides the giant koi fish. A couple of other fish follow behind, leaping in and out of the water.  Aww, man... Aaahhh! I don't know. (thrown to the ground) Ugh! (apologetically) It's my fault. I'm sorry we came here. I wanted to ride the elephant koi. This island is named for Kyoshi? I know Kyoshi! I know her because I'm the Avatar. That's me! Now... check this out!  All right! Dessert for breakfast! (stuffing his face and talking with his mouth full) These people sure know how to treat an Avatar! Mmm... Katara you've got to try these! (Aang offers Katara a sweet)  (looking off screen) Sokka, what's your problem? EAT! But you're always hungry! What's he so angry about? It's great here. They're giving us the royal treatment. I'm sure we'll be fine. Besides, did you see how happy I'm making this town? (Aang turns around to look out the window at the two villagers working on Avatar Kyoshi's statue.) They're even cleaning up that statue in my honor! Come on, you know me better than that. I'm just a simple monk. There she is, girls. Me in a past life. Excuse me for a second, ladies. Actually, I can't right now. I promised the girls that I'd give them a ride on Appa. Why don't Well, neither does carrying your basket. I don't want to leave Kyoshi yet. I can't put my finger on it, but there's something I really like about this place. (calling back) Just a second, Koko! It didn't. You know what I think? You just don't want to come because you're jealous. Jealous that we're having so much fun without you. It is a little ridiculous, but I understand. (giggling and racing off) Hey Sokka! Nice dress! Katara, remember how the unagi almost got me yesterday? Well, I'm gonna go ride it now. It's gonna be REAL dangerous. (surprised) You're not going to stop me? (crossing his arms peevishly) I will. I know it's great. I'm glad you're glad. Fine! I'm sure it will be here any second! (He looks down at the water.) What about this? (Aang suspends and spins the marble between his two hands.)  Where're you going? Don't leave! (excitedly waving) Katara! You came! Back there you acted like you didn't care. Me too. I did let all that attention go to my head. I was being a jerk. (grinning widely as he begins to swim toward shore) On my way! (weakly) Katara... don't ride the unagi. Not fun. Hey! Over here! (upset) Look what I brought to this place.  Yes, it is. These people got their town destroyed trying to protect me. (hanging his head) I'll call Appa. Appa, yip yip! (clearly expecting a lecture from Katara) I know, I know. That was stupid and dangerous.
Katara: (absentmindedly) That's great, Aang. (stops her sewing and looks at him) That's great! What does me being a girl have to do with sewing? (with exaggerated happiness) All done with your pants! And look what a great job I did! He's right. At this rate we won't get to the North Pole until spring. (waving) Woo! He looks pretty good out there. (Katara turns to see look at something happening off screen.) No, Appa! Don't eat that! (Katara hurries off screen as Sokka continues to watch Aang.)  What's wrong? (screams) Get out of there! AANG! What was that thing? (thrown to the ground) Uhh... (quickly) No, don't hurt him! He didn't mean it. My brother is just an idiot sometimes. (tersely) Aang... do some airbending... Well, maybe just a bite... (She takes the candy from Aang as Momo seizes the opportunity and snatches another from his other hand.)  He's just upset because a bunch of girls kicked his butt yesterday. (smugly) Right. And then they kicked your butt. Hey, don't get too comfortable. It's risky for us to stay in one place for very long. Well, it's nice to see you excited about being the Avatar. I just hope it doesn't all go to your head. (turning around) Oh, good! Can you help me carry this back to the room? It's a little heavy. (irritated) What do you mean you can't? (continuing to pick up vegetables) Watching you show off for a bunch of girls does not sound like fun. It's not my basket. These supplies are for our trip. I told you, we have to leave Kyoshi soon. (flatly) Aangy... 'Simple monk,' huh? I thought you promised me that this Avatar stuff wouldn't go to your head. Jealous? Of what? (ferociously putting vegetables into her basket) That's ridiculous. (without looking up from her bowl) Yeah. (still not looking up from her bowl) Good for you. (still not looking up) Nope. Have fun. Great. I'm glad you know. Good! I wanted to make sure you were safe. You really had me worried. I'm sorry. (affectionately) Well, get out of the water before you catch a cold, you big jerk! (calling from the shore) Hang on, Aang! Zuko! Wake up, Aang!  Get inside. It's not your fault. Then let's get out of here. Zuko will leave Kyoshi to follow us. I know it feels wrong to run, but I think it's the only way. I know it's hard, but you did the right thing. Zuko would have destroyed the whole place if we had stayed. They're going to be okay, Aang.  (as he dives off) What are you doing?! Yes, it was.
Sokka: You have no idea where you're going, do you? (flatly) I guess we're getting close then. (waves his arm dismissively in Aang and Katara's direction) Stop bugging her, airhead. You need to give girls space when they do their sewing. Simple girls are better at fixing pants than guys, and guys are better at hunting and fighting and stuff like that. It's just the natural order of things. Wait! I was just kidding! I can't wear these! (He sticks his arm through the big hole in the seat of his pants.) Katara, PLEASE! We just made a pit stop yesterday. Shouldn't we get a little more flying done before we camp out? Yeah, that was real convincing. Still, hard to argue with a ten ton magical monster. Are you kidding? The fish is doing all the work. (yells) There's something in the water! Aang's in trouble. (yells) Aang! Come back here! AANG! (getting up and wiping his hands together) Well, let's not stick around and find out. Time to hit the road. (thrown to the ground) Oof... Or we could stay a while... (close-up of his angry face) Show yourselves, cowards! (straining at his bonds) Who are you? Where are the men who ambushed us? (in laughing disbelief) Wait a second, there's no way that a bunch of girls took us down. Not hungry. They snuck up on me! (getting up angrily) Sneak attacks don't count! (pacing around the room, gesticulating wildly to the air) Tie me up with ropes! I'll show them a thing or two. I'm not scared of any girls. (He has paced around to the breakfast table and is ferociously grabbing sweets off it. He begins to lower his voice and talk to himself.) Who do they think they are anyway? (Sokka grunts and shoves a sweet into his mouth. He walks off camera and out of the room.) Mmm... this is tasty. (in a bit of an arrogant manner) Sorry ladies! Didn't mean to interrupt your dance lesson. (He stretches his arms and waist.) I was just looking for somewhere to get a little workout? (He bends over and grabs his knees with his hands.)  (flippantly) It's all right. I mean, normally I'd hold a grudge, but seeing as you guys are a bunch of girls, I'll make an exception. (He rotates his shoulders.)  True. But don't feel bad. After all, I'm the best warrior in my village. Oh... well... I mean... I... Well, if that's what you want, I'd be happy to. All right, you stand over there. (He grasps her shoulders and pushes her back a little, but Suki doesn't move. He doesn't seem to notice or care.) This may be a little tough, but try to block me. (rubbing his shoulder) Heh heh... good. Of course, I was going easy on you. Let's see if you can handle this! (angrily) That does it! (hesitantly) Uh... hey, Suki. No... I... well, let me explain. (kneeling in humility) I would be honored if you would teach me. (quietly) I'm sorry if I insulted you earlier. I was wrong. Please make an exception. I won't let you down. (quickly) Of course! Do I really have to wear this? It feels a little... girly. (standing proudly) Bravery and honor. (slightly losing his balance) I think I'm starting to get it. (crossing his arms in a "so there" manner) Hmm... (laughing and pointing his finger at her) I got you! Admit I got you!  Hey, I'm not a... oh, whatever! I guess training's over. What about, "I'm sorry"? I treated you like a girl when I should have treated you like a warrior.
Zuko: (in a dangerously silky voice) The only reason you should be interrupting me is if you have news about the Avatar.  (calmly) Uncle, you taught me that keeping a level head is a sign of a great leader. Now whatever you have to say, I'm sure that I can take it.  (enraged) WHAT?! (snatching the map from Iroh's hand) Give me the map! How am I gonna find him, Uncle?  He is clearly a master of evasive maneuvering. (standing up and speaking angrily) The Avatar's on Kyoshi Island? (Zuko walks out of the room while speaking to Iroh.) Uncle, ready the rhinos. He's not getting away from me this time. I was going to save it for later! (He storms off screen with his meal.)  I want the Avatar alive. Come out, Avatar! You can't hide from me forever! (to his men) Find him. Nice try, Avatar! But these little girls can't save you. Finally! (to his men) Back to the ship! Don't lose sight of them!

Aang: The Earth Kingdom city of Omashu! I used to always come here to visit my friend, Bumi. Well, let's go slow pokes! The real fun is inside the city! So, what am I supposed to do? Grow a mustache? Ohh, this is so itchy! (To Appa) How do you live in this stuff? (Appa grunts at him in response.)  (picking up his staff and using a fake, old man voice) Now let's get to skippin', young whippersnappers! The big city awaits. You guys are gonna love Omashu. The people here are the friendliest in the world. Just keep smiling... My business is my business, young man, and none of yours! I've got half a mind to bend you over my knee and paddle your backside! Name's Bonzu Pipinpadaloxicopolis, the Third, and these are my grandkids. Good idea!  This is the Omashu delivery system. Miles and miles of tubes and chutes. Earthbending brings the packages up and gravity brings them down. (Cut back to the group.)  They do get their mail on time, but my friend Bumi found a better use for these chutes... Umm... the mail system? A package sending system? Bumi, you're a mad genius! One ride, then we're off to the North Pole, Airbender's honor. I'm on it! I'm on it! Yeh! Good idea! That'll make us go even faster! Sorry! (sheepishly) Two cabbages please. Huh? Thanks, but I don't eat meat. I'm from... Kangaroo Island. Okay! You caught me. I'm the Avatar, doing my Avatar thing, keeping the world safe. Everything checks out (looks under the table), no firebenders here. So, good work everybody. (Puts his arms around his companions and together they stand.) Love each other, respect all life and don't run with your spears. We'll see you next time! He did say it was newly refurbished. I wonder what these challenges are gonna be. (smiling and pointing o.c.) The air vents! We can't, but Momo can. Momo, I need you to find Appa and bust us outta here! Go on, boy, get Appa! (from o.c., as Momo tries to free himself, but fails) Appa is a ten ton flying bison, I think he could figure something out. Sokka! Katara! (Turning to guards) Where are my friends? And if I fail? I... guess it's fine. Really? I don't have time for your crazy games! Gimme my friends back! We're leaving! (to King Bumi) I'll do as you want. There, enjoy your lunch! I want my friends back, now! Okay, found him! Come here, Flopsy! Flopsy, wait! Flopsy! Flopsy! (to monster) Flopsy? Flopsy!  Guys, are you ok? (looking severe) Come on. I'm ready for the next challenge. (thinking) So, you're saying whoever I point to, that's the person I get to fight? I... choose... you! (He is pointing at King Bumi.)  Can I fight the guy with the axe instead? Huh? That's not fair! You said you would release my friends if I finished your tests. How am I supposed to know his name? Yeh? Okay, so back to the challenges. I got a key from the waterfall. I saved his pet and I had a duel. Well, everything was different than I expected. Well, they weren't straightforward. To solve each test, I had to think differently than I usually would. (Realization sweeping his features.) I know his name! I solved the question the same way I solved the challenges. As you said a long time ago, I had to open my brain to the possibilities. (Cut King Bumi, who begins to laugh and snort, just as the younger version had in the flashback.) Bumi, you're a mad genius! (He runs and hugs the old King.)  Thank you for your wisdom. But before we leave, I have a challenge for you!
Katara: Wow. We don't have cities like this in the South Pole. Wait, Aang! It could be dangerous if people find out you're the Avatar. Technically, Aang is 112 years old. (now smiling serenely) Hi, June Pipinpadaloxicopolis. Nice to meet you. We will. This sounded like fun at first, but now that I'm here, I'm starting to have second thoughts! Aang, do something! Use your airbending! (to Aang) Is it just me, or is this guy's crown a little crooked?  You can't keep us here. Let us leave. This is a prison cell? But it's so nice. We're not sticking around to find out. There's gotta be some way outta here. Well, no point in arguing about it now. (She gets in a bed.) Get some rest, Aang. Looks like you'll need it for tomorrow. Other than the crystal slowly encasing my entire body, doing great. Think about the challenges, maybe it's some kind of riddle. We're gonna keep trying, but that is a good backup. And what did you learn? (a piece of crystal growing into her cheek) And...? Uh, over here! So this crazy king is your old friend, Bumi?
Sokka: (in amazement) They have buildings here that don't melt! You need a disguise. Great! Now you look just like my grandfather. Great, so they get their mail on time. (chewing) Mmm! What? It was pretty funny. We're in serious trouble. This guy is nuts. Nice or not, we're still prisoners. If you think we're gonna fit through there then you're crazier then that king. Eh, how was Appa supposed to save us anyway? Ah! It's already creeping! Oh come on! I got it! He's an earthbender, right? Rocky! (Silence, followed by a cough in the background.) You know, because of all the rocks? Little help? Why did you do all this instead of just telling Aang who you were?

Aang: Great, you're back! What's for dinner? It's coming from over there! Let's go meet him! Nice to meet you! Hey, that guy's gotta be running somewhere, maybe we're near a village and I bet that village has a market! Great hat. I'll trade you some nuts for it. No she doesn't, we saw you earthbending. Thanks. I'll make sure Appa doesn't eat all your hay. You must have really inspired him. What? ...and why would they do that? Sure, I got it. Yeh, yeh, just relax. You're taking all the fun out of this. Exactly! That's fun stuff. Katara, what's wrong? Maybe she's right. What do you say, Sokka? I wish I knew how to make a hurricane. (Cut to Katara and Sokka looking unhappy at this idea.) The Warden would run away and we'd steal his keys! I'm just tossing ideas around. (looking up and pointing o.c.) No, it's not. Look at the smoke. I bet they're burning coal – In other words, earth. Guys, throw me some coal!
Katara: Seriously, what else ya got? An earthbender! Hello there, I'm Katara! What's your name? We just wanted to say “hi”. (excited) Which means no nuts for dinner! (Aang and Katara run o.c.)  Hey! Hey, you're that kid! Why did you run away before? But, Haru's an earthbender, he can help. How can you say that? Haru has a gift. Asking him not to earthbend is like asking me not to waterbend. It's a part of who we are. I understand that Haru can help you fight back. What can the Fire Nation do to you that they haven't done already? I'm sorry about what I said earlier. I didn't know about your father. thanks. He sounds like a great man. So, that's why you hide your earthbending? See this necklace? My mother gave it to me. I lost my mother in a Fire Nation raid. This necklace is all I have left of her. No. (struggling) It's not working, we have to get help. Haru, there's a way you can help him. Please, there's no one around to see you, it's the only way. Haru, you did it! It was so brave of Haru to use his earthbending to help that old man. I guess so. Dawn? Can't we sleep in for once? (with a sly grin on her face) I'd rather eat fireballs than nuts. They took him! They took Haru away! The old man turned him in to the Fire Nation. It's all my fault, I forced him into earthbending. Haru's mother said they came for him at midnight. We don't need to track him. The Fire Nation is going to take me right to Haru. (determined) because they're going to arrest me for earthbending. Aang. Did you get all that? (also in a slightly exaggerated voice) How dare you call me “pipsqueak” you giant-eared cretin! A giant-eared cretin! Look at those things. (She puts her hands up to her ears and fans out her fingers in imitation of huge ears) Do herds of animals use them for shade? I will not back off! I bet elephants get together and make fun of how large your ears are! I'll show you who's boss – earthbending style! I said, “earthbending style!” (running and hugging him) Haru! It's my fault you were captured. I came to rescue you. It was the only way to find you. (bowing) It's an honor to meet you. (taking the bowl her hungry expression turns to disgust) Eruhh! (sitting down and eating a spoonful) Erahh! If you don't mind me asking, what's your escape plan? You know, the plan to get everyone off the rig? What is it? Mutiny? Sabotage? How can you say that? You sound like you've already given up. (standing up, grim determination on her face) We'll see about that. Earthbenders! You don't know me, but I know of you. Every child of my water tribe village was rocked to sleep with stories of the brave Earth Kingdom and the courageous earthbenders who guard its borders. (Cut to a view of the Warden watching from one of the catwalks above, Katara continues from o.c.) Some of you may think that the Fire Nation has made you powerless. Yes, they have taken away your ability to bend, but they can't take away your courage and it is your courage they should truly fear! Because it runs deeper than any mine you've been forced to dig, any ocean that keeps you far from home. It is the strength of your hearts that make you who you are, hearts that will remain unbroken when all rock and stone has eroded away. The time to fight back is now! I can tell you the Avatar has returned! So remember your courage, earthbenders, let us fight for our freedom! I can't. (close up, the lighthouse lamp playing directly behind her head) I'm not leaving. I'm not giving up on these people. We can't abandon these people. There has to be a way to help them. I tired talking the earthbenders into fighting back, but it didn't work. If there was just a way to help them help themselves. (touching the rig platform) But this entire place is made of metal. It's almost dawn, we're running out of time! Are you sure this is gonna work? Here's your chance, earthbenders! (She grabs a lump of coal and raises it high.) Take it! Your fate is in your own hands! (embarrassed) All it took was a little coal. So, I guess you're going home now? I can't. Your mission is to take back your home. Ours is to get Aang to the North Pole. I know. (She reaches for her necklace and starts in surprise when it is gone.) My mother's necklace! It's gone!
Sokka: We've got a few options. First, round nuts and some kind of oval shaped nuts, and some rock shaped nuts that... might just be rocks. Dig in! What was that!? Shouldn't we run away from huge booms – not toward them? He looks dangerous, so we better approach cautiously. Hey! I worked hard to get those nuts! (Momo flies off-screen to join the others, Sokka looks downcast) Yeh, I hate'em too. Fire Nation! Act natural! Nice guy. How long has the Fire Nation been here? Everyone should get some sleep. We're leaving at dawn. Absolutely not! This village is crawling with Fire Nation troops. If they discover you're here, Aang, we'll be eating fireballs for breakfast. Good night. Good night. Slow down, Katara, when did this happen? (dropping her hand) Then it's too late to track him, he's long gone. I thought you were crazy at first, Katara, but this might work. There are ventilation shafts throughout these mines, all Aang has to do is send an air current from that vent to this one right here. The boulder levitates and – tada! Fake earthbending. Do you remember your cue? By “this” do you mean intentionally getting captured by an army of ruthless firebenders? Here they come! Get in your places! (in a slightly exaggerated voice) Get out of my way, pipsqueak! What did you call me? You better back off! (Placing his hand to partially block his mouth from the soldier's view) Seriously – back off. That's it – you're going down! No, you idiot! It's the girl! (in an exaggerated voice, his hands on Katara's shoulders) I'll hold her! (Then sotto voce) You've got 12 hours to find Haru, we'll be right behind you. Momo, you have some big ears! She'll be fine, Aang, Katara knows what she's doing. Your 12 hours are up, where's Haru? We've got to get out of here. We don't have much time, there are guards everywhere. Get on. What do you mean you're not leaving!? I say you're both crazy! (A searchlight comes close by and they hunker down until it passes.) Last chance, we need to leave – now! (shaking his head) I hate when you get like this. (Another search light comes close). Come on, we better hide. We don't have much time. What are we gonna do? Wouldn't he just take his keys with him? For that they'd need some kind of earth, or some rock... something they can bend. It should. These vents reminded me of our little trick back at the village. We're gonna do the same thing, but on a much bigger scale.  There's a huge deposit of coal at the base of the silo, and the whole system is ventilated. Aang closed off all the vents except one. When he does his airbending, the coal only has one place to go – right back here. (drawing his boomerang) Stay back, I'm warning you!

Aang: I'll try it! Yehhhh! Turns out clouds are made of water! Why would anyone do this? How could I let this happen? Yes it does. It's the Avatar's job to protect nature. But, I don't know how to do my job. Yeh, a waterbending teacher, but there's no one who can teach me how to be the Avatar. Monk Gyatso said that Avatar Roku would help me. I don't know. No. Ow! Hey, how was that cheering me up? (smiling) Thanks, Katara. (bows) Nice to meet you too. (Pause). So...is there something I can help you with? So, what do you want me to do exactly? (clearly lacking confidence) Right...that's me. Yeh, that might be because I don't know anything at all about the spirit world. (Exasperated) It's not like there's someone to teach me this stuff! I have to try, don't I? Maybe whatever I have to do will just... come to me. Hello? Spirit, can you hear me? This is the Avatar speaking. I'm... here to try to help stuff. (shouting) The sun has set. Where are you, Hei-Bai? Well, spirit, uh, I hereby ask you to please leave this village in peace!  Okay. Well, I guess that's settled then. You must be the Hei-Bai spirit. (He bows his head.) My name is... My name is Aang! I'm the Avatar and I would like to help! Hey, wait up! Uh... Please, would you stop destroying things and listen?  I'm just trying to do my job as spirit bridge. Excuse me, would you please turn around? I command you to turn around now! Sokka, go back! I don't wanna fight him unless I – huh! Hang on, Sokka! Sokka! (He looks around and the view zooms out a bit.) I failed. Katara, Katara I lost him. What? No, I'm right here! Grrr!!! I'm in the spirit world! (smiling) I'll figure this out, Katara, I promise. Like they said, I'm the bridge between the worlds, right? All I have to do is... figure out what I have to do. But once I do that, no problem! Appa! Hey buddy, I'm right here. But, I guess you can't see me either. What am I supposed to do? (shouting) Avatar Roku, how can I talk to you? Sokka? That's definitely not Sokka! What? I can't airbend in the spirit world! You don't know where Sokka is, do you? You're Avatar Roku's animal guide! Like Appa is to me. I need to save my friend and I don't know how. Is there some way for me to talk to Roku? I'll be back Katara. (To the dragon) Take me to Roku! Hey, what are you doing!? Ahhhh!!!  I don't understand. This is just a statue of Roku. Is that what Roku wants to talk to me about? A comet? When can I talk to him? It's a calendar, and the light will reach Roku on the solstice! (Turning to dragon) So, that's when I'll be able to speak to Roku? (The dragon grunts.) But I can't wait that long. I need to save Sokka now. (downcast) I'm not sure.  You're the spirit of this forest. Now I understand. You're upset and angry because your home was burned down. When I saw the forest had burned I was sad and upset. But my friend gave me hope that the forest would grow back. Actually, I did have a little help. And there's something else.  I need to talk to Roku and I think I've found a way to contact his spirit. There's a temple on a crescent shaped island, and if I go there on the solstice I'll be able to speak with him. Yeh, and there's one more problem. The island is in the Fire Nation.
Katara: (from o.c. at first) Those clouds look so soft, don't they? Like you could just jump down and you'd land in a big, soft cottony heap. You're hilarious. Hey, what is that? Aang, are you ok? Shh! Aang, you didn't let this happen. It has nothing to do with you. That's why we're going to the North Pole to find you a teacher.  Hey Aang, are you ready to be cheered up? These acorns are everywhere, Aang. That means the forest will grow back. Every one of these will be a tall oak tree someday, and all the birds and animals that lived here will come back.  What happens then? Hey, ‘great bridge guy', can I talk to you over here for a second? Aang, you seem a little unsure about all this. So, can you help these people? I think you can do it, Aang. Aang will figure out the right thing to do, Sokka. Sokka wait! Sokka! I know. (holding Sokka's boomerang and trying to sound hopeful) Everything's gonna be okay. It's ok, Appa. I'm sure they're on their way back. I bet they even found you a bunch of moon peaches for a treat. It's no use, Appa. I don't see them anywhere. Our best hope is to go back to the village and wait. You're back! Where's Sokka? Aang, what are you doing? Run! Sokka! You were trapped in the Spirit world for 24 hours. How are you feeling? (angrily elbowing her brother) Sokka! I'm so proud of you, Aang. You figured out what to do all on your own. That's great! But, the solstice is tomorrow.
Sokka: Maybe you should give it a try. It's like a scar. Listen, it's so quiet. There's no life anywhere. Fire Nation! Those evil savages make me sick! They have no respect for –  (whispering) What? I'm not allowed to be angry? The Avatar before you? He died over a hundred years ago, how are you supposed to talk to him? Hehe, cheered me up. Ow! Yeh, I probably deserved that. Hey, who are you? Why is it attacking you? Yehhh, we're all gonna get eaten by a spirit monster. This isn't right. We can't sit here and cower while Aang waits for some monster to show up. He still shouldn't have to face this alone. It doesn't seem too interested in what he's saying. Maybe we should go help him? That's it! He needs help! (He exits to his left.)  Hei-Bai! Over here! We'll fight him together, Aang. Aang, over here! Help! What happened? (looking pained) Like I seriously need to use the bathroom! You could give us some supplies and some money. What? We need stuff. What is it? Creepy, but great.
Zuko: (yelling) Uncle! It's time to leave! Where are you? Uncle Iroh! Uncle? We need to move on, we're closing in on the Avatar's trail and I don't want to lose him! (angry) My troubles cannot be soaked away. It's time to go! Enough! We need to leave now! Get out of the water! On second thought, why don't you take another few minutes, but be back at the ship in half an hour or I'm leaving without you. Uncle! Uncle, where are you? Something's not right here. (He examines the hot tub, now with the stone projectiles embedded in it.) That pile of rocks... Land doesn't slide uphill. Those rocks didn't move naturally. My uncle's been captured by earthbenders! Yup, that's Uncle Iroh. The Avatar! You taught me well. Now would you please put on some clothes!

Aang: (groaning and pulling on the reins) Let's go Appa! Come on, boy! Look, I'm sorry, but Katara and Sokka aren't coming to the Fire Nation with us. If they got hurt, I'd never forgive myself. (angrily) So get your big butt off the ground and let's go! But I have to talk to Avatar Roku to find out what my vision means. I need to get to the Fire Temple before the sun sets on the Solstice. That's today.  Thank you, for your... Come on, boy! We've got a long way to go! Faster!  I'm on it!  (holding his nose) Yeah, but there's just one little problem. If we fly north we can go around the Fire Nation ships and avoid the blockade. It's the only way. This is exactly why I didn't want you to come. Its too dangerous. Appa! Yip! Yip! Appa! Are you ok? We made it!!! There it is! The island Roku's dragon took me to! You did it buddy. Nice flying. Its almost sundown. We'd better hurry. Great! I am the Avatar. I'll hold them off. Run! Follow me! Nope! (Aang disappears around the corner. Sokka, Katara and Momo begin to follow him. Suddenly, Aang comes running back around the corner. A Fire Sage is hard on his heels.) Wrong way! (surprised and relaxing his poise) You do? How? Did you know Avatar Roku? Is that how you knew I was coming? If this is the Avatar's temple, why did the Sages attack me? (pausing and leaning against the tunnel wall) They were waiting for me. (bowing slightly to Shyu) Thank you for helping me. Shyu, what's wrong? Definitely. They're still locked. Why won't it open! Aargh! (hanging his head) I'm sorry I put you through all this for nothing. Wait, how is Sokka genius? His plan didn't even work. Did the definition of “genius” change in the last hundred years?  (standing up) The light hits the statue and I talk to Roku. So why isn't anything happening? Why isn't anything happening? I don't know what I'm doing! All I know is airbending! Please, Avatar Roku, talk to me! Is it about that vision? The one with the comet? What does it mean? So the comet made them stronger? But that happened a hundred years ago. What does the comet have to do with the war now?  But I haven't even started learning waterbending, not to mention earth and fire. What if I can't master all the elements in time? What if I fail? But I won't be able to come back to the temple. What if I have questions? How will I talk to you?  I'm ready. Thanks. Where's Shyu?
Katara: Please don't go, Aang. The world can't afford to lose you to the Fire Nation. Neither can I. We're not letting you go into the Fire Nation, Aang. Aang, we got trouble. Fire ball! (covering her nose with her hand) We have to get out of Zuko's range before he shoots another hot stinker at us! There's no time. And that's exactly why we're here.(to Appa) Oh! You must be tired! (turns towards Sokka a wry look on her face) I was talking to Appa. The Fire Nation must have abandoned the temple when Avatar Roku died. That's when we were at the Air Temple. (stroking his ears as he chitters) I'm sorry Momo. (angrily again) No more apologies! (whispering) Shh! Momo, go back to sleep. (frustrated) Shoot! Come on water, work with me here! Okay, Katara, shift your weight through the stances...(the stream collapses)...ugh! No, let go of me! Go jump in the river! My mother's necklace! How did you get that? No! Aang, this is all my fault. Yeah, I did. I'm glad he cooled off. He's so stubborn sometimes. ...I've never used bending on water I can't see. I don't know... When we're done we'll meet you over there. Let's catch up with Jet at the reservoir. Well, we finished early--I'm sure he'll be happy to see us. ...What are they doing? Why would they need blasting jelly? What? No--that would destroy the town. Jet wouldn't do that. (less convinced) Jet wouldn't do that. Jet—why? This isn't the answer! Where's Sokka? Why, Jet? I can't believe I trusted you. There was no stealing and no putting anyone in prison. Just a game.  Nope, just a regular ball. That's what the game was called, Redemption. (releasing suppressed exasperation) Exactly! Finally, someone gets it. Would I!? (munching, barely paying attention) Mm hmm! (still munching) Mmmm! That's just terrible. (Pointing to her leg of meat) You gonna finish that? Yeh, Katara, what are you talking about? We Jin didn't steal the orb, he was returning it to their village gate and was wrongfully punished by the Gan Jin. (drawing out his boomerang) We barely survived one! (looking chagrined) Me too. I only took their side because they fed me. That's some luck you knew Jin Wei and Wei Jin. What!?

Aang: I need you too. Be careful guys! Guys? Gyatso? I didn't mean to. It's nothing, I just had a bad dream. Go back to sleep. I'm okay. I think I just need some rest. Look at those clear skies, buddy! Should be some smooth flying. I think it's true, Katara, swishing means it's ripe. (to Katara and Sokka) Maybe we should find some shelter? Sokka, maybe this isn't such a good idea. Look at the sky. I'm sorry for running away. Actually, he wasn't. I don't wanna talk about it. Well, it's kind of a long story. I'll never forget the day the monks told me I was the Avatar. I was playing with some other kids just outside the south wall. I was trying to teach them how to do the air scooter... First, you form a ball. Then you gotta get on quick. Quick, get on! (dismounting his own scooter) You kinda have to balance on it like it's a top. (He twirls his finger to demonstrate.)  I made it up. How do you know it's me? Those were some of my favorite toys when I was little! (He picks up the propeller toy.)  I just chose them because they seemed fun.  Well, I didn't know how to feel about it. All I knew is that after I found out, everything began changing... Hey, not bad! You guys have been practicing! Great! (dismayed) What's going on? (trying to smile) But I'm still the same – nothing's changed. So, what, I can't play? (dismounting his scooter) Oh, ok. What do you mean? (pointing at the board) Hey! Then, just when I was starting to feel better, something worse happened. How could they do that to me! They wanted to take away everything I knew and everyone I loved! (his glow fading) I'm sorry I got so mad.  Well, that's not exactly what happened... (from o.c., narrating from the present) I was afraid and confused. I didn't know what to do. I never saw Gyatso again. Next thing I knew, I was waking up in your arms after you found me in the iceberg. (looking up at Katara) And then the Fire Nation attacked our temple. My people needed me and I wasn't there to help. The world needed me and I wasn't there to help. The fisherman was right! I did turn my back on the world. You don't know that.  (standing, resolute) I'm going to find them. (to the old woman) We'll be back soon, I promise. Come on, Appa! (pointing to the horizon) The boat! It's there! Hang on to the rope! He doesn't have to apologize. Actually, I don't eat meat. Katara, I think you were right before. I'm done dwelling on the past.  I can't make guesses about how things would have turned out if I hadn't run away. I'm here now and I'm going to make the most of it.
Katara: We need you, Aang. Are you all right, Aang? You seem to be having a lot of nightmares lately, you wanna tell me about it? (examining empty food bag) Well, we better smoothly fly ourselves to a market, cause we're out of food. What happened in your dream? I don't know if I like the sound of that swishing. (putting fruit back) I just realized we're out of money anyway. You could get a job, smart guy. (smiling, hands on hips) That's right. (coming to Aang's side, angry) Don't yell at him! Aang would never turn his back on anyone! Aang is the bravest person I know! He has done nothing but help people and save lives since I met him. It's not his fault he disappeared, right Aang? Aang? What's wrong? You're a horrible old man! (mounting Appa) Appa, yip! Yip! It's ok. That fisherman was way out of line. What do you mean? It has to do with your dream, doesn't it? Talk to me. I'm gonna try to get a little fire going. So you were upset that you were the Avatar? Why wouldn't you be excited about it? That's awful, Aang. I don't know what to say. Whoa! Hot cinders! You have a right to be angry after the monks sent you away like that. You ran away. You don't know what would've – Aang... You're being too hard on yourself. Even if you did run away, I think it was meant to be. If you had stayed you would have been killed along with all the other airbenders. I know it's meant to be this way. The world needs you now. You give people hope. (rushing to her side) It's ok, you're safe. What do you mean? Where's Sokka? I'm going with you. Where are they? (smiling) I don't think you're gonna have those nightmares anymore.
Sokka: (groggily) Huh? Uh... what's going on? Did we get captured again? Don't have to tell me twice. (sits up, excited) You guys want to hear about my dream? (Silence, as Katara looks annoyed.) That's ok, I didn't wanna talk about it anyway. (alarmed) Guys, wait, this was in my dream, we shouldn't go to the market. Food eats people!  Also, Momo could talk. (To Momo.) You said some very unkind things. (depressed) Out of food and out of money, now what are we supposed to do? Are you kidding? Shelter from what? (running up to them) I'll go! (to his friends) What? You said ‘get a job' and he's paying double. I said I was gonna do this job. I can't back out just because of some bad weather. Hey, they left without saying goodbye! I know! This one time I was... I'm too young to die! (holding out his hand) Seriously, you're still gonna pay me, right? Do you hear that? It's stopped raining.
Zuko: (lowering the telescope) You're out of your mind, Uncle. The weather's perfect. There is not a cloud in sight. We know the Avatar is traveling northward, so we will do the same. The safety of the crew doesn't matter!  Finding the Avatar is far more important than any individual's safety.  (crossing to the Lieutenant) Lieutenant, you'd better learn some respect, (pointing at his chest with two fingers) or I will teach it to you. (to Iroh) I don't need your help keeping order on my ship. (in a higher voice than we are used to) Let me in! (Iroh appears from the left, putting his hands on the young man's shoulders.)  I want to go into the war chamber, but the guard won't let me pass!  If I'm gonna rule this nation one day, don't you think I need to start learning as much as I can? (bowing to Iroh) Thank you uncle! (jumping up) You can't sacrifice an entire division like that! Those soldiers love and defend our nation! How can you betray them? Please, father, I only had the fire nation's best interest at heart! I'm sorry I spoke out of turn! (stricken, abasing himself on the floor) I meant you no disrespect. I am your loyal son. I won't fight you. Where were we hit? The helmsman! The Avatar! (pausing to consider) Let him go. We need to get this ship to safety. Uncle, I am sorry.

Aang: (walking over) How's Sokka doing? I couldn't find any ginger root for the tea, but I found a map. There's an herbalist institute on the top of that mountain. We could probably find a cure for Sokka there. Not you too! That's how Sokka started yesterday. Now look at him – he thinks he's an earthbender! A few more hours and you'll be talking nonsense too. (Getting up and grabbing his staff.) I'm going to find some medicine. Uh, maybe it's safer if I go on foot. (Cut back to Appa et al, Aang continues from o.c.) Keep an eye on'em guys. (speaking very fast) Hello! I'm sorry to barge in like this, but I need some medicine for my friends. They have fevers and they've been coughing and – That's nice. That's nice. Are you almost done? Finally! Thanks for all your help! (looking frightened and abashed) Taking the cure to my friends! What about my friends? What am I supposed to do with frozen frogs? (shocked) Suck on them!? You're insane aren't you? Uhh, I think you dropped this. A frog! I've never hidden from you. Untie me and I'll fight you right now! What? No! Don't leave frogs! My friends are sick and they need you! Please go back to being frozen! Who are you? What's going on? Are you here to rescue me? (The Blue Spirit opens the door and motions for him to follow.) I'll take that as a "yes." My frogs! Come back! And stop thawing out! (The Blue Spirit comes back, picks him up by the collar and carries him out. He continues from o.c.) Wait! My friends need to suck on those frogs! Stay close to me! Here, take this. Jump on my back! Gimme the next one! (from o.c. at first) You know what the worst part about being born over a hundred years ago is? I miss all the friends I used to hang out with. Before the war started (cut to Aang still looking down at the ground), I used to always my friend Kuzon. The two of us, we'd get in and out of so much trouble together. He was one of the best friends I ever had (he turns to face Zuko) – and he was from the Fire Nation, just like you. (Cut back to Zuko still looking at Aang.) If we knew each other back then (cut back to Aang), do you think we could have been friends too? Suck on these. They'll make you feel better. No, I don't think I did.
Katara: This should bring your fever down. That's nice. I'll tell him. Not so good. Being out in that storm really did a number on him.  Aang, he's in no condition to travel. Sokka just needs more rest. I'm sure he'll be better by tomorrow. Relax, it was just a little cough. I'm fine – Listen carefully, Momo. I need you to take this to the river and fill it with water. Got it? Momo should be back any minute. Ugh! No, Momo, water. Wa-ter! (Momo's ear go straight u. He then jumps off her and scampers o.c.) Aang, what in the world is taking you so long? (with a weak, sickly voice) How many times do I have to tell you, Momo, we need water. Wa-ter. Oh forget it. Aang, please, hurry.
Sokka: (feverishly) You know what I love about Appa the most? His sense of humor. Haha! Classic Appa. (swinging at something that isn't there) Take that, you rock! (deliriously) Haha! You guys are killin' me! Katara... please... water... Water... (delirious) Who's this "Aang" kid you keep talking about, Your Highness? (speech impaired by the amphibian oral obstruction) Aang, how was your trip? Did you make any new friends? Mmmm! This is tasty! Mmm!
Zuko: What do they want? (sullenly) I've got nothing to report to Zhao. Now get off my ship and let us pass. (angrily) Off my ship! I don't care what they do. (Looks away out to sea.)  (turning back, desperation and fear on his face) How, Uncle? With Zhao's resources it's just a matter of time before he captures the Avatar. (Turns back out to sea and whispers) My honor, my throne, my country, I'm about to lose them all. (walking away) I'm going to bed. No disturbances.

Aang: Oh, I didn't think you would need it, Sokka. (Holds up a necklace.)  Not tangled – woven. (Airbending himself to a standing position and turning to Katara.) I made you a necklace, Katara. (Looking from side to side in an embarrassed fashion) I thought since you lost your other one... I don't see why I can't do both. (Katara puts necklace on in the background.)  You mean all of you or just your neck? I mean, uh, both look great. (rubbing his head in an embarrassed gesture) I...well... (clearly put down) Thanks. Someone's being attacked by a platypus bear! Make noise, it'll run off! And then run in zigzags! Whoa there! Aunt who? What do ya know, an umbrella! Not everyone has the gift, Sokka. (rubbing his nose) Hello. Aang. (confused) I... guess... Likewise. (earnestly) Good luck with that! (pushing puffs away) I'm good on puffs. So...what do you think they're talking about back there? (growing more alarmed at each of Sokka's pronouncements) Yeh... dumb stuff like that... (bites his fingernails, eyes wide) well, I've gotta find a bathroom! Yeh, when I was in there... Wow, that's a big crack. (The bone cracks again, almost disintegrating.)  (dramatic music and the sound of fire suddenly dies away) Yeh, yeh, I knew that already, but did it say anything about a girl? Yes! Really!? (He stands and clasps his hands in a gesture of thanks) Thank you, Aunt Wu!  (knowingly) They sure are. (smiling) Some stuff. You'll find out. (pointing up) That cloud looks like a fluffy bunny. Sure, I guess. (Camera pans left as Aang simultaneously pushes her off the screen.) Hey Katara, don't you think that cloud looks like a flower? Since I got you here, uh, there's something I want to tell you. I like you, but more than normal.  Never mind. They seem happy, Sokka. So, Sokka, you know some stuff about ladies, right? Well, there's this girl...(cut to shot of Aang in the foreground, with Meng hiding behind a barrel at the far end of the square, stalking Aang. She laughs.)  You do? And you're ok with it? She does!? Well, how do I do that? (to a sound effect) You can be too nice? (screen pans left to show Meng sidling up to Aang) Well...ok. See ya later. Oh, hey Katara. I didn't see you there. (shouting after her) That's ok, I'm busy with my own stuff. (trying to sound cool) So...papaya. You know me. (He picks up a fruit.) I don't really care what I eat. Maybe aloof isn't my style. (to Momo, perched on his shoulder) Did you see that? Excuse me. Where can a guy find one of those things? Not just any flower – a panda lilly. I've seen it in action and boy does it work. But my heart is telling me to get this flower, and Aunt Wu said if I trusted my heart I would be with the one I love. Well, Aunt Wu hasn't been wrong yet. Why should she be wrong about love? (Pointing up.) There, on the rim! Oh no! Aunt Wu was wrong. There's no time to walk. (He opens up his glider.) Grab on. (He grabs Sokka and they launch into the air.)  Hi, Katara. But, she doesn't even charge. Please listen to us! You are all in danger! And we have to get out of here. You can't rely on Aunt Wu's prediction. You have to take fate into your own hands. But they will listen to Aunt Wu. Well, it's about to become the solution. We're taking fate in our own ha(who has just emerged from the lake, holding a fish as if about to give it a kiss) Oh look! nds. First, I need to borrow Aunt Wu's cloud reading book. (whispering) Shh... we don't want anyone to hear us. Oh! I didn't see you there. Of course I like you. Oh. I guess not. (sadly) I know what you mean. (he blushes) Huh? Don't worry. You're gonna meet a great guy who's gonna completely fall for you. I know it. (He puts his hands on her shoulders.)  How did you know? (blushing) Oh, thanks. I guess. Clouds are made of water and air so between the two of us we ought to be able to bend them into any shape we want. We can still save the village if we act fast. Sokka has a plan. If any of you are earthebenders come with me. Everyone needs to evacuate! We'll come for you when it's safe! (sheepishly looking at the ground) By the way, we kind of borrowed your book. Can I ask you something? You didn't really see love in my fortune, did you? You just told me what I wanted to hear.
Katara: Look! (smiles, walks over to Aang and takes necklace) Thanks, Aang. I love it. (from o.c.) So, how do I look? (looking in annoyance o.c. towards her brother) Stop teasing him, Sokka. (Momo hops up onto Aang's shoulder.) Aang's just a good friend. (She rubs Aang's head) A sweet little guy – just like Momo. (She rubs Momo's head just as she had Aang's a moment before.)  Run down hill, then climb a tree! Wow, it must be. That explains why you were so calm. Maybe we should go see Aunt Wu and learn our fortunes. It could be fun. That proves it. (She runs under the umbrella with Aang.)  I guess you're not really getting wet then. Just admit you might be wrong and you can come under the umbrella. Really? Try to keep an open mind, Sokka. There are things in this world that just can't be explained. Wouldn't it be nice to have some insight into your future? I guess that's me. Actually, I have this special seaweed lotion. I could get you some if you want. (Aang sticks his tongue out, his face clearly expressing his disdain for discussions around moisturizer) So, do you see anything interesting in my love line? (Aang's eyes bug out instantly and he leans in close to hear.)  Tell me more! You're just saying that because you're going to make yourself unhappy your whole life. (cut to Katara and Aang) Well, I liked my predictions. Certain things are going to turn out very well. (She holds her hands together in a gesture of hope.)  Why, what did she tell you? (also looking up) What's with the sky? (putting a hand on Sokka's shoulder) Shhhh!! She's coming!  Shh!! Hi, Aunt Wu. Sorry to bother you. About this man I'm supposed to marry (her cheeks flush momentarily in embarrassment)...is he gonna be handsome? (She clasps her hands together in a gesture of hope.) Oh, I hope he's tall! Yes, please! Wow, thanks Aunt Wu. (Gets up, turns to leave, but turns back.) Oh, wait, one more thing. How warmly should I dress tomorrow? Okay, okay, but, one more thing. Should I eat a mango or a papaya for breakfast tomorrow? Ohhh, I hate papaya. (walking away) Hey Aang. Ugh. Papaya please. Uh-huh. Would you like some? Ok then. See you later. Can you believe she won't let me in? And after all the business I've given her? I know, but still. Sokka, you tried to convince me she was wrong before. It's going to take an awful lot to change my min – Oh, no! If you won't listen to him, maybe you'll listen to me. I want to believe Aunt Wu and her predictions as much as you do, but my brother and Aang saw the lava with their own eyes. They just won't listen to reason. (Aang flies back down to them.)  (reading Aunt Wu's book) I found it. The symbol for volcanic doom. It's too much! It's gonna overflow! Wait, what did you just say? I suppose he is... (taking Sokka by the shoulders) It's ok, Sokka. Everything's gonna be all right. Goodbye everyone! It was so nice to meet you! Take care, Meng.
Sokka: He is taunting us. (Cut to long shot of the group.) You are so gonna be dinner! (Sokka runs back to the tent and grabs his fishing pole which standing up outside of it, runs back to the lake edge and casts the pole a few times without effect.) Hey! Where's the fishing line? Aahh, it's all tangled! (again at the water's edge and looking back at Aang) Great, Aang. Maybe instead of saving the world you can go into the jewelry making business. Stop taunting me!  (who has just emerged from the lake, holding a fish as if about to give it a kiss) Smoochie, smoochie, someone's in love. (The fish flips is his hands, knocking him back into the lake.)  No, play dead, he'll lose interest! No, punch him in the bill! Mmm! Lunch! (He sniffs egg, then looks at calm man o.c. with a haughty look.) Lucky for you we came along. But the fortuneteller was wrong! You didn't have a safe journey, you were almost killed! Oh come on, fortunetelling is nonsense. (holding the egg above his head to try and deflect the rain) No it doesn't – you can't really tell the future. Of course she predicted it was gonna rain. The sky's been gray all day. Look, I'm going to predict the future now (making funny motions and in an exaggerated voice) – “It's going to keep drizzling.” (He folds his arms across his chest and assumes an expression of defiance.) See! (as he gets soaked) Yahhh! I'll try a curd puff. Oh, don't be modest. They're huge!  I can't believe we're here in the house of nonsense. It would be nice to have some bean curd puffs.  Not bad. Not bad. Mmmm! (Offers puffs to Aang.)  Boring stuff, I'm sure. Love. Who she's going to marry. How many babies she's gonna have. Looks like someone had a pretty good bathroom break. I don't even wanna know! (standing) Okay, let's get this over with. But, you didn't read my palms or anything! Well, now you got to see for yourselves that fortunetelling is just a big, stupid hoax. (exploding) That woman is crazy! My life will be calm, and happy and joyful! Ow! (From o.c.) That doesn't prove anything! Do you even hear yourself?  (incensed) I can't believe you would trust your lives to that crazy old woman's superstition. I can't believe all these saps. (Cut to side view where it is apparent that Aang follows behind him.) Someone really needs to scream some sense at them. Not for long. I'm gonna prove Aunt Wu's predictions are nonsense. (Turns and grabs nearby man.) Hey, you. I bet Aunt Wu told you to wear those red shoes, didn't she? Uh-huh. And how many times have you worn those shoes since you got that fortune? (swirling red fire appears behind him, demonstrating his anger and frustration) THEN OF COURSE IT'S GOING TO COME TRUE! I don't care what Aunt Wu told you, you have to take a bath sometime! (smugly) Some stuff? You've come to the right place. (Puts his arm around Aang's shoulders and points at his chest in a conspiratorial gesture.) What can I do you for? I think I know who you mean. (clearly thinking of Meng rather than Katara) Of course I am. And, to tell you the truth, I've been picking up the subtle vibe that she likes you too. (Meng visible in the background, waving her arms trying to get Aang's attention.)  Oh yeh, she's crazy about ya. All ya have to do now is not mess it up. The number one mistake nice guys like you make being too nice. Yup. If you want to keep her interested you have to act aloof, like you don't really care one way or the other. (rubbing his chin in admiration) Wow, that kid is good. (from o.c.) I can't believe you're dragging me all the way up here for a stupid flower. (climbing into frame from below) Flowers are fine once you're married, but at this early stage it's critical that you maintain maximum aloofness. What? Don't tell me you believe in that stuff too. Those people all think they're safe. We've got to warn'em. Aaahhh! Well, we have other things to worry about. Aunt Wu was wrong about the volcano. Everyone! That volcano is gonna blow any second. Aunt Wu was wrong! (another explosion occurs) Look! (Pointing to the mountain.) Can your fortunetelling explain that? (annoyed) Yes! Yes, it can! I know, that's the problem. Aunt Wu, look!
