Something is happening in the clouds. Lava is gonna flow downhill to this spot. If we can dig a deep enough trench we can channel all the lava away from the village to the river. Everybody else grab a shovel (explosion sounds)... come on, we've gotta hurry! Dig faster! Dig faster! Man, sometimes I forget what powerful bender (Katara's expression instantly changes at this, remembering Aunt Wu's words) that kid is. Nothing, just that Aang is one powerful bender. No offense, but I hope this taught everyone a lesson about not relying too much on fortunetelling. (getting right in the Calm Man's face) I hate you.

Aang: Hey look! A sword made out of a whale's tooth. (looking in a bush) No, we found something. So then what happened? (waking up in the background) Who the what now? (bowing) Hi, I'm Aang.(bowing) Thank you! It's truly an honor to be here. If there's anything – Yeh, nothing's more comforting than dead animal skins. Hey, I ride animals too! One time there was this giant eel – What's that story? I can't believe they would leave me. Uh, I know Bato. It's the map to Sokka and Katara's Dad! Hey everyone! Sorry I was gone so long.(with exaggerated happiness) Yup, but now I'm back. Sure...could go for some delicious sea prunes! (taking the map back) I'm sorry! I'll take care of this.  What's ice-dodging?(Looking nervous and guilty) I know that! Why wouldn't I know that? I'm the Avatar! I know about trust. What does that even mean!? I can't.(rubbing off the mark) No, you can't trust me. (holding out the crumpled scroll) A messenger gave this to me for Bato. (Katara looks at the scroll and draws in a breath of surprise.) You have to understand, I was afraid you'd –  Okay. You too. Guess I should be moving on. I'm an idiot, Momo. Looks like we're going alone, guys. Okay, I get it. Everybody wants me gone.(in alarm) Who? Zuko! A necklace? (Eyes suddenly going wide) Huh! Katara! You've got something I want!  So, where do we go? Don't you want to see your father? I wish I could give you a little piece of home, Katara. Something to remind you – Still, just a little trinket. Maybe something like...this!(smiling) Zuko asked to be sure I got it to you. Sure!
Katara: (entering wider shot) Did someone lose something? (pointing o.c. to the right) Wait! Look! Is this... Dad's boat? Bato! Is he here? Bato! It looks like home! No way! Stewed sea prunes? Bato, is it true you and Dad lassoed an arctic hippo? Everyone does. You and Dad had so many hilarious adventures. Really? I do really miss him. It would be great to see Dad. Even if we had time to wait for the message, who knows how far we'd have to travel. We don't have time for a long detour. Hey Aang, I didn't notice you left. He never got to go. Dad left before he was old enough. There's no way through! Of course you can! Aang, what are you talking about.(looking at Aang, then lowering her eyes) I'm with you, Sokka. Good luck. That wolf sounds so sad. Sokka?(smiling) You're right. Aang! We're getting you to the North Pole. And we need you. I'll be okay.(grabbing the necklace and putting it on happily) Aang, how did you get that? (in mock appreciation) Oh, that's so sweet of Zuko. Would you give him a kiss for me when you see him?
Sokka: (grabbing it) Lemme see that. This is a water tribe weapon. (To Aang, behind him over he left shoulder.) See if you can find anything else. It's burned.  There was a battle. Water tribe warriors ambushed a group of firebenders.  The firebenders fought back, but the warriors drove them down this hill... I don't know. The trail ends here. (from o.c.) It's one of our boats! (rubbing the ship's prow and smiling) No, but it's from his fleet. Dad was here. I'm coming with you. (his eyes pleading) I'm strong! I'm brave! I can fight! Please, Dad! (eyes watering) I don't understand. Who's there? Bato?  Where's Dad? (cutting Aang off) What smells so good, Bato? (He sniffs the air.) Perfume? Maybe we could dump some on Appa? Because he stinks so much! Am I right? Everything's here, even the pelts! Dad could eat a whole barrel of these things. (cutting Aang off) So who was it that came up with the great blubber fiasco? It's a long one, Aang, some other time. Was it you or Dad that put an octopus on your head and convinced Gran-Gran you were a water spirit? When? It's been over two years since we've seen Dad! That would be so incredible. Katara?(less exuberantly) It would be great, but we can't. We have to take Aang to the North Pole first. Is this the boat he took you ice-dodging in? How are we supposed to ice-dodge without ice? Aang, ease up on the jib. Katara, steady! Aang, less sail! (Sokka, sweating, pulls the tiller to his right) Katara, give him room! Aang! Helm to lee! Helm to lee! Great job! We can make it! Aang, I'm gonna need air in that sail! (Aang nods.) Katara, I want you to bend as much water as you can between us and those rocks! (Cut to zooming close up of Sokka's determined face.) Now!(looking at the map, and then Aang in hurt and surprise) This is the map to our father! You had it the whole time!? How could you? (Aang shrivels up.) Well, you can go to the North Pole on your own! I'm going to find Dad. Katara, are you with me? It's probably wounded.(after a pause) We need to go back. I want to see Dad, but helping Aang is where we're needed the most. Thanks, Bato.(defiantly) We split up! He's long gone. Pretty stupid. (Grabbing Katara by the arm) Run! I'm starting to get some feeling back! (A bunch of tiles fall on them) Ow! That thing sees with its nose. Let's give him something to look at. Yeh, we've lost too much time as it is. Of course we do, Aang. But, you're our family too, and right now, you need us more.
Zuko: There are no stowaways on my ship. He's paralyzed. But how did you find him on my ship? Out of my way! Step aside, filth! I need to talk to you. Your beast trashed my ship. You have to pay me back. (grabbing her hand as she raises her cup to her lips) Money isn't what I had in mind.(from o.c.) I need you to find someone. It's not the girl I'm after, it's the bald monk she's traveling with. If you find them, I'll consider the damage to my ship paid for. We're looking for someone. Why are we stopping?(grabbing the necklace from June's hand) We have no time for this! Hey, watch it! Where is he? Where's the Avatar? How stupid do you think I am? What are we supposed to do now? What's it doing? It's just going around in a circle! Uncle? I didn't see you get hit with the tongue.

Aang: I bet we'll find something to eat here! (Cut to a frontal shot of the flyer). The Fire Days Festival. (Reading the flyer.) Fire Nation cultural exhibits...jugglers, benders, magicians. This'd be a great place for me to study some real firebenders! Hey, a poster of me! I have to learn firebending at some point, and this could be my only chance to watch a master up close. You guys stay out of sight here while we go to the festival. Ready disguises! Let's go. (pointing ahead, o.c.) Hey, there's some food.(looking o.c. to his right) Hey, look at this. I don't know, but there's a big crowd so it must be good. I gotta learn that trick! (raising his hand and waving it about) Oh! Oh! Me! Me! I want to get a closer look. Awww! That could'a been me. We gotta help her! I'm calling Appa! Appa! Down here! Nice touch setting off the fireworks. You mean there's a firebender out here who's not with the Fire Lord? (Standing up) We've gotta go see him! He can train me! (hurt) Sokka, this could be my only chance to meet a firebending master who would actually be willing to teach me. Is that where Jeong Jeong is? I need to talk to him right away. What happened? Can I see Jeong Jeong now? Why won't he see me? Wait, how does he know that? I'm going in anyway! Master, I need to learn firebending.(sitting down) I'm the Avatar. It's my destiny to...  Ookay, but it's the Avatar's duty to master all of the bending disciplines. Please, I have to learn. This could be my only chance. Really? That's great! (as Jeong Jeong begins to walk away) Wait! What do I do now? But what am I concentrating on? (looking at the sun then turning back to Jeong Jeong, a large smile on his face) So when do I get to make some fire? Are we coming up here so I don't burn anything with my fire blasts? (clearly disappointed and impatient) What? You brought me up here to breathe? You're not even look...  I've been breathing for hours. (angrily throwing his hands wide in a gesture of frustration) I want you to stop wasting my time! I already know how to squat and breathe and feel the sun. (Here he makes semi-disrespectful gestures mimicking each of the activities that Jeong Jeong has insisted he practice.) I want to know how to shoot fire out of my fingertips! I thought about what you said. I promise I'll be more patient. Oh yeh! I mean, let us begin. What's going on? (petulantly) This is the worst firebending instruction ever. All he does is leave me alone for hours to concentrate or breathe. But I'm ready to do so much more. I did it! I made fire! Now that's firebending! (continuing to play) Wonder how that juggler did it? Katara! (He hops over to her as she cries pitifully) I'm so sorry!  Iiiit was an accident! I was... Katara, I'm so - I'm sorry, I didn't... (Sokka walks away) I'm sorry! Jeong Jeong tried to tell me that I wasn't ready. I wouldn't listen. I'm never going to firebend again. No, never again. What? How? (airbending himself to his feet) Where? (running out of the hut) I have to help him! (from o.c. ) Jeong Jeong! YOU were Jeong Jeong's student? Whoa! Wild shot! (to himself) No self control... Oh, were we fighting? I thought you were just getting warmed up. Is that all you got? Man, they'll make anyone an admiral these days! Ahoy! (Sticking his butt out at the admiral and wiggling it suggestively) I'm Admiral Zhao! I don't know why, but I thought you'd be better than Zuko. Sloppy. Very sloppy. You've lost this battle. (motioning to his left) No, but you have. Jeong Jeong said you had no restraint. Have a nice walk home! Wait! Where's Jeong Jeong? Wow! That's good water. Two?
Katara: This should give us a good idea of what's around here. I think we better keep moving. (looking at the ground, unsure) I guess we could check it out.  We'll wear disguises and if it looks like trouble, we'll leave. I think we need some new disguises.(Crossing her arms) "Flaming fire flakes" hot? What do you know. Aang, hold on! Where are we going? It's better that we don't attract any attention to ourselves. (backing away and shaking her head) Uh (standing up as well) It can't hurt just to talk to him. I'm sure there's a good reason. (coming closer) Aang, that's great, but you should take it slow. Careful! Aang, you'll hurt yourself! But you're a great master. You have powers I'll never know. I'm fine, we've got to get out of here. Where's Aang? You'll have to eventually. It's okay, Aang. I'm healed. I'll explain later. But right now, we have to get out here. Zhao and his soldiers are attacking! By the river. They captured Jeong Jeong. Aang, you're burned. Let me help you. (shrugging) I guess I always knew. He tried to get the first fish hook out with another fish hook.
Sokka: (finishing with the empty bag) See if you can find a menu, I'm starving. (from other side of the board) You might wanna rethink that. Look at this. A wanted poster. This is bad. What!? You want to walk into a Fire Nation town where they're all fired up with all their, you know, fire? (to no one) Yeh, because we always leave before we get into trouble. (sarcastically) It's like you're a whole different person. (skeptical and annoyed) Where are we gonna get masks like that? (as Aang and Katara rush over) That was surprisingly easy. (running ahead) Finally! (To food merchant) What do you have? I'll take'em! Aaahhh! Hot! Hot! Knowing the Fire Nation, it's probably an execution. What do you think you're doing? No, we don't want to make a scene! I think it's time to go. I hope he can really hear that bison whistle! You seem to really know your explosives. (surprised) You're a Fire Nation soldier! He was very highly ranked, we get it. We're not gonna go find some crazy firebender! (standing up) Look, thanks for the help, but we're leaving for the north pole in the morning. That's what you said about going to the festival! Why doesn't anyone ever listen to me!? Hold on, you know these guys!? (getting up on his elbows) Finally! Let's hit the road. (He stretches back out again.)  (from afar) Hey! (rushing into the frame) Katara, what's wrong!? (To Aang, angrily) What did you do? I told you we shouldn't mess around with this! Look what you did! You burned my sister! You burned my sister! (Shot widens more to show Jeong Jeong has returned. Then, to Jeong Jeong) This is all your fault! Katara! Are you all right? (from o.c.  Aang, come on! He disappeared. They all did. When did you learn how to do that? Oh... well then thanks for all the first aid over the years. Like when I fell into the grease briar bramble and that time I had two fish hooks in my thumb! Oh, and the time that big snake bit me! Thanks for healing that up. That was great. Really helpful.

Aang: Aren't airbender stories the best? I laugh at gravity all the time. Haha! Gravity.  Hey thanks for the story! (Momo climbing back up to his shoulder) It means a lot to hear airbender stories. It must have been hundred years ago your great grandpa met them. Hey, we're almost at the Northern Air Temple! This is where they had the championships for sky bison polo. Hey guys, look at this! (leaning back and folding his arms unhappily) No, they're not. (from o.c. as the camera returns to a shot of the temple and its gliders) Gliding maybe, but not flying. You can tell by the way they move. They're not airbending. Those people have no spirit.  Yeh, I know. But I can do more than fancy gliding! (clearly not enthused) It's great. (looking embarrassed but happy) Thanks. This place is unbelievable. No, just unbelievable. (sadly from o.c. as the camera pans the mural) This is supposed to be the history of my people. (as the smoke erupts from the statue) Ugh! It's nice to see even one part of the temple that isn't ruined. (assuming an airbending stance) Do you know what you did? You just destroyed something sacred! For a stupid bathhouse! (pointing at the Mechanist) This whole place stinks! This is a sacred temple! You can't treat it this way. I've seen it when the monks were here. I know what it's supposed to be like. (advancing on the Mechanist with each question) What are you doing? Who said you could be here? Our gliders. Nature knows where to stop. I just can't get over it. There's not a single thing that's the same. (lowering his head) I'm sorry, this is the last part of temple that the same as it was. I want it to stay that way. Thanks. (from o.c.) Spirit. That's the something you're talking about. Just make sure to keep your mouth closed so you don't swallow a bug! Even though Teo's not an airbender, he really does have the spirit of one. I've been thinking. If you wanna see what's in that room, I'd be happy to open the door for you. This is a nightmare.(turning and pointing a finger at him in anger) You're making weapons for the Fire Nation! When are they coming? You can't give them more weapons. The deal's off! (striking the emissary with an air whip) Get out of here! You're leaving empty handed! I'll tell ya how. (Pointing to the sky) We have something they don't. (Screens moves fast to open sky where a few gliders are moving) Air power! We control the sky. That' something the Fire Nation can't do. We can win!(smiling) Good, we'll need it. (jumping off Appa and opening his glider as he lands) We'll have to start without him. We've got'em on the run! We need more slime! Look! They're retreating! You know what? I'm really glad you guys all live here now. It's like the hermit crab (he picks one up from the stone bench.), maybe you weren't born here, but you found this empty shell and made it your home. And now you protect each other.
Katara: Was it realistic? Was that how it was back then? (sitting down next to Sokka) Do you think we'll really find airbenders? (folding her arms) Are you saying I'm a liar? Huh! They really are airbenders! (pointing to the glider) I don't know, Aang. That kid seems pretty spirited! Aang used to come here a long time ago. I think he's a little shocked it's so... different. I'm sure some parts of the temple are still the same. You're right. They're kind of keepers of the temples origins. Hey! It's just like the one in the other Air Temple. Aang? (looking over the side of the terrace in fear) I've changed my mind. I think I was born without that something. No! I can't believe I'm flying! Teo was right about the air! All I had to do was trust it. Let it carry me. (her voice echoing from o.c.) Wait! How do I land this thing? What if I land (swallows bug) – eh! Blech! Yech! Bug! Bug! That was a bug! Aang, what are we gonna do? How can we possibly keep them all away? (to Aang) Ugh, if only we knew. Hmm. That's actually pretty smart. Yes, but where's Sokka with the war balloon? Those things are unstoppable! Water? Can you get me close to one? Come on, Sokka, where's that war balloon? No! Sokka! Hold on!
Sokka: Sorry! (whittling) You want me to be like you, or totally honest? I'm saying you're an optimist. Same thing basically. (appearing in the far background with Momo and pointing ahead) What do you mean they're not? Those guys are flying! We better find some solid ground before it finds us! Wow! This glider chair is incredible! (running forward) Wow! So better! (approaching the candles) Wait, how can you tell the time from that thing? The notches all look the same. You put spark powder in the candle! (after catching the fingers) Aaahhh! These lanterns are terrible! I can't see. Why would you want to use fireflies for light? Okay, so you brought me all the way down here to see an empty room. (checking his part of the door for leaks) So this place is an explosion waiting to happen? (sniffing the air) Ugh! Week old egg smell! How could something that's so small you can't even see it make such a big stink! Yeh! If we put a whole mess of rotten eggs in the cellar where the gas seeps up... Then, if there's a leak... And plug up the hole where the gas is escaping!(angry) You make weapons for the Fire Nation!? This is bad! Very bad! Thank you. You're a genius! See, the problem with the old war balloon was you could get it airborne, but once you did, it just kept going. (He demonstrates with a model that goes up and hits the ceiling.) You could put a hole in the top, but then all the hot air would escape. So the question became, how do you keep a lid on hot air? A lid is actually the answer. If you control the hot air, you control the war balloon. (He demonstrates by pulling a string connected to the lid that opens and closes it.)  Okay, we've got four kinds of bombs. Smoke, slime, fire and... Hey, why aren't they shooting at us? (cutting a rope with his knife) Then I guess they won't see this coming. Oh no! That was the last one! Rotten eggs! There! That's where the gas is escaping! It's the only bomb we've got! We're going down! Get ready! Aang, you were right about air power. (Pointing to the sky) As long as we've got the skies we'll have the Fire Nation on the run!

Aang: I have an idea, why don't we all get on your back and you can fly us to the North Pole? There it is! We'll find a master to teach us, no problem!(trying to ignore this) My friend and I can't wait to start training with you – after we relax for a couple days. Good morning, Master Pakku! Uhh... this is my friend, Katara, the one I told you about? Yeh! They're not fair. If you won't teach Katara, then – Then I won't learn from you! (through gritted teeth) I'm trying! That bad? Master Poophead won't teach her because she's a girl. Master Pakku said this move is all about sinking and floating. That was amazing! I... I was just showing Katara a few moves. I'm sorry, I – Uh, Katara... I'm sure she didn't mean that. You don't have to do this for me. I can find another teacher. Go Katara! Go get her. Hey Katara! Good to see ya here.
Katara: Look, we're all just a little tired and cranky because we've been flying for two days straight. They're waterbenders! We found the Water Tribe! (from o.c. with wonder) The Northern Water Tribe... I can't believe how many waterbenders live up here!(from o.c.) This place is beautiful. Ha! Prince of what?(with a mock bow) My apologies, Prince Sokka. Very smooth. I've waited for this day my whole life! I finally get to learn from a real waterbending master! What do you mean you won't teach me? (Walking up to Pakku) I didn't travel across the entire world so you could tell me “no”! (hands on her hips) But there must be other female waterbenders in your tribe! I don't want to heal, I want to fight! Well your rules stink! Wait! (To Pakku) Aang didn't mean that. You can't risk your training for me. You have to learn from Master Pakku. Even if he is a big jerk. Um, hi. Are you Yagoda?(walking forward and sitting down) I guess I am. Thanks for the lesson. Huh? (smiling) No, I don't think I'm ready for that yet. My grandmother gave my mother this necklace, and my mother passed it down to me.(starting backwards in surprise) Wait, how do you know my Gran-Gran's name?(looking away) She never told me. If Gran-Gran was engaged, why did she leave? How's warrior training going?(raising her head with a smile) Why didn't I think of that? (Getting up.) At night, you can teach whatever moves you learned from Master Pakku. That way you have someone to practice with and I get to learn waterbending. Everyone's happy! But you're never happy. Come on, Aang. I got it! That wasn't me. Yes – please! Fine. No! No way am I apologizing to a sour old man like you!(a look of challenge on her face) I'll be outside – if you're man enough to fight me!(taking off her coat and throwing it at Sokka, hitting him in the face) I know! I don't care!  I'm not doing it for you! Someone needs to slap some sense into that guy! So, you decided to show up? (He walks past her.) Aren't you gonna fight? You can't knock me down! But you still won't teach me, will you? Come back here! I'm not finished yet! No it's not, it's mine! Give it back! My Gran-Gran was supposed to marry you? But she didn't love you, did she? It was an arranged marriage. (walking up to Pakku) Gran-Gran wouldn't let your tribe's stupid customs run her life. That's why she left. It must have taken a lot of courage. (smiling) You too.
Sokka: (petulantly) I'm not one to complain, but can't Appa fly any higher? I'd love to! Climb on everyone (he wiggles his butt at everyone), Sokka's ready for takeoff! And for what? We can't even find the Northern Water Tribe. There's nothing up here. We're finally here... (looking dreamily at the girl as he boat moves away) Yeh, she is. (in a cheesy voice) Hi, there. Sokka, Southern Water Tribe. (after a brief pause, trying desperately to strike up a conversation) So... uh... you're a Princess! (She nods and smiles) You know, back in my tribe, I'm kinda like a Prince myself!(angry) A lot of things! Uh, do you mind? I'm trying to have a conversation here!(turning back to Yue and trying to recover) So it looks like I'm gonna be in town for awhile. I'm thinking maybe we could...(then lamely) do an activity together? Princess Yue! Good morning! (Coming up beside her boat on the sidewalk along the side of the canal and walking with her boat as it floats down the canal.) Hey, how about that picnic last night? Boy, your Dad sure knows how to throw a party. Well, it wasn't as much fun after you left. So, I'm still hoping we can see more of each other. (eyes wide, clearly excited) Yes! At... a place! For... some time! Great! I'll see you – aahh!(to himself, as he falls over backwards to lie flat on the sidewalk) That's okay, it was worth it. (Shot zooms out and rotates) See you tonight. Hi, Princess Yue. (Offering her something) I made you something. I carved it myself. Actually, it's a fish (he turns it sideways), see it has a fin. No, it's Princess Yue. I don't get it. One minute she wants to go out with me and the next she's telling me to get lost! (Pause.) So how's waterbending training? Why don't you just teach her, Aang? I'm not happy. Yeh, I think she did. Are you crazy, Katara? You're not gonna win this fight! Nothing. I just want you to know, I think you're beautiful... and, I never thought a girl like you would even notice a guy like me. No, no, see, that's the thing. I think I do understand now. You're a princess, and I... I'm just a southern peasant. It's okay. You don't have to say anything. (Turning to leave) I'll see ya around, okay? Okay, now I'm really confused! Happy – but confused!
Zuko: For the last time, I'm not playing the sumki horn.(turning to face Zhao) What!? I'm not. They're antiques. Just decorative. Good riddance to those traitors.(getting up) Uncle? (Opening his door to look out into the corridor) Uncle, is that you? (removing his guard mask) You didn't have to do this. Thank you, Uncle.

episode_title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
Aang: Yes, Master Pakku? I wouldn't say "mastered", but check this out! I wasn't there when the Fire Nation attacked my people. (Cut to a close up of Aang, a fierce expression on his face.) I'm gonna make a difference this time. Yip! Yip! I'll take it from here, boy! Appa! Thanks for the rescue, buddy! You have got to be kidding me. I can't do it. (Putting his hands to his head.) I can't do it. I must have taken out a dozen Fire Navy ships, but there's just too many of them. I can't fight them all. I'm just one kid.(his eyes opening wide as he gets an idea) The Spirits! Maybe I can find them and get their help!(spreading his arms wide) Or, maybe they'll unleash a crazy amazing spirit attack on the Fire Nation!  Or wisdom. That's good too. So is this the way to the Spirit World? I never thought I'd miss grass this much! You're right, Yue. I can feel...something...it's so...tranquil. How 'bout some quiet!? (Turning to look at them, Katara putting a hand over her mouth.) C'mon guys! I can hear every word you're saying!
Katara: Sokka! (pointing at them) Aang! What happened? I've always noticed my waterbending is stronger at night.  The Avatar is the bridge between our world and the Spirit World. Aang can talk to them! The only problem is, last time you got to the Spirit World by accident. How are you going to get there this time? (smiling) It's so warm here! How is that possible? (She takes off her overcoat.) (also whispering) He's meditating – trying to cross over into the Spirit World. It takes all his concentration. He's crossing into the Spirit World. He'll be fine as long as we don't move his body. That's his way back to the physical world. No, he's my friend. I'm perfectly capable of protecting him.(turning to the voice) No! (shouting) Aang! (sadly) He took Aang. He took him right out from under me.
Sokka: (stopping and sitting down on the rail) Are you kidding? I grew up in a block of ice. It's not exactly a cultural hub. What's wrong? We're taking a walk! I know what you need! (He hops off the rail to stand by her side.) You need to meet my good friend Appa! Appa and I go way back. Don't we boy? Ahh! Easy! Down boy! Ahh! No! Up! You hangin' on tight? Yip... (Cut to a close up of Sokka's face) ...yip!(stretching) Yeh, we pretty much live up here. Not when you're with someone. Yeh. Whoo! Yeh! Good times! Good times!(pointing down) Hey, look! (looking ahead o.c.) Oh no.(voice over) Soot. I've seen it before. Right before my village was attacked. It's soot mixed with snow. It's the Fire Nation. They've closed in on the North Pole. And from the looks of the stuff... ...I'd say there's a lot of them. What's wrong? (Pointing up to the citadel) We have to go!(turning in surprise) What? We're just friends. You don't love him, do you? You don't even seem to like him. You're not marrying them. (standing up) Count me in. Katara!? (pointing at him) Fire Navy uniforms don't look like that. When, like a hundred years ago? (walking forward) The Fire Nation doesn't wear shoulder spikes anymore. The newer uniforms are more streamlined.  His name is Zhao. Middle-aged. Big sideburns. Bigger temper. Princess Yue's marrying you? (turning away) Nothing, congratulations.(his eyes bulging in anger) Perks!? What does that mean? Princess Yue is wasted on a self absorbed weasel like you! You're just a jerk without a soul! No offense! (to the backs of Hahn and his departing soldiers) It's Admiral Zhao! Oh no! Hahn's out there on the top secret mission while I'm here sharpening my boomerang. Everything's fine!(turning to the Chief in anger) What? You want me to scrub the barracks?(getting up, an look of innocence mingled with desire on his face) Er, sure. That shouldn't be too hard. What happened? Where's Zuko? (voice over as we see a shot of Momo looking back at them from his perch on the side of the pond) Where did they go?
Zuko: (removing his mask) I'm working on it, Uncle. I don't need your wisdom right now, Uncle. Uncle, you don't have to say it. I know, Uncle. (He bows and salutes him with his arm over chest.) We'll meet again...(releasing his Uncle and walking over to the canoe) ...after I have the Avatar. I will.(now far below his uncle) I'll be fine. Where are they going? They're coming up for air somewhere... (to the noisy turtles) Be quiet!(voice over, his voice echoing slightly in the chamber) Well, aren't you a big girl now? Yes! Hand him over, and I won't have to hurt you.(getting up) I see you've learned a new trick. But I didn't come this far to lose to you.(voice muffled by the ice) You little peasant. You've found a master, haven't you? You rise with the moon. I rise with the sun.

episode_title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
Aang: Hello? I'm sorry to disturb you, but I just really need to find the Moon and the Ocean spirits. Yes! I need –(getting up) Come back! Roku! Roku, the Water Tribe is under attack. I need to find the Ocean and Moon spirits! Who?(with relief) Oh! Whew! You're just a curly tailed blue nose.(in unison with voice over from Roku) Show no fear. Show no emotion at all. Hello? I'm looking for a spirit named "Koh." Thank you.  You know me? I didn't know that. Why did he... or I... try to kill you? I need to find the Moon and the Ocean. Please, help me find them. An entire culture could be destroyed if I don't get their help. What do you mean? How can I find them and protect them?(smiling) The koi fish! I must be going now. The spirits are in trouble. I need to get back to the physical world. Hei-Bai!(dismounting) This is where I came in. (He jumps onto the platform underneath the paifang) But how do I get back? Momo! (looking at his hands) Momo? (Realizing his predicament) Oh no! Where's my body?(threateningly) Good to be back.  Appa! We need to get to the oasis! The spirits are in trouble! Wait, we can't just leave him here.  No, if we leave him, he'll die.(his hand on his head as well) I feel it too. (Aang's looks up) The Moon Spirit is in trouble. Zhao! Don't! Destroying the moon won't just hurt the Water Tribe. It will hurt everyone – including you. Without the moon, everything would fall out of balance. You have no idea what kind of chaos that would unleash on the world.(voice deep and other-worldly) No, it's not over.(extending a forearm and laughing) Come here.
Katara: I can't believe I lost him.(getting up) Okay. It's all right. You stay here, Momo, in case Aang comes back. I'm not worried they'll get away in the blizzard. I'm worried that they won't. Look! That's gotta be Aang!(beginning to waterbend) Trust me, Zuko, it's not going to be much of a match. It's too late. It's dead. What about Aang? (Cut to a shot behind Katara and Pakku as they look at Aang and Momo in the background) He still needs to learn waterbending. You too, Momo.
Sokka: You did everything you could and now we need to do everything we can to get him back.(continuing from o.c.)  Zuko can't have gotten far. We'll find him. Aang's gonna be fine. Yip! Yip! They're not gonna die in this blizzard. If we know anything it's that Zuko never gives up. They'll survive – and we'll find them! Hey! This is some quality rope! Sure we can. Let's go. Yeh, this makes a lot of sense. Let's bring the guy who's constantly trying to kill us! Are you okay? What do you mean?(reaching for her) No! You don't have to do that!(from o.c. as the camera shows a close up of their clasped hands) I won't let you! Your father told me to protect you!(in despair) NO!(softly) She's gone. (He hugs her body tightly) She's gone. You must be proud.
Zuko: Shelter! I finally have you. But I can't get you home because of this blizzard. (He walks over to the cave entrance to look out at the falling snow, his back to the camera) There's always something. Not that you would understand. You're like my sister. Everything always...came easy to her. She's a firebending prodigy – and everyone adores her. (Cut to a frontal view of Zuko) My father says she was born lucky. He says I was lucky to be born. (Cut to view of his back again.) I don't need luck though, I don't want it. I've always had to struggle and fight and that's made me strong. It's made me who I am. Guess we'll be here awhile. Welcome back. That won't be enough to escape.(assuming a firebending stance) Here for a rematch? You tried to have me killed! I had no choice! Take my hand! I'm tired.

Aang: (as he falls) Aaahhh! (he lands on the floor of the Air Temple) Oof! Nah. Just a nightmare. (unsettled) I was in the Avatar state, but I was outside my body watching myself. It was scary. I was scary. Appa, yip yip! (humbly) I try not to think about it too much. (alarmed) What?! No I'm not! See, it's this special state where— (with uncertainty) Right... but I'm don't know how to get in or out of the Avatar state, much less what to do once I'm there. (o.c.) General Fong? (looks down in uncertainty) I'm in. (looks up with determination) I'll fight the Fire Lord. (quietly) I told the general I'd help him... by going into the Avatar state. (pleading) Katara, I'm just being realistic. I don't have time to do this the right way. (He looks sad and almost ashamed.)  Ten-fold energy, huh? (slurps; twitch, twitch, twitch)  (speaking in a fast, high-pitched, hyper voice while zipping everywhere on his air-scooter) Is it working, is it working? I can't tell! Somebody tell me if I'm in the Avatar state 'cause I don't have a good view of myself! Am I talking too loud? (collides with a column, his air ball disappear and his shawl falling over his head.) Ooof! (cheerfully) I love surprises. Aaahhh! (looks at his hands and holds them up) Still not glowing. This is just mud! Aaaaachoooo! (o.c.) Sure. I'm really glad you told me that. But I still need to do this. No, you don't. Every day more and more people die. I'm already a hundred years late. Defeating the Fire Lord is the only way to stop this war. I have to try it. (sadly) Goodnight. (as the water vortex knocks him overboard) Aaahhh! (softly) Sokka. Sokka, wake up. I don't think we should be trying to bring on the Avatar state. Yes. (apprehensive) Do you think the general will be mad? The thing is, I don't think we'll ever be able to trigger it on purpose. So, I guess that's it. I'm sure. I can only reach the Avatar state when I'm in genuine danger. (gets hit with the desk) Ugh! (about to hit the ground) Aaahhh! What are you doing? I am not your enemy! I won't fight you! You can't fight forever! Aaahhh! Don't hurt her! Stop this! You have to let her go. (desperately) I'm trying... I'm trying! (hysterical) You don't need to do this! What do you mean? (tired and remorseful) I'm sorry, Katara. I hope you never have to see me like that again. (The two look up as Fong begins to speak.) (Cut to Fong, who walks forward, spreading his arms.)  You're out of your mind.
Katara: Aang? Do you wanna talk about it? (respectfully) Thank you, Master Pakku.  (calls back as they fly off) Say hi to Gran Gran for me! (Cut to a scene looking down at the ship as Appa flies toward the screen.)  (pleased) "Mighty Katara"? I like that. Aang still needs to master all four elements. (irritated) No, nothing's decided. We already have a plan. Aang's pursuing his destiny his way. Aang, no. This is not the right way. There's a right way to do this. Practice, study, and discipline. (angrily) If you two meatheads want to throw away everything we've worked for, fine. Go ahead and glow it up! (She exits to the right. Aang rises and starts after her.)  (o.c.) Can we talk about something? Do you remember when we were at the air temple and you found Monk Gyatso's skeleton? It must have been so horrible and traumatic for you. I saw you get so upset that you weren't even you anymore. I'm not saying the Avatar state doesn't have incredible—and helpful power. But you have to understand, for the people who love you, watching you be in that much rage and pain is really scary. I don't understand. (quietly) I can't watch you do this to yourself. I'm not coming tomorrow. (She begins to walk off toward the screen, but pauses.) Goodnight. (She exits off screen.)  I wonder what crazy thing they're trying now. (Cut to Momo, who makes a purring noise and closes his eyes.) Maybe we should just make sure Aang's okay. (to Sokka) What's going on? Aaahhh! (grunts, straining) I can't move! (sinking deeper) Aaahhh! Aang, I'm sinking! (terrified) Aaahhh! Please! I think we're all set.
Sokka: (excitedly) There it is! Not bad, not bad. But, sir, the thing is Aang can only do those things when he's in the Avatar state. Why not? Remember when he took out the Fire Navy? He was incredible. Or just glow it up and stop that Fire Lord. (Looking bored.) I guess he could talk the Fire Lord to death. Maybe I can shock you into the Avatar state. (groggily) Wha...? You sure? (accepting) Okay. What can he say? You're the Avatar. Who knows better than you? Aang! The general's gone crazy. He's trying to force Aang into the Avatar state! (nervous coaxing) Good bird/horse thingy. Katara! No! (Fong sinks the bird creature's legs into the dirt and Sokka gets tossed from his ostrich, landing in the hole of one of the discs.) Waaaahhh! Oof! (bonks Fong on the head and knocks him out) Anybody got a problem with that? (Soldiers all shake their heads in unison) (Sokka dismounts from the creature. The soldiers approach the others and bow. The creature runs off in the background.)
Zuko: (dejectedly) Three years ago today I was banished. I lost it all. (He looks up suddenly.)  I want it back. I want the Avatar, I want my honor, I want my throne. I want my father not to think I'm worthless. We don't need anymore useless things. You forget we have to carry everything ourselves now. (accusingly) What are you doing here? (furiously) Don't call me that! (with shocked and quiet disbelief) Father regrets? He... wants me back? (o.c., happily) We're going home. After three long years. It's unbelievable. (Zuko walks behind a thoughtful Iroh, carrying some folded clothing. He walks off to the right of the screen.)  Did you listen to Azula? Father's realized how important family is to him. He cares about me. (defensively, turning his back to Iroh) You don't know how my father feels about me. (He stiffens) You don't know anything. (nastily) I think you are exactly what you seem a lazy, mistrustful, shallow old man who has always been jealous of his brother. (happily surprised) Uncle! You've changed your mind! We're finally going home. (wistfully) Home... You lied to me!
Azula: (to her men) My brother and my uncle have disgraced the Fire Lord and brought shame on all of us. You may have mixed feelings about attacking members of the royal family; I understand. But I assure you, if you hesitate, I will not hesitate to bring you down. Dismissed. I'm sorry, Captain, but I do not know much about the tides. Can you explain something to me? Do the tides command this ship? (condescendingly) You said the tides would not allow us to bring the ship in. Do the tides command this ship? And if I were to have you thrown overboard, would the tides think twice about smashing you against the rocky shore? Well, then, maybe you should worry less about the tides who've already made up their mind about killing you and worry more about me, who's still mulling it over. 'Almost' isn't good enough! (o.c.) Hello, brother. Uncle. (arrogantly) In my country, we exchange a pleasant 'hello' before asking questions. (She gets up and walks over to face Zuko.) Have you become uncivilized so soon, Zuzu? Hmm... must be a family trait. Both of you so quick to get to the point. (She shatters one of Iroh's shells with her sharp nails on this last word. Iroh's face darkens.) I've come with a message from home. Father's changed his mind. Family is suddenly very important to him. He's heard rumors of plans to overthrow him—treacherous plots. Family are the only ones you can really trust. (Her voice and face soften.) Father regrets your banishment. He wants you home. (o.c.) Did you hear me? You should be happy. Excited. Grateful. (Camera returns to show her pleasant expression.) I just gave you great news. (interrupting him angrily) Don't interrupt, Uncle! (addresses Zuko. The camera pans to show his scarred face in the foreground, and Azula walks up beside him.) I still haven't heard my thank you. I am not a messenger. I didn't have to come all this way. I can see you need time to take this in. I'll come to call on you tomorrow. Good evening. (Azula walks off screen to the right.)  Brother! Uncle! (Cut back to Zuko and Iroh, both bowing. Iroh opens one eye slightly, watching the soldiers beside him.) Welcome. I'm so glad you decided to come. (pleasantly) Set our course for home, Captain. (smugly) Like I've never done that before. You know Father blames Uncle for the loss at the North Pole. And he considers you a miserable failure for not finding the Avatar. (o.c.) Why would he want you back home, except to lock you up where you can no longer embarrass him? Anyone who harbors these traitors will face the wrath of the Fire Lord. (menacingly) There will be no place left to hide.

Aang: So, you were showing me the octopus form. (blushing, slightly flustered) Oh... yeah. Thanks. Just... people. You guys are nomads That's great! I'm a nomad. (flatly) I know... you just said that. Hey, Sokka, you should hear some of these stories. These guys have been everywhere. They said they'll take us to see a giant night crawler. Yeah. Thanks for the help, but Appa hates going underground and we need to do whatever makes Appa most comfortable. (terrified) AAAAAHHHHH! So all you need is to trust in love to get through these caves? We can make it. Yeah, but I wouldn't mind a map, also. We found the exit! No... it's a tomb. It must be the two lovers from the legend. That's who's buried here. How are we gonna find our way out of these tunnels? What? Katara, what is it? Right... (totally clueless) Where are you going with this? (surprised) Us, kissing? (dreamily) Us... kissing... (also tries to laugh it off) Yeah, heh, heh. (He points at her for additional emphasis) I definitely wouldn't wanna kiss you!  (trying desperately to recover) No, no, I mean... if there was a choice between kissing you and dying... What? I'm saying I'd rather kiss you than die. (He holds clasps his hands together in a gesture of appeasement) That's a compliment. (dejected) What is wrong with me? (gloomily) We're gonna run out of light any second now, aren't we? Then what are we gonna do? It's made of some kind of crystals. They must only light up in the dark! (uncertainly) So... um... (worried) What about Sokka? Just like the legend says we let love lead the way. So, are you guys gonna come to Omashu with us? Okay. Thanks for everything, Moku.
Katara: (teasingly) What, like you're ready to go right now, naked guy? Right. Let me see your stance. (evaluates Aang's form and comes over to correct it) Your arms are too far apart. See, if you move them closer together you protect your center. You got it? Okay, let's see what you got. You make a fine octopus, Pupil Aang. (gesturing negatively with her hands as Sokka resurfaces behind her, Momo landing on his hand) We're not river people. Sokka's right. We need to find King Bumi so Aang can learn earthbending somewhere safe. (skeptically) Is this real or a legend? (terrified) AAAAAHHHHH! That's no campfire, Moku. (sympathetically) It's okay, Appa. We'll be fine. (less confidently) I hope. Sokka, this is the tenth dead end you've led us to. Everyone be quiet. Listen. Aang, look! This isn't the exit. These pictures tell their story. (voice-over) They met on top of the mountain that divided their two villages.  (voice-over) The villages were enemies so they could not be together. (voice-over) But their love was strong and they found a way. (voice-over) The two lovers learned earthbending from the badger moles. They became the first earthbenders. (voice-over) They built elaborate tunnels so they could meet secretly. Anyone who tried to follow them would be lost forever in the labyrinth. (voice-over) But one day the man didn't come.  He died in the war between their two villages. (voice-over) Devastated, the woman unleashed a terrible display of her earthbending power. She could have destroyed them all.  (voice-over) But instead she declared the war over.  Both villages helped her build a new city where they would live together in peace.  (voice-over) The woman's name was Oma and the man's name was Shu. The great city was named Omashu as a monument to their love. (reading the inscription) Love is brightest in the dark. I have a crazy idea. (hesitantly) Never mind, it's too crazy. I was thinking... the curse says we'll be trapped in here forever unless we trust in love. And here it says 'love is brightest in the dark' and... (she turns to face him, but doesn't yet meet his eyes) has a picture of them kissing. (shyly) Well... what if we kissed? See? It was a crazy idea. (tries to laugh it off) Us kissing. What was I thinking? Can you imagine that? (offended) Oh, well I didn't realize it was such a horrible option. (Leaning over at him in anger) Sorry I suggested it! (turning to Aang, infuriated) Well, I'm not sure which I would rather do! I think so. What can we do? That's how the two lovers found each other. They just put out their lights and followed the crystals.  That must be the way out! (excitedly) Let's go! Sokka! Why is your forehead all red?
Sokka: You guys are gonna be done soon, right?  We've got a lot of ground to cover if we wanna make it to Omashu today. I can be ready in two minutes. Seriously. (He lifts his hair to look at them and lets his arm drop lazily back into the water.) Whenever. (with an accusing finger pointed at Chong) Who're you? (firmly) Look, I hate to be the wet blanket here, but since Katara is busy I guess it's up to me. (Katara, whose hair is being braided by Lily, looks crossly up at Sokka at this) We need to get to Omashu. (Counting off the verboten distractions on his hand) No sidetracks, no worms, and definitely no rainbows. (emphatically) O. Ma. Shu. I think we'll just stick with flying. We've dealt with the Fire Nation before. We'll be fine. (terrified) AAAAAHHHHH! (unenthusiastically) Secret love cave. Let's go. How far are we from the tunnel. Labyrinth ! (in exasperation) Curse! What exactly is this curse? (aggravated) That's it! There's no way we're going througbrh some cursed hole! That's Fire Nation. They're tracking us. Everyone into the hole! We will be fine. All we need is a plan. Chong, how long do those torches last? (while grabbing and stomping out the torches she lit) It doesn't work like that if they're all lit at the same time! I'm gonna make a map to keep track of exactly where we've been. Then we should be able to solve it like a maze and get through. This doesn't make any sense; we already came through this way. There's something strange here. There's only one explanation. The tunnels are changing. (cynically) Right. If only we listened to you. Noooooooo!  (defensively) At least I'm thinking of ideas and trying to get us out of here, Moku. (explodes) Yes! We're all thinking of ideas! No, they were trying to get away from something. (trying to sing to the one note he's strumming and not doing very well) Badger moles, coming toward me. Come on guys, help me out. How did you guys get out? Really? We let huge ferocious beasts lead our way. (sullenly, but also blushing) Just play your songs. The journey was long and annoying, but now you get to see what it's really about - the destination.  I present to you the Earth Kingdom city of O... (devastated with realization) Oh, no...
Zuko: (frustrated) I didn't find anything to eat. I can't live like this. I wasn't meant to be a fugitive. (kicks at the ground angrily) This is impossible! (more calmly) Uncle... what are you doing? We need food, not tea. I'm going fishing. (horrified) You didn't! (in repulsion) Yah! (losing his patience) We're not taking any more chances with these plants! We need to get help. (musingly) If the Earth Kingdom, discovers us, they'll have us killed. Earth Kingdom it is. (standing and talking quickly) Yes, we're travelers. (hesitantly) Names Of course we have names. I'm... Lee. And this is my uncle, uh... Mushi.  Sorry, but we need to be moving on. I haven't seen my father in many years. Yeah. (quietly, without much feeling) Thank you. (quietly, but intensely) I know. They're about to show us a little more kindness. (offers his hand to Iroh) Well?

Aang: I can't believe it. I know the war has spread far, (he turns to face his friends) but Omashu always seemed...untouchable. (firmly) No. I'm going in to find Bumi. (defiantly) What? If he's still what? This isn't about finding a teacher. This is about finding my friend. Does that answer your question? Stop making so much noise. It's just a purple pentapus. Thank you, sewer friend! Somewhere he can't earthbend. (looking up and around, cut to Aang's p.o.v. as he pans around) Somewhere made of metal. So, is King Bumi with you guys? Is he leading the resistance? Actually there's another path to freedom. You could leave Omashu. You're directing all your energy to fight the Fire Nation. (Cut to a panning shot of the resistance fighters around them, all clearly listening to Aang, the camera ultimately resting back on the Resistance Leader.) But you're outnumbered. You can't win. Now's the time to retreat, so you can live to fight another day. (turning to face her) No. I'm not leaving until I find Bumi. Sorry Momo, I'll feed you later. Flopsie! (climbing on top of Flopsie) Come on, Flopsie. You gotta help me find Bumi. Yip Yip! Oh...I guess that doesn't work with you. Let's go! (sadly) We looked everywhere. No Bumi. It's from the Fire Nation governor. He thinks we kidnapped his son. So...he wants to make a trade. His son (the camera rotates around Aang for additional effect) for King Bumi. I don't think so. I'm sure the Governor wants his son back as much as we want Bumi. It's a new day. (Cut to a wide, overhead shot of the group and the sun and mountains behind them) I have a good feeling about this. He's here. We're ready to trade. Bumi! Hang on! We're gonna get you out of here. (smiling and laughing) Just like old times, isn't it, Bumi? (not understanding because of the noise) It's good to see you too! Hang on, Bumi! Our ride's here! You could earthbend all along!? I don't understand. (Getting angry, the questions becoming rapid fire) Why didn't you free yourself? Why did you surrender when Omashu was invaded? What's the matter with you, Bumi!? I know! (holding up his fingers as he counts them off) There's positive jin when you're attacking, and negative jin when you're retreating. (startled, looking at his hand which now has three fingers raised) There are three jins? (with dawning understanding) That's why you surrendered, isn't it? I guess I need to find someone else to teach me earthbending. Hey, Momo!
Katara: This is horrible, but we have to move on. I know you had your heart set on Bumi, but there are other people around who can teach you earthbending. That wasn't as bad as I thought. Sorry. We were just on our way home. Uh...he has pentapox, sir. (a pleasing, earnest look in her eyes) Um...it's highly contagious! ...and deadly... Let's find Bumi and get out of here. Aang, what are you doing? Aren't you coming with us. Oh no. Did someone get left behind? (leaning over to hug the baby from behind) Ooo, you're so CUTE. Mmmmm... (picking the baby up, who still clearly wants to play with the club) Does that look like the face of a killer to you? We've got to get the baby out of here! There's Aang!
Sokka: Up until now, it was. Now Ba-Sing-Se is the only great Earth Kingdom stronghold left. Aang, stop. We don't even know if Bumi's still... (refusing to meet Aang's eyes) ...around. (from o.c.) A secret passage?  Why didn't we just use this last time? (The cap pops off, releasing a huge gout of greenish sewage, some of which washes over Sokka.) Ugh! Ew! Aaahhh! Aaahh! Aahhh! They won't let go! Help! Aaaak! Uuuuuu....It's so awful...I'm dyiiiing... Where would they be keeping him? Suckers! You're all about to come down with a nasty case of pentapox. The marks make ya look sick, but you gotta ACT sick, too. Ya gotta sell it! (putting his arm around an earth kingdom citizen next to him) Now that's what I'm talkin' about. Okay everyone! Into sick formation. No! Bad Fire Nation baby! Oh...alright. You realize we're probably walking right into a trap? (stopping his whistling to answer, a smile on his face) Way ahead of ya! I seem to manage!  We can catch him!
Azula: You're right. The royal procession is dead weight. If I want to catch my prey, I must be agile....nimble. I need a small, elite team. It's time to visit some old friends. Ty Lee, could that possibly be you? (smiling) Please, don't let me interrupt your... (raises an eyebrow, searching for the right word and failing) whatever it is you were doing. Tell me, what is the daughter of a nobleman doing here? Certainly our parents didn't send us to the Royal Fire Academy for Girls to end up in... (cut to a shot of the efforts with the platypus bear, Azula continues, with a slight note of contempt in her voice) places like this. I have a proposition for you. I'm hunting a traitor. (Looking at her wrist a bit absent mindedly) You remember my old fuddy duddy uncle, don't you? I would be honored if you would join me on my mission. I'll take your word for it. Well, I wouldn't want you to give up the life you love just to please me. Of course, before I leave, I'm going to catch your show. I will. Incredible. Do you think she'll fall? Then wouldn't it make it more interesting if you removed the net? You're right, you're right. That's been done. (After a short pause) I know. Set the net on fire. Brilliant, just brilliant! (She looks back down at the Circus Master) Oooo, what kind of dangerous animals do you have? (cutting him off) Release them all! What an exquisite performance. I can't wait to see how you'll top yourself tomorrow. Really? (hugging Mai) It's great to see you, Mai. I have a mission (she puts one of her hands on each of their shoulders) and I need you both. Yes, I'm so sorry to hear about your son, (she crosses her legs in front of her) but really, what did you expect by just letting all the citizens leave? (She stands, suddenly angry, and looks down upon him) My father has trusted you with this city (she makes a slashing gesture with her left hand) and you're making a mess of things! You stay here. (Mai and Ty Lee stand up behind her) Mai will handle the hostage trade so you don't have a chance to mess it up. (Cut to several exterior shots of the still smoking city and several construction projects within, continue Azula voice over) And there is no more "Omashu". I'm renaming it in honor of my father, the City of New Ozai.  (to Mai, Bumi grinning behind them all) I'm sorry, but a thought just occurred to me. Do you mind? We're trading a two year old for a king. (She turns to Bumi) A powerful, earthbending king. (turning back to Mai) It just doesn't seem like a fair trade, does it? (in surprise) The Avatar! (Cut to a quick shot of Aang spiraling upwards with his glider, then back to Azula, who looks smug) My lucky day. It's not just Zuko and Iroh anymore. We have a third target now.

Aang: What? (Wiping his forehead with his left hand) I didn't even notice. (looking down at the swamp with a slightly fierce expression) I know this is gonna sound weird, but... I think the swamp is... calling to me. No, I... I think it wants us to land there. I don't know... Bumi said to learn earthbending I would have to wait and listen, and now I'm actually hearing the earth. Do you want me to ignore it? Okay, since everyone feels so strongly about this... bye swamp. Yip! Yip! Where's Appa and Momo? (calling fruitlessly) Appa! Momo! No... and the tornado... it just disappeared. (concerned) Maybe... we should be a little nicer to the swamp. Sokka, the longer we're here the more I think you shouldn't be doing that. ...except for them. Guys? (calling out) Katara! Appa! Hello? (from o.c.) Who are you? Hey, come back! Who are you? (airbending himself to his feet) I was chasing some girl. (helping Katara to her feet) I don't know. I heard laughing and I saw some girl in a fancy dress. What about me? I didn't know the girl I saw. And all our visions led us right here.  Yeh, the center... (from o.c.) It's the heart of the swamp,  (angry) Why did you call me here if you just wanted to kill us? We were flying over and I heard something calling to me, telling me to land. I get how the tree is one big thing, but, the whole world? But what about my vision It was someone I had never met. (to himself) Time is an illusion... so, it's... (looks up at Hue, realization spreading across his face) someone I will meet? I think I know how to find them. (Aang leans forward and places his hand on the tree root. He closes his eyes and begins to concentrate.) Everything is connected. Come on! We've got to hurry! Appa! But what about when the tree showed me where Appa and Momo were?
Katara: (coming up from behind) Is something wrong? I don't know... There's something ominous about that place. Sokka! You've got an elbow leech! Where do you think? You couldn't find them? (also concerned) Maybe you should listen to Aang. (Cut to an overhead shot of the dark swamp) Something about this place feels... alive. (calling out) Appa! Momo! What was that!  Does anyone else get the feeling that we're being watched? (calling out) Aang? (Cut to a closer shot) Sokka? Hello? Hello? Can you help me? (She squints, then cut to again to water tribe woman's back) Mom? (More loudly and running towards the figure) Mom! I can't believe... (displeased with Sokka's attitude) Well, I've been wandering around looking for you! What girl? (after a pause and looking down) I thought I saw Mom. You saw something too? Okay... so where's here? (Gesturing in front of them) The middle of the swamp? So, who are you then? But what did our visions mean? Hey, you guys are waterbenders! The South Pole. No, it' all ice and snow. What about the visions?
Sokka: (to Aang, o.c.) Hey, you takin' us down for a reason? (from o.c.) Aang! (Aang flinches and the camera zooms backward to a wide shot of Aang and Sokka, now visible behind him in the saddle) Why are we going down? Are you noticing now? (holding his stomach) It is telling ya where we can get something to eat? No offense to the swamp, but I don't see any land there to land on. Yes! See Even Appa and Momo don't like it here. You better throw in an extra "yip"! We gotta move! (freaking out) Where! Where! (angrily ripping off the leech and throwing it near Katara) Why do things keep attaching to me! We better speed things up! (continuing to chop through the vines) Aang, these are just plants! Do you want me to say "please" and "thank you" as I swing my machete back and forth? (slightly annoyed and gesturing with his machete) I'm sure there are lots of things that are alive here, and if we don't wanna wind up getting eaten by them, we need to find Appa as fast as we can. There's no way they can hear us and no way we can see them. We'll have to make camp for the night. Nothing. Just swamp gas. (The gas begins to swirl about them) Look, there's nothing supernatural going on here. I think we should build a fire... (slightly sarcastically) No, I asked the swamp. It said this was fine. (He turns to address a nearby root) Right, swamp? (he grabs the root and begins to shake as he fakes a reply in a funny voice) "No problem, Sokka!" Please, we're all alone out here. (terrified) Right, except for them. Aang! (He is cutting a path in the vines before him with his weapon) Stupid swamp! Dumb, ugly vines! Katara! (Turning to another vine in his way) You think you're so tough, huh? Hello? (Sokka walks forward) Yue? (Sokka grabs the side of his head and looks away) This is just a trick of the light... swamp gas... (he turns around, his back to the ghost) I... hit my head running away last night. I'm going crazy. What do you guys think you're doing! I've been looking all over for you! (sarcastically) Well, there must be a tea party here and we just didn't get our invitations! (again after a pause and looking down) Look, we were all just scared and hungry and our minds were playing tricks on us. That's why we all saw things out here. (turning away) I thought I saw Yue. But, that doesn't prove anything. (Turning back to the others) Look, I think about her all the time, and you saw Mom, someone you miss a lot. (frustrated) It's just a tree. It can't call anyone! For the last time, there's nothing after us (cut to a wide shot of the three standing on the tree root, Aang on the left, Sokka on the right, Katara in the middle) and there's nothing magical happening here. There's someone in there! He's bending the vines! He's the Avatar. Stuff like that happens to us - a lot. (to his friends) See? Completely reasonable. Not a monster (he sheathes his machete as he follows Aang and Katara who have now exited the frame), just a regular guy defending his home. Nothing mystical about it. Sure ya did. It seems real chatty. Sorry to interrupt the lesson, but we still need to Appa and Momo. Hue? (examining his kabob) Tastes just like arctic hen. (Looking up at them) So why were you guys so interested in eating Appa? (Points at the catfish crocodile) You've got plenty of those big things wandering around. Nice Slim! (To his sister in a slightly sanctimonious tone) Well, I hope you realize now that nothing strange was going on here. Just a bunch of greasy people living in a swamp. I told you, we were hungry. I'm eating a giant bug!  That's Avatar stuff, that doesn't count. (To Hue) The only thing I can't figure out is how you made that tornado that sucked us down. (trying to sweep the issue under the carpet) Well, no accounting for weather. Still, there's absolutely nothing mysterious about the swamp.
Zuko: This is humiliating! We're royalty. These people should be giving us whatever we want. We're not performers.

Aang: My staff! Yip, yip! (initially from o.c.) Sorry about your boomerang, Sokka. Avatar Day? There's a holiday for the Avatar. Who knew? Having a huge festival in your honor is great, but frankly, it's just nice to be appreciated. (smiling) That's the biggest me I've ever seen. That party-pooper's my friend!  (calmly, raising his hand in a non-threatening way) No, I'm not, I... It's true. (airbending himself down to where Katara and the Mayor stand) I'm on your side. You think that I... murdered someone...  (cringing in revulsion) Huh! (to everyone) Give me a chance to clear my name. (confidently) I'll gladly stand trial. No problem! How was I supposed to know they wouldn't take Water Tribe money? I can't. I can't do that with people thinking I'm a murderer, either. I need you guys to help prove my innocence.  (shrewdly) That's okay, Sokka. For some reason, I thought you were an expert detective. So you'll help me with my case? (hopefully) You think so? (uncertainly) I don't know... (smiling) You guys are great. Then how can I prove my innocence? Right... evidence. Ladies and gentlemen, I'm about to tell you what really happened. And I will prove it with facts. Fact number one... (Aang blanks) Uh... Oh, yeah... (to the crowd) You see, I have very large feet.  (unpersuasively) Furthermore, your... temple matches your statue. But... I was in a painting at sunset. (wraps it up fast with a big smile) So there you have it! I'm not guilty! (in an uncertain, mock female voice) Hey, everybody. (He drops the fan slightly to reveal his painted face and his eyes blink to a sound effect) Avatar Kyoshi here. (confused) So... what just happened? I said I would face justice, so I will. (calmly) Gee, I'd love to help, but I'm supposed to be boiled in oil.
Katara: My scrolls! Ahhh! There's no time! (cheerfully) That's correct! I hope that's okay. Look! They made a giant Kyoshi float. Aang, look! Hey, what's that guy doing? Why not? Aang helps people. (defensively) Aang would never do something like that. No Avatar would. (pointing an accusing finger at the crowd) And it's not fair for you all to question his honor! (disdainfully) I think what "Master Swish" is trying to say is that you're supposed to be out saving the world. You can't do that locked up in here. (playing along) Yeah! Back home he was famous for solving the mystery of the missing seal jerky. (getting worked up) So if they were built at the same time, that means... That's a big hole in the mayor's story, but it's not enough to prove Aang's innocence. Where'd you get that? He couldn't be here, Koko. Oyagi! Aang is in jail. The town of Chin says he murdered their leader in a past life. (touching the kimono) She had exquisite taste. These were her boots? Her feet must have been enormous! (with realization) Wait a minute... big feet? (cut to a brief vision of the small footprint by the Chin temple) Little footprints? (cut back to the present, then happily) There's no way! (with mock respect) You're right. I'm sorry. Please. (unimpressed) Brilliant, Sokka. They point east. So the sun must have been in the west. (formally, and in voice over at first) Honorable mayor, (cut to a shot of the kids and the Mayor at Aang's jail) we've prepared a solid defense for the Avatar. We did an investigation and found some very strong evidence. Mayor Tong, I'd like for the court to hear one last testimony. This isn't just any witness. I'm going to call... (gestures widely with her arms) Avatar Kyoshi herself! Well, she is Aang's past life. Maybe wearing her stuff will trigger something. (pleading) Please! If you could just wait one more second, I'm sure Kyoshi will be here. Uhh... you kind of confessed. Sorry. (worried) Community service! Please stop on community service. (halfheartedly) Happy Avatar Day, everyone.
Sokka: (spitting and startled) What are you doing in my mouth! Momo, you need to be a little more sensitive to my boundaries. Come on, come on, come on! Ahhh! Wait, my boomerang! Oh, I see. There's time to get your scrolls and time to get your staff, but no time for my boomerang?  (resigned) Oh. I feel like I've lost part of my identity. Imagine if you lost your arrow, or if Katara lost her... (cut to Katara, looking confused) ... hair loopies. (picks up basket, then, dejected) I used to be boomerang guy... And here comes Avatar Roku. And it's nice to appreciate their deep-fried festival food. Now a torch; that's a nice prop. It's bright, dangerous... (inhales deeply)... smells manly. But I'm not sure I could carry it off. So some people don't like you. Big deal! There's a whole nation of firebenders who hate you. Now let's bust you out of here. (upbeat) Sure you can! A little... swish, swish, swish! Airbending slice! ... and we're on our way. How're we gonna do that? The crime happened over three hundred years ago. (self-importantly) Well, I guess I could be classified as such. (bragging) Everyone wanted to blame it on a polar leopard, but I figured out that it was Old Man Jarco wearing polar leopard boots. See, a real eight hundred pound polar leopard would have left much deeper tracks. Okay, I guess I am pretty good. Fine. But I'm gonna need some new props. I'm ready. What? This temple and this statue were cut from the same stone. And we know that the statue was built after Chin died. (interrupting) Shhh! I wanna solve it! That means Kyoshi never set foot in this temple. You're right.  We need to go to Kyoshi Island. (looking ridiculous with his hat and pipe) They say it was Kyoshi. (with feigned casualness) So, uh... what's Suki up to? Is she around? (sadly) Oh, well... that's great. (musing with an affected voice) These fans... they were her weapons, no? Ahem. (Sokka clears his throat, interrupting her) Special outfit Hat and pipe These things mean anything to you? (dramatically) Aha! There's no way Kyoshi could have made that footprint and therefore there is nothing linking her to the crime scene! (spits out his pipe at the surprise information) Three hundred and seventy years... wait, (grabs Oyagi by the lapels) are you sure it was today? This ceremony didn't take place at sunrise; it took place at sunset. Look at the shadows.  (shoves Katara out of the way) If Kyoshi was in the ceremony at sunset, she couldn't have been in Chin committing the crime. (points his pipe dramatically and the magnifying glass swing in front of his eye) She has an alibi! (quietly) You can do it, Aang. Just remember the evidence. (quietly prompting) The footprints! (aside to Katara, both still smiling) He's dead. (whispers) What are you doing? (adjusting his magnifying glass and accepting Katara's reason) I do believe in the power of stuff. (happily) Boomerang! You do always come back! What is this? This is by far the worst town we've ever been to.
Zuko: (walking away) What does it matter where they came from? (avoids the question) Do you like your new teapot? There's no honor for me without the Avatar. (abruptly) Then there is no hope at all. Uncle, I thought a lot about what you said. (without malice, but also without hesitation) It's helped me realize something. We no longer have anything to gain by traveling together. I need to find my own way.

Aang: (voice over) Look, there's a coupon on the back. The first lesson is free. (disappointed) He's not the one. Excuse me, (runs over to the boys, cut to wider shot of the three) but where is this earthbending tournament exactly?  How did you get them to tell you? Hey, front row seats! I wonder why no one else is sitting here. (hesitantly) I don't know. Bumi said I need a teacher who listens to the earth. He's just listening to his big muscles. What do you think, Sokka? I think she is. She waited, (turns to Katara) and listened. I will! I don't really want to fight you. I want to talk to you. Please, wait! Please listen! I need an earthbending teacher, and I think it's supposed to be you. Wait! If we want to find The Blind Bandit, the Earthbending Academy is a good place to start. We need to talk to her. Do you guys know where she lives? (almost lost in thought) That's because we're asking about the wrong person. In my vision, I saw a girl in a white dress with a pet flying boar. Know anybody like that? Flying boar is good enough for me. (to his friends) Let's check it out. That's the flying boar from my vision. Come on. How did you know it was me? (airbending himself to his feet) Well, a crazy king told me I had to find an earthbender who listens to the earth. And then I had a vision in a magic swamp and... Allow me. Then she must be a great earthbender, (cut to a view of Toph's feet, Aang continues in voice over) probably good enough to teach someone else.  Ow! Oh, I'm sure she's better than you think she is. What's your problem? Good night, buddy. That's amazing. Is that why you became The Blind Bandit? Then why stay here where you're not happy? (pause, then with a smile) You could come with us. Go. I'll be ok. Hit it harder! I'm sorry, Toph. Not like her. Toph! What are you doing here?  You're gonna be a great teacher, Toph. Okay.
Katara: Then you should get it. You deserve something nice. (slightly annoyed) Alright, then don't. Who knows? This Master Yu could be the earthbending teacher you've been looking for. (in a comforting tone) I'll take care of this. Hey strong guys, wait up! You ready to find an earthbending teacher? Because we're going to Earth Rumble 6! Oh, (looks over her shoulder coyly) a girl has her ways. This is just gonna be a bunch of guys chuckin' rocks at each other, isn't it? How about The Boulder? He's got some good moves. She can't really be blind. (cut to a close up of the Bandit's eyes that pans right) It's just part of her character, right?  (incredulously) How did she do that? (smacking her brother) Don't boo at him! (sarcastically) That is a big relief. Yeah, I didn't think so. Let me handle this. (pointing at student #2 and saying angrily) You're not telling us everything! Hey, I've got my eye on you. You're the one whose bag matches his belt. (cutting Aang off) What Aang is trying to say is, he's the Avatar, and if he doesn't master earthbending soon he won't be able to defeat the Fire Lord. (voice over) "If you want to see your daughter again, bring (cut to a pan right of Toph's parents and Yu) 500 gold pieces to the arena." (cut to a shot of Katara and Sokka, the open scroll still in her hand) It's signed "Xin Fu and The Boulder." (turning to address Lao) We're going with you. What about Aang? Toph, there's too many of them. We need an earthbender. We need you! Don't worry. We'll find you a teacher. (cut to a profile shot of the two, the air blows Katara's braids) There are plenty of amazing earthbenders out there.
Sokka: (voice over) It's pricey, but I really do like it. (turns to her with a smile) I do, don't I? (turns back with an exaggerated gesture) But no. It's too expensive, I shouldn't. You know what? I'm gonna get it. Ha, ha! Oh, I got to remember that one. What was I thinking? I don't need a new bag. Why'd you let me buy this?  I guess that's why. (hopefully) That's what I paid for. (excitedly) Ha ha! Whoo! (giving thumbs down) Boo! Boo! Go back to the Fire Nation! (looking at Fire Nation Man's impact point) Yeah! Whoo! The Boulder knows how to put the hurt in the dirt! (cut to a close up of Sokka looking insane and making taunting faces) Yeah! Whoo! I think she is... (yells) going down! (crying) No! (cupping his hands to his mouth) Go Aang! Avenge The Boulder! Boo! No talking! Way to go, champ! I gotta admit, now I'm really glad I bought this bag. It matches the belt perfectly. Nicely done. (whispers with a smile) Water Tribe. (whining) Don't answer to twinkle toes. It's not manly! Look, we all have to do our part to win this war. And yours is to teach Aang earthbending. Whoever took Aang and Toph left this. (somberly) I can't believe it. (screaming) I have the Boulder's autograph! Here's your money. Now let them go. I'm trying! (he and Katara look at each quickly) Well, we'd better get out of here - before your dad changes his mind again. Sorry.
Toph: (pointing at the Boulder and in a mocking tone) Sounds to me like you're scared, Boulder. (points again at her opponent) Whenever you're ready...The Pebble. (throws her head back) Ha ha ha! Do people really want to see two little girls fighting out here? Somebody's a little light on his feet. What's your fighting name, (cut to Aang, the Bandit continues in voice over) The Fancy Dancer? Where'd you go? There you are! Whoever you are, just leave me alone. What are you doing here, twinkle toes? How did you find me? Not my problem. Now get out of here or I'll call the guards. Guards! Guards, help! I thought I heard someone. I got scared. What's your problem? Relax. Look, I'm sorry about dinner. Let's call a truce, ok? Even though I was born blind, I've never had a problem seeing. I see with earthbending. It's kind of like seeing with my feet. I can feel the vibrations in the earth, and I can see where everything is. You, that tree, even those ants. (frustrated) My parents don't understand. They've always treated me like I was helpless. Yeah. They're my parents. Where else am I supposed to go? Yeah. You guys get to go wherever you want. No one telling you what to do, that's the life. It's just not my life.  We're being ambushed. You think you're so tough...  ...why don't you come up here so I can smack that grin off your face? Yes, I can.  (pointing at the camera) Let him go. I beat you all before, (making a sweeping motion with her hand) and I'll do it again. Wait.  (turning her head left and looking o.c.) They're mine. Dad, I know it's hard for you to see me this way, but the obedient little helpless blind girl that you think I am just isn't me. I love fighting. I love being an earthbender. And I'm really, really good at it. I know I've kept my life secret from you, but you were keeping me secret from the whole world. You were doing it to protect me. But I'm twelve years old and I've never had a real friend. So now that you see who I really am, I hope it doesn't change the way you feel about me. (hopeful) It has? But dad! I'm sorry, too. Goodbye, Aang. My dad changed his mind. He said I was free to travel the world. Good idea. (slyly) Speaking of which, I want to show you something. Now we're even.  Um, I'll take the belt back. Ow!

Zuko: Could I get some water, a bag of feed, and something hot to eat? No. (turning around and putting his hand on his sword hilt) No. (turning back to the merchant) Maybe a chicken flew over. No kidding. I'm, uh... I can't. I should be moving on. Uh-uh. Far away. Hey mom, want to see how Azula feeds turtle ducks? Stupid turtle duck, why'd she do that? (emphatically) I am not cart wheeling. I don't care. I don't want to play with you. (with a gesture of frustration) Girls are crazy! (reading the inscription) "Never give up without a fight." (he takes the swords and begins to demonstrate moves for the boy) Two halves of a single weapon. Don't think of them as separate, because they're not. They're just two different parts of the same whole. Trouble. No. I need to move on. Here. (offers him his dagger) I want you to have this. Read the inscription. The other one. (getting up, his cheeks flaming) Put an apple on your head and we'll find out how good I am! Does that mean we won the war? What are you talking about? Uncle's not a quitter. (angry) How do you know what he should do? (looking down, sadly) He's probably just sad his only kid is gone... forever. Great Grandfather won, because... (struggling)  I'd like to demonstrate what I've been learning.  (dejected) I failed. What are you...? (sarcastically) Ha-ha, Azula. Nice try. Liar! Stop it, you're lying! (holding his blanket for security) Dad would never do that to me. (almost chanting) Azula always lies... Azula always lies... Azula always lies... I'll get your son back. (in a threatening tone) Let the kid go. It doesn't matter who I am, but I know who you are. You're not soldiers. (cut to a shot of Zuko's face) You're bullies. Freeloaders, abusing your power. Mostly over women and kids. You don't want Lee in your army. You're sick cowards messing with a family who's already lost one son to the war. (sleepily) Mom? (with confidence) My name is Zuko. Son of Ursa and Fire Lord Ozai. (sheathing his swords) Prince of the Fire Nation and heir to the throne. It's yours. You should have it. Mom? Mom, mom!  (slightly panicked) Where's mom? Not funny, Azula. You're sick. And I want my knife back, now. Where is she?
