Azula: (whispers to Ty Lee) Watch this.  Mom, can you make Zuko play with us? We need equal teams to play a game. You won't have to. Cart wheeling's not a game, (under her breath) dumb dumb. We are brother and sister. (her voice becoming sickly sweet) It's important for us to spend time together. Don't you think so, mom? (voice over) Here's the way it goes.  Now what you do is try to knock the apple off the other person's head. Like this. (to Ty Lee) See, I told you it would work. If Uncle doesn't make it back from war, then dad would be next in line to be Fire Lord, wouldn't he? I still think our dad would make a much better Fire Lord than (looking at the doll with disdain) his royal tea loving kookiness. You waste all your time playing with knives. You're not even good. (getting up and walking over to him) By the way, Uncle's coming home. No. It mean's Uncle's a quitter and a loser. Oh yes, he is. He found out his son died and he just fell apart. (leaning against a nearby pillar) A real general would stay and burn Ba Sing Se to the ground, not lose the battle and come home crying. (mocking) Fire Lord Azulon. Can't you just call him "Grandfather"? He's not exactly the powerful Fire Lord he used to be. Someone will probably end up talking his place soon. Because even though his army was outnumbered, he cleverly calculated his advantages. The enemy was downwind and there was a drought. Their defenses burned to a crisp in minutes. (whispering to Zuko) You'll never catch up. Shh! (in a sing-song voice) Dad's going to kill you. (normal voice) Really, (turning to look at him with a leer) he is. Fine, don't believe me, but I heard everything. Grandfather said dad's punishment should fit his crime. (imitating Azulon) "You must know the pain of losing a first born son, by sacrificing your own!" (coming and sitting on his bed) I'm only telling you for your own good. I know, maybe you could find a nice Earth Kingdom family to adopt you. (innocently) I don't know. No one knows. Oh, and last night, Grandpa passed away. Who's going to make me? Mom?

Aang: That's not gross; it's just a part of spring.  You know, rebirth, flowers blooming, and Appa gets a new coat! (Dropping into the shot from atop Appa, he has arranged the fur on his face to form a large mustache and beard.) And a great beard! (Leaping down to lift the basket off him.) Sorry! What is it? Better safe than sorry. (Hesitant) Should we... do something? Okay, okay, you both need to calm down. I... can see that. (urgently in voice over) I don't think so, Sokka. I don't know, but this time I'm going to make sure we lose 'em. (Cut to an over head shot of Aang, Katara, and Toph all lying down.) Come on guys, there's something after us and we don't even know what (covers his head with the top of his shirt, muffling his voice) or who it is. That's impossible. There's no way they could have tracked us. Maybe we should face them. Find out who they are. Who knows, maybe they're friendly. Appa, yip yip! Sokka, we'll be okay. (Cut to Appa flying over the hills with the rising sun in the background) We can't keep flying forever. (yawns) So, what's the plan? Appa fell asleep! Wake up, buddy! Appa's exhausted. Alright, alright! Everyone's exhausted. Let's just get some rest. No, no! She's not blaming you! What? You're blaming Appa?! How dare you blame Appa! He saved your life three times today! If there's anyone to blame, it's you! You're always talking about how you carry your own weight, but you're not! He is! Appa's carrying your weight! (Camera zooms in on him) He never had a problem flying when (cut to Toph from over Aang's shoulder) it was just the three of us! What did I just do!? I can't believe I yelled at my earthbending teacher. Now she's gone. I have a plan. Toph was right. Appa's fur was leaving a trail right to us. But now that he's clean, no more trail! (Cut to him standing next to Appa's wet head) He'll be fine as long as we leave his saddle and all our stuff here. (He moves to a pile of fur and places it into a bag) I'm going to use Appa's fur to make a fake trail and lead the tank off course. Alright, you've caught up with me. Now who are you and what do you want? So what now? (standing up) I'm not running. Zuko! (laughs a bit) Zuzu?  Katara!
Katara: (Lifting her right foot out of the fur and balancing on her left) Oh, gross! Ah, the beauty of spring. (Appa, who sticks his tongue out to reveal it's covered in fur, sneezes, blowing fur everywhere.) Stop, Appa, stop!  (unamused) I'm just glad we finally have another girl in the group because you two are disgusting. So, Toph, usually when setting up camp we try to divide up the work. (Cut back to her, Aang and Sokka can be seen working again in the background) Well, actually, what I'm trying to say is, uh, some of us might fetch water while someone else might set up the fire pit or put up the tent. (Momo flies down dropping nuts into Katara's hand and flutters by her head.) Even Momo does his fair share. (Cut back to her, as she becomes steadily more annoyed) Well, that's great for you, but we still need to finish... Never mind. Hey Toph, I wanted to apologize for earlier. I think we're all just a little tired and getting on each others' nerves. (angrily) I meant all of us. (half-heartedly) Goodnight. Should we leave? What is that thing? Actually, can you help us unload? Well, yeah. (Cut to Toph while Katara approaches her from the right) That and everything else. You're a part of our team now and... (Hand on her hips.) That's not the point.  Ever since joining us you've been nothing but selfish and unhelpful. Sugar Queen! (Toph closes off her rock tent by brining a slab of earth up to cover the opening to Katara.) D-Did you just slam the door in my face!   How can you be so infuriating!  (Cut to the back of her head) Both? (Shouting, turning quickly to show a hysterical face.) I'm completely calm! The stars sure are beautiful tonight.  Too bad you can't see them, Toph! Seriously, what is that thing? (Cut to her as she pulls a bag close to lay her head on it) That's good, because Toph wasn't going to help anyway. It could be Zuko. We haven't seen him since the North Pole. (jokingly) What's wrong with ponytails, ponytail? Well, it certainly tells the other warriors that you're fun and perky! Let's get out of here! It's those three girls from Omashu! I can't believe those girls followed us all the way from Omashu. Are you kidding? The crazy blue firebending and the flying daggers are bad enough, but last time we saw them (Cut to her alone) one of those girls did something that took my bending away. That's scary. (Cut to shot of her and Toph) Every time we land, those girls are there, so we'll just have to keep flying. I'm sure we'll come up with something after a short nap. Of course, we could have gotten some sleep earlier (Cut to shot of Toph on her stomach asleep on the ground) if Toph didn't have such issues. (Cut to her with an annoyed yet sarcastically placid face) I'm just saying, maybe if you helped out earlier we could've set up our camp faster and gotten some sleep and then maybe we wouldn't be in this situation! No, I'm blaming her! I know. We're all just trying to get used to each other, and I was so mean to her. (Sarcastically) Thanks, Sokka. We need to find Toph and apologize. Are you sure that he's okay to fly? How did they find us? He's too tired! Come on, Appa, just a little further! (voice over) You did it, Appa!  (in a frenetic voice) Well, you know! (with a genuine smile) Thanks. Zuko, I can help!
Sokka: That's not grass. Appa's shedding. It's not that bad, Katara. (He stands to reveal he has piled the fur on his head to form a tall pillar of hair in a very Marge Simpson like fashion.) It makes a great wig! Aaaah! Your powers of perception are frightening. Hey, I'm just enjoying the show. Hey, how is a guy supposed to sleep with all this yelling and earthquaking!  Well, how far away is it? (Covering his head again, muffling his voice slightly) Maybe we can close our eyes just for a few minutes. Okay, forget about setting up camp. I'm finding the softest pile of dirt and going to sleep. (Cut to him in his bag from the front, his head perched up on the ground.) Oh, just some angry freak with a ponytail who's tracked us all over the world.  (gesturing to his hair, speaking in a muffled voice) This is a warrior's wolf tail. Anyway, whoever's chasing us, they couldn't have followed us here. So... now would everyone just (cut to him with finger to mouth) shhh!  Aww, don't tell me... Always the optimist. Actually, Toph, there's four of us. (Dropping his stance and making a furious expression at Toph, while shouting in an equally furious way) I can still fight! Well, we wanted to find out who they were. We found out. (Sheathing his boomerang and turning around.) Now let's get out of here. Oh no, the sun is rising! (Cut to shot of the basket, Sokka sitting at the lip of it gesturing to the sun off screen) We've been up all night with no sleep. (Speaking desperately, shot cuts to him making erratic arm movements and crazy facial expressions) Are you sure!? I've never not slept before! What if I fall asleep now and something happens? And something always happens! Yes! Sleep! Okay, we've put a lot of distance between us and them. The plan now is to follow Appa's lead and get some sleep. Wait. (Cut to him drinking from a cup, the other two visible over his shoulder) Yeah, you two were pretty much jerks. No problem. Okay, but what are we going to do about the tank full of dangerous ladies chasing us? Toph couldn't have made it too far. (Momo begins screeching.) What is it, Momo... oh no! Katara! Appa, come on! We need to go faster! Not good, not good!  We just need to make it across that river! (voice over) We made it! We're safe! Good try, but no. How ya doing? Thanks Appa. I don't know what we'd do without you.
Zuko: Yes, (he stands and throws his straw coolie hat away) I really do. Back off, Azula! He's mine! Uncle... Get away from us! Leave!
Azula: The Avatar is trying to give us the slip. (Pointing at the tree tops) You two head in that direction and keep your eye out for the bison. (Cut to shot of the fur trail again) I'll follow this trail. You mean you haven't guessed? You don't see the family resemblance? Here's a hint. (In an imitation of Zuko's voice) I must find the Avatar to restore my honor. (Cut to a shot of Aang who is nonplussed, then back to Azula) It's okay. You can laugh. It's funny. Now... Now it's over. You're tired and you have no place to go. You can run, but I'll catch you. Do you really want to fight me? I was wondering when you'd show up, Zuzu. I'm not going anywhere. Well, look at this. Enemies and traitors all working together. I'm done. (she raises her hands in a gesture of surrender) I know when I'm beaten. You got me. A princess surrenders with honor.
Toph: Hey, you guys picked a great campsite. (cut to a shot of Toph's feet in the pile of white fur) The grass is so soft. Excuse me, (She walks in between the two breaking them apar.) does anyone have a razor... (She lifts both arms to reveal a mass of white fur emerging out of both of her sleeves, under her arms) ...because I've got some hairy pits! (Cut to her lying down) Hey, don't worry about me, I'm good to go. (Cut back to her as she takes the straw from her mouth) Katara, I'm fine. I can carry my own weight. I don't need a fire, I've already collected my own food, and look, (Now sitting upright, she uses her earthbending to create a stone tent.) my tent's all set up. (Irritated) I don't understand. What's the problem here? Yeah, you do seem pretty tired. Well, goodnight.  There's something coming toward us! It feels like an avalanche... (Aang, Katara, and Sokka all enter the shot and stand behind her) But also not like an avalanche. Ahh, land, sweet land! (Using earthbending to propel herself to her feet and slinging her bag over her shoulder.) See you guys in the morning! (Cut to her looking back.) Really? You need me to help unload Sokka's funky-smelling sleeping bag? (Irritated) Look. (Pointing at Katara) I didn't ask you to help unload my stuff. I'm carrying my own weight.  What? (Doing a half turn and pointing at Katara again.) Look here, sugar queen, (Drops arm and continues, Katara makes a gesture like she wants to interject.) I gave up everything I had so that I could teach Aang earthbending, so don't you talk to me about being selfish! That thing is back! And how does it keep finding us? (Cut to her laying face up with her head on her bag.) Oh, I didn't realize baby still needed someone to tuck her in bed. Who's Zuko? I can feel it with my own two feet! We can take 'em. Three on three. Oh. I'm sorry, I didn't count you. You know, no bending and all. Okay. Three on three plus Sokka. I still think we could've taken them. Don't know... too tired to think. (shouting) What's going on!  (Screaming, and springing awake slamming her hands on the ground causing it to break a little) What!? No! I want to hear what Katara has to say. You think I have issues? You're blaming me for this!? Hey!  I never asked you for diddly doo da. I carry my own weight!  Besides, if there's anyone to blame, it's sheddy over here! Yeah! You wanna know how they keep finding us? He's leaving a trail everywhere we go! I'm outta here. (she takes it) You seem a little too old. I know what you're thinking. I look like I can't handle being by myself. You wouldn't even let me pour my own cup of tea.  People see me and think I'm weak. They want to take care of me. But I can take care of myself by myself. (laughs) So, where is your nephew? Is he lost? So... now you're following him. Your nephew is very lucky, even if he doesn't know it. (standing up) Thank you. No, thank you for what you said. It helped me. Oh, and about your nephew? Maybe you should tell him that you need him too. I thought you guys could use a little help.

Aang: Today's the day! Can you believe it? After all that time searching for a teacher, I'm finally starting earthbending! And this place... i-it's perfect! Don't you think, Sokka? Oh, you're still sleeping, huh? (whispering) Sorry! Good morning, sifu Toph. Well, if you think I should... So what move are you going to teach me first? Rockalanche? (He shoves his fist down to illustrate the move.) The trembler? (He pretends like he's has someone in a hold and trembles slightly.) Oh! Maybe I can learn to make a whirlpool out of land! Sounds good! Sounds good! Like a rock. Got it. I'm ready. Maybe there's another way. (He takes up a fighting stance and begins to walk toward the boulder.) What if I came at the boulder from a different angle? Whoa! (sarcastically) Yeah, thanks Katara! I guess I just panicked. I don't know what to say. I know. I'm sorry. (sadly) No. I don't think I do. Yeah... that sounds good. (dejectedly) I don't want to talk about it. (frustrated) I know I know I know I know, I get it, alright! (He lets the ball of water fall back into the pond.) I need to face it head-on, like a rock. But I just can't do it! I don't know why I can't, but I can't. I guess it's earth. Thanks, Katara. Sifu Katara. As a matter of fact, I don't mind. I'm happy to share anything I have. Actually, I'd prefer if you didn't... (There's another crack as Toph smashes another nut, and Aang cringes.) That's an antique, hand crafted by the monks... (There's another crack and Aang cringes again, growing more frustrated.) It's a delicate instrument! Ohmmmm... (annoyed) Meditating here! We'll find him faster if we split up. Sokka! Are you okay? (scratching his head pensively) Hmm... I bet I can airbend you out of here. (forlornly) I can't. I can't do it. I can't do that either. It would just be really... uncomfortable. Thanks, Sokka. (Cut to behind the two. Aang crouches down.) This whole earthbending thing really has me confused. There's so much pressure. Everyone expects me to get it right away. It puts me in a really awkward position. If I try, I fail. But if I don't try, I'm never going to get it. I feel like I'm caught between a rock and a hard place. Aww, what a cute name for a little baby sabertooth mooselion cub.  It's hard to tell before their giant teeth and horns grow in. Whatcha doin' out here, little guy? Did you lose your mama? (nervously) Hey, there... we found your cub! (He smiles and raises the baby into the air. The baby yawns. The mother growls and Aang puts the baby on the ground. It runs to its mother and then passed her into the bushes, squealing.) See? We have no problem with you! We're friendly.  Oh no! (Aang leaps up on a rock outcropping away from Sokka. He cups his hands around his mouth and begins to shout at the mooselion.) Whoo-hoo! Look at me! (determined) I won't. What? You were there the whole time?  (angrily) Why didn't you do something? Sokka was in trouble! I was in trouble! You could've gotten him out and helped us get away! (forcefully) Enough! I want my staff back! (still angry) What? But... (happily) I can't believe it!  No problem, Sokka! (cutting Sokka off) Hey, Katara, look what I can do! Appa! Appa! I can earthbend now! The key is being completely rooted! Physically and mentally unmovable!
Katara: (sleepily) Hey... you never call me sifu Katara. I don't understand what went wrong. (She glances at Toph and points at Aang.) He did it exactly the way you did. I've been training Aang for a while now. He really responds well to a positive teaching experience. Lots of encouragement and praise. Kind words. If he's doing something wrong, maybe a gentle nudge in the right direction.  Sorry, Toph, but are you sure this is really the best way to teach Aang earthbending? (nervously) Heh. Aang, it's no big deal. You'll take a break and try earthbending again when you're ready. Besides, you still have a lot of waterbending to work on, okay? You know this block you're having is only temporary, right? You do know that's the problem, don't you? If you face this issue instead of avoiding it... Aang, if fire and water are opposites, then what's the opposite of air? That's why it's so hard for you to get this. (Cut to a view of Aang's reflection that then pans up to show Aang himself.) You're working with your natural opposite. But you'll figure it out. (Cut back to Katara.) I know you will. (Katara reaches behind her and breaks off a reed. She hurls it at Aang without warning.) Think fast! Excellent. You have the reflexes of a waterbending master. Hey Aang, have you seen... It's important. It's almost sundown and Sokka isn't back yet. I think we should search for him. You found him!  You did it! I knew you would! (She glances at Toph.) You tried the positive reinforcement, didn't you?
Sokka: Rock beats airbender! You're awfully cute, but unfortunately for you, you're made of meat. Just a bit closer... Gotcha! (He falls deeper into the crevice and drops his sword. He's stuck up to his shoulders. He struggles to free himself but doesn't budge.) You are a lucky little meat creature. You probably think I deserve this, don't you? (The baby mooselion peers over Sokka's forehead and looks at him.) Look, I'm sorry I hunted you, but that's just the natural order of things! Big things eat smaller things, nothing personal. But this time it didn't work out that way. I admit it. You're cute. (The mooselion begins licking its paws.) Okay, you've convinced me. If I get out of this alive, it's a comically correct vegetarian existence for me. No meat. Even though meat is so tasty.  (offscreen) Hey, it looks like my karma is already paying off! That's okay! I got it! Now come back, boomerang.  Okay, karma person or thing, whoever's in charge of this stuff, if I can just get out of this situation alive, I will give up meat and sarcasm. Okay? OW! (The band holding Sokka's hair in the ponytail comes off after a strong tug by the baby mooselion and Sokka's hair becomes a fuzzy mess.) That's all I got! It's pretty much my whole identity! Sokka, the meat and sarcasm guy! (The baby mooselion exits to the right.) But I'm willing to be Sokka the veggies and straight talk fellow! ...Deal? Aang! Thank goodness! Have you got any meat? (grunts) Stop, stop! You're going to pull my fingers off and I don't think the rest of me is coming!  Seriously, Aang, I know you're new at it, but I could use a little earthbending here. How about it? (annoyed) If you can't earthbend me out of here, go get Toph. You can't? Why not? Uncomfortable? (Cut to a close-up of Sokka in the crevice.) Well, I wouldn't want to make you feel uncomfortable. Awkward position... I think I know the feeling. Hmm. How about that. (He motions to the mooselion.) Aang, this is my friend Foo Foo Cuddlypoops. Foo Foo Cuddlypoops, Aang. Really? He looks nothing like a sabertooth mooselion. (frantic) Aang, this is bad! You gotta get me outta here!  This is really bad! (Cut to Aang, who looks increasingly worried as Sokka speaks.) Please, Aang! You have to earthbend me out, there's no other way! (terrified) Please don't leave me again. What are you doing here? Aww, this is really a wonderful, touching moment. So, could you get me out of her so I can give you both a big, snuggly hug? Yeah, no crushing, please. The whole time that I was in that hole, not knowing if I would live or die, it makes a man think about what's really important. I realized...
Zuko: Uncle! You were unconscious. Azula did this to you.  It was a surprise attack. I hope I made it the way you like it. So uncle, I've been thinking. It's only a matter of time before I run into Azula again. I'm going to need to know more advanced firebending if I want to stand a chance against her. I know what you're going to say she's my sister and I should be trying to get along with her. I see. That's why we're drinking tea To calm the mind. I'm ready to try it!  Why can't I do it? Instead of lightning, it keeps exploding in my face! Like everything always does! (frustrated and enraged) What turmoil? But I don't feel any shame at all! I'm as proud as ever! Well... my life has been nothing but humbling lately.  Why are you telling me these things? All this four elements talk is sounding like Avatar stuff. (excitedly) You can teach me to redirect lightning? I think so.  Great! I'm ready to try it with real lightning! (annoyed) I thought that was the point (Cut to Iroh, whose eyes twitch as Zuko continues.) you teaching me how to protect myself from it. Well, if you won't help me, I'll find my own lightning. (defiantly) You've always thrown everything you could at me! Well, I can take it! And now I can give it back! (Lightning strikes in the distance. Cut to a close-up of Zuko's face as the rain pours off of it. He glances up at the sky.) Come on! Strike me! You've never held back before!
Toph: Good morning, earthbending student! Sorry, snoozles. We'll do our earthbending as quietly as we can. Let's start with "move a rock". The key to earthbending is your stance. (She lowers herself and widens the distance between her feet. Aang tries to imitate her.) You've got to be steady and strong. Rock is a stubborn element. (She shoves Aang, causing him to stumble to the side.) If you're going to move it, you've got to be like a rock yourself.  Good. Now the actual motion of this one is pretty simple. (She lunges forward and punches, causing the boulder to shoot off into the distance, slamming into the side of the canyon.) Okay, you ready to give it a try? No, that's the problem. You've got to stop thinking like an airbender. (She knocks her fist lightly against the side of Aang's head. He winces slightly.) There's no different angle, no clever solution, no trickity trick that's going to move that rock. (She shoves Aang. He cries out and falls down offscreen.) You've got to face it head on. And when I say head on, I mean like this! Thanks, Katara. A gentle nudge. I'll try that. (Cut to Toph shouting.) Keep your knees high, twinkletoes! Rocklike! Rocklike! This time we're going to try something a little different. Instead of moving a rock, you're going to stop a rock. (She walks off screen, then quickly lunges toward Aang, who recoils slightly.) Get in your horse stance! (Aang widens his stance. Cut to Toph standing in front of Aang with a trail leading up an angled cliff behind her.) I'm going to roll that boulder down at you. (She points up the hill at a large boulder sitting at the top of the trail.) If you have the attitude of an earthbender, you'll stay in your stance and stop the rock. (Cut to a close-up of Aang's face. His mouth opens and he looks surprised and scared. Katara looks on with concern in the background. Cut back to Toph.) Like this. I'm glad you said something. (She reaches down and grabs Aang's belt.) Actually, there is a better way. (She jerks off Aang's belt and blindfolds him with it.) This way he'll really have to sense the vibrations of the boulder to stop it. Thank you, Katara! There's nothing to say. You blew it. You had a perfect stance and perfect form but when it came right down to it you didn't have the guts.  Yeah, you are sorry. If you're not tough enough to stop the rock, then you could at least give it the pleasure of smushing you instead of jumping out of the way like a jelly-boned wimp! Now, do you have what it takes to face that rock like an earthbender?!  Yeah, whatever, go splash around until you feel better.  Aang! I found these nuts in your bag. (She holds up a green bag with a crudely-drawn picture of Aang's face on it.) I figured you wouldn't mind. And besides, even if you did, you're too much of a pushover to do anything about it. You know, I'm really glad you feel that way, because I also have this great new nutcracker. (in a mocking tone) It's not the only delicate instrument around here. Just enjoying the show. Pretty much. I guess it just didn't occur to me. Do it now. Earthbend, twinkletoes. You just stood your ground against a crazy beast, and even more impressive, you stood your ground against me. You've got the stuff. DO IT! (excitedly) You did it! You're an earthbender. Actually, you should probably let me do that. You're still a little new to this. You might accidentally crush him. Yep. It worked wonders.

Aang: Shhh! I know you can see underground, but don't ruin the surprise. Just watch. (watching as the prairie dog descends back into the hole) Heheheha, yeah! I'm putting an orchestra together. (Looking up at Sokka) I'm learning the elements as fast as I can. (Cut to a close up of Aang.) I practice hard everyday with Toph and Katara. I've been training my arrows off. (voice over) Your turn, Katara. (cut to a shot from the side of Aang holding the map open and Katara looking at it) Where would you like to go on your mini-vacation?  Oh yeah, I've been there. It's a pristine natural ice spring, and I usually don't use the word pristine. It's one of nature's wonders. Must have changed ownership since I was here.  (looking up at the man) No worries, I clean up easy. Thanks. I try. The southern temple. (nervously) Uh, are fruit pies an agricultural product? Wow, shouldn't be too hard to find a place like this out here. (petting Appa) Don't worry buddy. I'm not making you go underground ever again. You can stay out here with Toph. Nothing. We just like architecture. What do you have against humans? Ow. (cut to a close up of Aang) Uh, yeah, I'll vouch. We will not abuse the knowledge in your library, good spirit. (cut to a shot from the side of everyone standing on the bridge) You have my word. Uh, oh, I know! (pulls a scroll from his shirt collar and presents it, revealing it to be a Fire Nation wanted poster of the Avatar. The sound of a trumpet plays to give dramatic effect.) Ha!  Hey, look at these weird lion turtle things. I always knew I was special. Sokka, where are you going? Firebender. Wow, I gotta hand it to you Sokka. You picked the best mini-vacation, for sure. Great, you must have broken it. (pleading) We had no choice. Please, we're just desperate to protect the people we love. What are you doing? We've gotta get back to the surface. Why are we doing this?  You can't possibly check every single date. Come on, eclipse! Where's Appa?
Katara: Yeah. What's wrong with having a little fun in our downtime? Alright, we'll finish our vacations, and then we'll look for Sokka's intelligence. (placing her finger on the map) How about the Misty Palms Oasis? That sounds refreshing. (voice over) You've made a lot of trips into the desert. (giving Sokka's head a small shove) I think he means they look like actual foxes, Sokka. It shouldn't be this hard to spot a giant ornate building from the air. (disappointedly) Forget it. It's obviously not what we're looking for. The building in this drawing is enormous. You got something against libraries? Oh, right. Sorry. I have an authentic waterbending scroll. Aang, did you know in a past life, you were left handed? They destroyed everything having to do with the Fire Nation. Maybe these dials represent dates and times. (points to the dials) Sokka, try entering that date from the parchment you took. Hey wait, what happened to the sun? That makes sense. (Cut to a close shot of Sokka and Aang as Katara walks in from the right.) I mean, think of what the lunar eclipse at the North Pole did to the waterbenders. This is huge. He's sinking the building! We've gotta get out of here! (voice over) Sokka, let's go! Don't be stupid, we'll find out later. But- (voice over) Hurry, Sokka! Just go!
Sokka: (voice over) What's out here?  Orchestra, huh? Well la dee da. This is great and all, but don't we have more important things to worry about? We should be making plans.  There's no time for vacations. (crossing his arms) Even if you do master all of the elements, then what? It's not like we have a map of the fire nation. Should we just head west until we reach the Fire Lord's house? (mimics the action of knocking on a door, accompanied by the sound effect) Knock, knock! Hello, Fire Lord? Anybody home? (Humorous background music plays as Sokka says this. He leans towards Aang, closing his fists and dropping them to his sides) I don't think so. We need some intelligence if we're gonna win this war. I don't see anything wrong with having one of those fruity beverages while we plan our strategy. (signaling to the bartender) Excuse me! So professor, you're obviously a well traveled guy. Do you have a more current map? Ours seems to be a little dated. What, no Fire Nation? (straitening his back) Doesn't anybody have a good map of that place? Oh, so this spirit has attractive assistants, huh? If this place has books from all over the world, do you think they've got info on the Fire Nation? A map maybe? Then it's settled. (cut to the shot of the group around the table. Toph is sipping her drink.) Aang, I do believe it's my turn. I'd like to spend my vacation (cut to a shot of Sokka as he points his finger into the air. The background changes to a rushing one) AT THE LIBRARY! (crossing his arms) You gotta work here a little longer before you qualify for vacation time. Professor, would you like to see our sky bison? Down there. What's that? What kind of animal is that? No, this is the library. (points up at the spire) Look! (voice over) It's completely buried. That fox thingy went in through a window. I say we climb up there and give it a look. Are you the spirit who brought this library to the physical world? (smiling nervously and waving his hand in protest) What? Oh, no, no, no destroying, we're not into that. (trying to think of an answer) Um, knowledge, for, knowledge's sake. I'm not lying. I'm here with the Avatar, (points behind with his thumbs and pulls Aang in front of him) and he's the bridge between our worlds, he'll vouch for me. (pats Aang on the shoulder before nudging him in the back.)  Oh, great spirit, (cut to a shot of Sokka holding a piece a string between his fingers. The others, standing behind him, look puzzled.) check this out! (quickly ties the string into a butterfly shaped knot and holds it out, accompanied by the sound of chimes) Ta da! It's a special knot! That counts as knowledge. Bright enough to fool you.Eh, I've seen weirder. (reading) The darkest day in Fire Nation history. It's got a date at the top, but it doesn't say anything else. I want to know what happened to the Fire Nation on their darkest day. This could be promising. (Cut to a shot of the group running through the library.) The information on the Fire Nation should be right up here. (frustrated) That's so unfair! (places his hands against his head) Just when I think I'm one step ahead of the Fire Nation, it turns out they beat us here a long time ago. I need to know what happened on the darkest day. Hello, little weird fox guy. Um, sure, I'll guess I'll follow you. Uh, this is beautiful, but, how is it helpful? Shh! Katara! (places his hand in front of his mouth and begins whispering, eyeing the fox warily) Not in front of the fox, he's with the owl. It's not broken. (voice over) The sun is behind the moon, it's a solar eclipse! It's literally the darkest day in Fire Nation history. Now I get it! (grabs Aang by the shoulders and turns him) Something awful happened on that day, I don't know what, but I do know why. Firebenders loose their bending during a solar eclipse! (pushes Aang and lets go of him, causing the Avatar some discomfort) Sorry.Fine, you earned it. We've got to get this information to the Earth King at Ba Sing Se. We'll wait for the next eclipse, (cut to a close up of Sokka) then we'll invade the Fire Nation when they're totally helpless. The Fire Lord is goin' down!  You don't understand. (raises fist) If anyone's evil, it's the Fire Nation. You saw what they did to your library. They're destructive and dangerous. We need this information. But we still don't know when the next eclipse is gonna happen. No, we won't. (gestures to the side) If we leave this place we'll never get the information. (raises fist) Aang, come with me to the planetarium, I need cover. (voice over) Katara, take Momo and get out of here. Go! Because if this calendar can tell us about eclipses in the past, then maybe it can project when the next one will be. (removes his bag from his shoulder and turns the dial)  I don't have to. (turns the dial) We just have to check every date before Sozin's comet arrives, because after that... Well, try not to think about that. (voice over) That's it, the solar eclipse! (cut to a wide shot of the planetarium as it darkens) It's just a few months away. Got it. (puts the date into his bag) Now, let's get to Ba Sing Se. That's called Sokka style. (swings his fist to the side as he says this) Learn it! Wait! (cut to a shot from behind Zei, who is sitting between two bookshelves. Sokka, Katara and Momo can be seen climbing the rope in front of him) Professor, let's go! We got it. There's a solar eclipse coming. (Katara and Sokka jump at and hug each other. Momo jumps off of Katara's shoulder) The Fire Nation's in trouble, now!
Toph: (kneels and places her palm on the ground) A lot actually. There's hundreds of little- We did make plans. We're all picking mini-vacations. You spent years walking through the desert to find some guy's library?  (sarcastically) Mm, sounds like good times. (waving her hand to gain the others attention) Uh, hey? What about me? When do I get to pick? (frustrated) Aw, does this place even exist? Shouldn't you have mentioned that before?  (in excitement) There it is! That's what it will sound like when one of you spots it. (voice over) Actually, (cut to a pan left shot of Top, with Aang, Katara, Sokka and Momo standing in the background) that won't be necessary. The inside seems to be completely intact, and it's huge. I say you guys go ahead without me. I've held books before, and I gotta tell you, they don't exactly do it for me. Let me know if they have something you can listen to. What's up? So, you like flyin'? Of course, I'm more comfortable on the ground, where I can see. Well, I don't see the way you do. I feel the vibration in the ground with my feet, (cut to a closer shot of Toph as she picks up a handful of sand and lets it sift through her fingers) but this sand is so loose and shifty, it makes everything look fuzzy. Not that there's anything wrong with fuzzy. I already told you, I don't want to snuggle. The library's sinking. The library's sinking!  What is it now? Who's there? Don't make me put this down. No, stop sinking! No! (sadly) I'm sorry Appa.

Aang: (enraged) How could you let them take Appa  Why didn't you stop them?! You could have come to get us! I could have saved him! You just didn't care! You never liked Appa! You wanted him gone! That's all any of you guys care about yourselves! You don't care whether Appa is okay or not! (Aang stalks off, sulking angrily.)  I'm going after Appa. Appa! Appa! (Stares across the horizon but sees nothing)No... NO! (hopelessly) What's the difference? We won't survive without Appa. We all know it. It doesn't matter. None of those will tell us where Appa is. I'm awake. I couldn't sleep. (joyfully) Appa! (angrily) I'm sorry, okay! It's a desert cloud; I did all I could! What's anyone else doing! What are you doing? (darkly) Maybe we can find some sandbenders. Yeah... look at the shape. Momo! I'm not losing anyone else out here. (angrily) You stole Appa! Where is he  What did you do to him  Where is my bison?!  You tell me where he is now! (enraged) You muzzled Appa?! (In an unearthly voice) Tell me where Appa is!
Katara: Aang, stop it. You know Toph did all she could. She saved our lives. We're all concerned, but we can't afford to be fighting now. Aang, wait! We'd better start walking. We're the only people who know about the solar eclipse. We have to get that information to Ba-Sing-Se. Come on guys, we've got to stick together. Okay, but we've got to try to conserve it. I'm sorry, it's all we have. Sokka, wait! You shouldn't be eating strange plants! (Katara grabs Toph's wrist and runs over to Sokka and Momo.)  I don't know... Okay, I think you've had enough.  I don't think that's a good idea. Come on, we need to find Aang. Uhhh... What is that?  Let's just keep moving. I hope Aang's okay... I'm sorry, Aang. I know it's hard for you right now, but we need to focus on getting out of here. Come on, Aang! We can do this if we work together. Right, Toph?  Sokka?  Any ideas how to find Ba-Sing-Se?  Ugh... We're getting out of this desert, and we're going to do it together! Aang, get up. Everybody hold hands. We can do this. We have to. I think we should stop for the night. This is the last of it. Everyone can have a little drink. No, he hasn't. Sokka, let me see the things you got from the library. Sokka, I was there. (takes Sokka's bag) No, but we can find out which way Ba-Sing-Se is. We can use the stars to guide us. That way we can travel at night when it's cool and rest during the day. (She sighs.) Just try to get some sleep. We'll start again in a few hours. Come on, get up. We need to go. Well, we need to get moving if we want to get out of this sand pit. (sadly) It's just a cloud. Wait! A cloud! (To Aang Here, fly up and bend the water from that cloud into my pouch. Wow... there's hardly any in here. Trying to keep everyone together. Let's just get moving. We need to head in this direction. A boat?  It's one of the gliders the sandbenders use! And look! It's got some kind of compass on it! I bet it can point us out of here! Aang, you can bend a breeze so we can sail it. We're going to make it! The needle on this compass doesn't seem to be pointing north according to my charts. (gasps) That's what the compass is pointing to! That giant rock! It must be the magnetic center of the desert. Maybe we can find some water there! (irritated) You've been hallucinating on cactus juice all day and then you just lick something you find stuck to the wall of a cave?!  Sokka, there's nothing there. We have to get out of here! I'm completely out of water to bend! Come on, we're going down. Toph, shoot a rock right there. Fire! Yes. Now let's move. On your left! We found the sailer abandoned in the desert. We're traveling with the Avatar. Our bison was stolen and we have to get to Ba-Sing-Se. Are you sure?
Sokka: Who's going to save our lives now? We'll never make it out of here. You think if we dig out the giant owl, he'll give us a ride? (breathing hard) Can't you watch where you're - Right. Sorry. If I sweat any more, I don't think sticking together will be a problem. We're drinking your bending water? You used this on the swamp guy! Not anymore! Look! There's water trapped inside these! (Sokka holds up some cactus for Katara, but she backs away, pushing Toph back as well.)  Suit yourself. It's very thirst-quenching, though. (In a strange, echoing voice) Drink cactus juice. It'll quench ya! Nothing's quenchier. (moves across the sand like an inch worm) It's the quenchiest! Who lit Toph on fire? How did we get out here in the middle of the ocean? It's a giant mushroom! Maybe it's friendly! (in the echoing voice from before) Friendly mushroom!Mushy giant friend! Why don't we ask the circle birds?  Momo, no! You've killed us all! Oh, right. Bending. (offended) What! I didn't steal anything! Who told you that?! (pointing an accusing finger at Momo) It was you! You ratted me out! Appa? But why would Princess Yue need him? She's the moon! She flies by herself! (dreamily) Take it easy little lady. I'm sure the sand folks who built this baby know how to get around here. (breathes deeply) I think my head is starting to clear out the cactus juice. And look!  This tastes like rotten penguin meat! Awww I feel woozy. I have a natural curiosity. What are you doing?! That rock almost crushed me! I got this one. I guess my head's not as clear as I thought. Yeah! You got it! She got it, right?  Just get out of here! Run!
Zuko: Maybe we should make camp. You know these guys?  Too bad you don't have any old friends that don't want to attack you. No one here is going to help us. These people just look like filthy wanderers. You brought us here to gamble on Pai Sho?  What are you old gasbags talking about?  I thought you said he would help! Now that you played Pai Sho,are you going to do some flower arranging, or is this club going to offer some real help? What's going on? Is the club meeting over?  Ba-Sing-Se? Why would we go to the Earth Kingdom capital?
Toph: I couldn't! The library was sinking! You guys were still inside and -(Toph swings her arms wide.)  I can hardly feel any vibrations out here. The sandbenders snuck upon me and there wasn't time for - No. Katara, can I have some water? It does taste swampy. Can I get some of that cactus? What? What is what? As far as I can feel, we're trapped in a giant bowl of sand pudding. I got nothin'. Is there any more water?  Yesterday my mouth tasted like mud. Now it just tastes like sand. I never thought I'd miss the taste of mud so much. Ow! Crud! I am so sick of not feeling where I'm going! And what idiot buried a boat in the middle of the desert?!  Believe me, I kicked it hard enough to feel plenty of vibrations. (happily) A rock?  Yes! Let's go! Ahhh... Finally! Solid ground! I don't think this is a normal cave. This was carved by something. There's something buzzing in here. Something that's coming for us! Sorry, I can't tell where they are in the air!  I recognize the son's voice. He's the one that stole Appa. I never forget a voice. You said to put a muzzle on him!

Aang: So, did you figure out what routewe're gonna take?  (calmly) Katara, it's ok. I know I was upset about losing Appa before, but I just want to focus on getting to Ba Sing Se, and telling the Earth King about the solar eclipse. So, are you guys headed to Ba Sing Se too?  (hesitantly) Um, four tickets for the ferry to Ba Sing Se, please.  Uh, no one told us we had to have passports. (holds up hands) That won't be necessary.  Are the other Kyoshi warriors around? (annoyed) I'm doing fine. Would everybody stop worrying about me! (calling down to them) I'll talk to the lady for you.  (pleading) But she's pregnant, and all of their stuff was stolen. You have to make an exception. What if we gave them our tickets?  But... (reassuringly) Don't worry, you'll get to the city safely. I'll lead you through the serpents pass.  (evenly) I don't know. The monks used to say that hope is just a distraction. So maybe we do need to abandon it.  Hope isn't going to get us into Ba Sing Se, and it's not gonna find Appa. We need to focus on what we're doing right now, and that's getting across this pass. (steps through gate)  You saw what I did out there. I was so angry about losing Appa, I couldn't control myself. I hated feeling like that.  Thank you for your concern Katara. (He walks away, Katara watching him leave with a worried look) I'll distract him. Katara, get everyone across.  (softly) I've been going through a really hard time lately. But you've made me... hopeful again. (thoughtfully) I thought I was trying to be strong, but really I was just running away from my feelings. Seeing this family together, so full of happiness and love, it reminded me of how I feel about Appa.....and how I feel about you. I promise I'll find Appa as fast as I can. I just really need to do this. (Tophhands him his staff)  (softly) I know. Thank you Katara. (glancing over) You ready Momo?  (looks sadly to his lemur friend) Sorry Momo, Appa's gonna have to wait.
Katara: Waterbending bomb! Yeah! Sorry. (in a hushed voice) Shush up about Appa. Can't you at least try to be sensitive? (Sokka and Katara glance up at Aang)  (surprised) Oh, well, ok. I'm glad you're doing better.  Great, we can travel through the Serpent's Pass together. (the three travelers react with horror.)  (sarcastically) Hmmm, peaceful ferry ride...or deadly pass?  I can't believe how many people's lives have been uprooted by the Fire Nation. (cuts to a scene of refugee camp, showing a woman feeding a crying child)  You look so different without your makeup, and the new outfit.  (sadly) Appa is missing. We hope to find him in Ba Sing Se. (she looks over at Aang, who looks away) (stepping forward, reads) It says, "Abandon hope".  (incredulous) What are you talking about? (somberly) Ok, if you say so. (everyone begins to follow Aang through the gateway)  You know, it's o.k. to miss Appa. What's going on with you? In the desert, all you cared about was finding Appa, and now it's like you don't care about him at all. (walks up beside him)  But now you're not letting yourself feel anything. I know sometimes it hurts more to hope, and it hurts more to care. But you have to promise me that you won't stop caring. C'mon, you need ahug. (She holds out her arms to him, but he bows politely to her)  Everyone single file. Aang, I need help. (smiling, he hands staff to Toph and begins bending)  What is that thing?  (outraged) Sokka! Sokka, Calm down. I helped Gran-Gran deliver lots of babies back home. It's called a baby, and I helped todeliver plenty of those too. (speaking with authority) Aang, get some rags. Sokka, water. Toph, I need you to make an earth tent. A big one. (Toph creates a tent of stone slabs around the refugees) Suki, come with me. (both enter the tent) You're doing great Ying. (calling back) Sokka! Where's that water? Get ready to push. (Sokka enters behind her) One, two, three...PUSH!  (from inside) It's a girl! Aang, you have to come see this. (steps back inside)  (awed) She's beautiful. (gently) You'll find him Aang.
Sokka: (holding out dripping map) Sure, 5000 year old maps from the spirit library, just splash some water on 'em. (pointing out map features) Okay. We just got out of the desert, so we must be around here, and we need to go to Ba Sing Se, which is here. It looks like the only passage connecting the South to the North is this sliver of land called the Serpent's Pass.  It's the only way, I mean it's not like we have Appa to fly us there. (rolling map) Then to Ba Sing Se we go, no more distractions.  Well, we are desperate.  (stepping forward) Don't you know who this is? He's the Avatar!  (in file behind the others) Alright, we scammed that lady good!  (intimidated) Is there a problem? (eyes narrowing) Do I know you? Suki!!  (They hug.)  I'll grab a tree branch and do a few chin touches every now and then, nothing major. (stretches and flexes casually, pats his bicep)  I can't believe we gave up our tickets, and now we're going through the Serpent's Pass.  (cautiously)Are you sure that's a good idea?  I do, it's just...Nothing. I'm glad you're coming. (Suki walks past him angrily, Sokka looks down and then follows)  (voiceover) This is the Serpent's Pass I thought it would be more windy, you know, like a serpent. Hmm, I guess they misnamed it.  (shouting) They've spotted us! Let's go, let's go! Suki, are you ok You have to be more careful! (leads her past Toph) C'mon! Suki, you shouldn't sleep there. (walks up and takes bedroll) Who knows how stable this ledge is? It could give way at any moment.  (laying bedroll near his) You're right, you're right. You're perfectly capable of taking care of yourself...Wait! (abruptly leaps between her and bedroll) Oh, never mind. I thought I saw a spider, but you're fine. (pats Suki's shoulder reassuringly, while she looks mortified)   Yeah, it really is.  I know you can.  It's so hard to lose someone you care about. (looks away) Something happened at the North Pole, and I couldn't protect someone. I don't want anything like that to ever happen again. (indignantly) Who is this guy? Is he taller than me? (rises to his feet)  Is he better looking?  Oh... (looks to her wistfully)  I can't.  (turning away) No, you shouldn't be. (leaves her standing beneath arch)  (pointing upward) I think I just figured out why they call it the Serpent's Pass.  Suki, you know about giant sea monsters. Make it go away! (beseechingly holds up Momo) Oh great and powerful sea serpent, please accept this humble and tasty offering. Thank you.  (calling out) Toph, come on. It's just ice.  (shouting encouragement) You're doing great! Just follow the sound of my voice!  You're almost there. (the serpents tail crashes through the bridge, shattering its entire length and sending Toph plunging into the lake) I'm coming Toph! (pointing excitedly) There's the wall! (view pans past rocky barrens toward a vast wall that fills the distant horizon) Now it's nothing but smooth sailing to Ba Sing Se. (apprehensively) What's wrong?  (in rising panic) What! Now! Can't you hold it in or something? (completely panicking) This isn't the same as delivering an arctic seal! This is a real... human.... thing! No no, I'm good this time. (Sokka stands and follows Toph into the tent. Moments later Katara appears at the entrance.)  (dubiously) It's so...squishy looking.  See ya in the big city. (standing) Whoa, hold on. Why does it sound like you're saying goodbye? (stunned) So you came along to protect me?  (gazing into her eyes) You talk too much.
Zuko: (grimly) Look around, we're not tourists, we're refugees. (sips from wooden bowl) Ugh! (spits over railing) I'm sick of eating rotten food, sleeping in the dirt... I'm tired of living like this.  (looking out over lake) Hello. (turns) I'm in. (grimly) I've realized lately, that being on your own isn't always the best path.
Toph: You're sure that's the best way to go?  Deadly route. (whacks Sokka's arm painfully) Great pick, Sokka. (strides forward) I'll take care of this. My name is Toph Bei Fong, and I'll need 4 tickets.  (arrogantly) It is your pleasure. As you can see I am blind, and these three imbeciles are my valets.  Is my Seeing-Eye Lemur.  (Momo hops up on her shoulder.)  Thank you very much.  I can't believe you're still complaining about it.  What does it say?  (muttering) Thanks for saving my life Toph. Hey no problem Sokka.  (puts a foot out onto ice, shrinks back) Actually, I'm gonna stay on my little island where I can see. (A huge coil of the Sea Serpent crashes down behind her, sending her out onto the ice with a cry of fright.)  Ok, I'm coming! (begins inching sideways across the ice span)  (acidly) It's hard to ignore.  (screams and thrashes helplessly) Help! I can't swim!  (dramatically) Oh Sokka, you saved me. (plants a big kiss on Suki's cheek)  (fatally embarrassed) Oh...well...heheh. (limply) You can go ahead and let me drown now.  (leaning over to Sokka) So, you want to go see the baby? Or are you going to  faint like an old lady again?  She sounds healthy.  Say hi to that big fuzzball for me. (slugs Aang's arm, who winces and rubs it painfully)

Aang: I was, but something stopped me. Something big. That.  (looking determined) I'm the Avatar. Take me to whoever's in charge.  Not needed? The question is, how are we gonna stop that thing? You're the idea guy. (looking out a window at the Drill below) We'll take it down from the inside.  Where are we gonna get something like that (Sokka abruptly draws his machete and chops off asteam valve) What are you doing! Someone's gonna hear us!  (sitting down to rest) I don't know how many more of those I have in me.  (suddenly inspired) Maybe we don't need to cut all the way through. Toph has been teaching me that you shouldn't give 100% of your energy into any one strike. (levitates to hisfeet) Sokka, take a fighting stance.You've gotta be quick and accurate. (hooks a foot around one of Sokka's ankles, pulling him off balance) Hit a series of points, and break your opponent's stance.(hits Sokka with a series of pretend blows) And when he's reeling back, you deliver the final blow. (bonks him lightly on the head) His own weight becomes his downfall. Literally. (A he finishes speaking, Sokka collapses >forward comically.)  (pointing upward) Then I'll go to the top of this thing, and deliver the final blow.  (passionately) Everyone inside that wall, the whole world, is counting on us.  That's enough, we need to get to the next one! (narrowly avoiding a second blast) Whoa! Guys get out of here, I know what I need to do. (heads other direction with Momo)  (pausing) This looks like a good spot Momo. (glances up, and barely avoids the large boulder that bounces off where he was standing) Aggh!  (shouting upward) General Sung, tell your soldiers to stop shooting rocks down here! (winded) What I'd give to be a metal bender.  Momo, get out of here!  (scratchingMomo's head) Thanks Momo, I owe you one. Now all I need is a... (boulder crashes down startling him) Actually, that is what I needed for once.  I kinda like that one.
Katara: Aang, what are you doing here? I thought you were looking for Appa? And also the complaining guy. His Chi is blocked. (dissipates the energies) Who did this to you?  (lookingaway thoughtfully) Ty Lee. She doesn't look dangerous, but she knows the human body and it's weak points. It's like she takes you down from the inside.  Yes?  They come to fix it.  (appearing behind him) Hi. (crossing arms) What's this we stuff? Aang and I are going to have to do all the work. (explodes with frustration) Grrrrrr! (shoots a menacing glare back at Sokka, who stands  wide-eyed, arms still in air)  (clearlyexhausted) At this rate, we won't do enough damage before the drill reaches the wall.  This is bad, really bad. So we just need to weaken the braces, instead of cut all the way through. Wait! You need this water more than I do!  (as Sokka struggles with hatch) Slurry pipeline What does that mean?  (fiercely) Why don't you try blocking my chi now circus freak! (stands resolutely with one hand upraised)  (losing temper) You know, I am just about sick and tired of you telling me what to do all day. You're like a chattering Hog-Monkey! Toph, help me plug up this drain! (slightly annoyed) Enough with the Team Avatar stuff. No matter how many times you say it, it's not gonna catch on.  Let's talk about this on our way into the city.  Sokka.
Sokka: (as platform ascends) Now what's so big that Appa has to wait? (thoughtfully) That's a good group name, very catchy. (slaps general hard on the face) Get a hold of yourself man! Why are you all looking at me?  (complaining) So I'm the only one who can ever come up with a plan? That's a lot of pressure.  That part I don't mind.  (an idea suddenly hits him and he begins gesturingwildly Ooo, ooo, ooo, ooo, ooo!  (excitedly) What you just said, that's how we're gonna take down the Drill. The same way Ty Lee took down all these big earthbenders.  It's so dark down here, I can't see a thing.  Sorry. (pointing ahead and upwards) There!  (peeking out upside down from the opening) Toph, Come on!  Okay, good luck. (both he and Aang disappear up into the Drill)  (studying the pipes) I need a plan of this machine. Some schematics that show what the inside looks like. Then we can find it's weak points.  (confidently) That's the point. I figure a machine this big needs engineers to run it, and when something breaks... (runs up and takes plans) This'll work, thanks!  (studying cross-diagram of Drill) It looks like the Drill is made up of two main structures. There's the inner mechanism, where we are now, and the outer shell. (traces his finger along diagram while speaking) The inner part and the outer part are connected by these braces. If we cut through them, the entire thing will collapse. (studying plans) Wow, it looks a lot thicker in person than it does in the plans. We're going to have to work pretty hard to cut through that.  (turns and gestures to self) Look, I'm the plan guy, You two (makes rapid chop-chop gestures) are the "cut stuff up with waterbending" guys. (strikes a heroic pose) Together, we're Team Avatar!  (pumping arms in the air) C'mon team, don't quit now, we're...  I mean, (recovers and points reassuringly) you're almost there.  Do you hear that We took it down. We better get out of here fast!  (grimacing) C'mon brace, budge! Were putting everything we've got into busting these braces, but it's taking too long! (raising arms) And boom, it all comes crashing down! (sweeps arms down)  The whole world, minus the Fire Nation that is.  (Encouragingly) Good work Team Avatar. Now Aang just needs to... (glances up) DUCK!  (smiles vacantly and waves) Hey.  (finally opening hatch, peering into it with Katara) It's rock and water mixed together, it means our way out.  Katara, keep that up. The pressure will build up in the drill, then when Aang delivers the final blow, it will be ready to pop! (in lecturing tone) Good technique little sister! Keep it up! Don't forget to breathe! (screaming) Just bend the slurry woman!! (enthusiastically) I just want to say, good effort out there today Team Avatar.  How about... (whips out boomerang, startling Momo) the "Boomerang Squad!", see it's good cause it's got "Aang" in it. (puts hand on Aang's head  Boomer-Aang. The "Aang Gang"?  The "Fearsome Foursome"? (now alone) Why? We're fearsome!
Zuko: (snatching his papers from Iroh disgustedly) I'm gonna forget I saw that.  Thanks, but I don't think you want me in your gang. (turning and walking back towards Iroh) I said no. (whispering through gritted teeth) What are you doing firebending your tea?! For a wise old man, that was a pretty stupid move.
Azula: (condescendingly) Oh, I'm sure it is War Minister Qin. But just to be on the safe side... (in commanding tone) Mai, and Ty Lee, take the earthbenders out!(turning from Qin to Mai and Ty Lee) Let's go ladies. (reaching intersection) Follow them, the Avatar is mine. (Azula races off after Aang, while Mai and Tai Lee pursue the others)
Toph: What about the Dragon of the West? He got in. Yeah, thanks for the tour, but we still got the drill problem. Maybe you'd like the Avatar's help now?  (enthusiastically) By hitting its pressure points! (gesturing back towards the Drill) Once I whip up some cover, you're not gonna be able to see, so stay close to me.  Run! Everyone into the hole!  (feigning horror) Oh no, what a nightmare.  (looking resigned) No way am I going in that metal monster. I can't bend in there. I'll try to slow it down out here.  (straining) C'mon twinkle toes, hurry up! (emerging from beneath the Drill) You guys need some help?  Here it comes! (begins raising the three of them up on a pillar of rock)  You're crazy.

Aang: It's such a big city. I'm comin' for you buddy. He's here. I can feel it. This is why I never came here before. I always heard it was so different from the way the monks taught us to live. Can we see the King now?  If we are going to be here for a month, we should spend our time looking for Appa.  If someone wanted to sell a stolen animal without anyone knowing, where would they go? You mean Platypus-Bear? Gopher-Bear?  Yeah, I'm mastering every element. How hard could manners be (grabs a nearby curtain and drapes it around himself like a noble's robe, and begins talking in a very sophisticated manner) Good evening, Mr. Sokka Watertribe. Ms. Katara Watertribe. Lord Momo of the Momo Dynasty, your Momo-ness. Ow! Earth! Wow, you look beautiful. Where are they?  Or, we could go in with these guys. Toph said we might pass as busboys. Where are Toph and Katara?  I don't know what he looks like.  (voice over) That could be anyone. You found us.  Sorry! No, don't shout.  Watch this everybody! Greetings your majesty.  This could be the most important thing he has ever heard. (defiantly) I'll tell them. I'll make sure everyone knows!
Katara: Look, the inner wall. I can't believe we finally made it to Ba Sing Se in one piece. Don't worry Aang, we'll find Appa. What's that wall for? Why do they have all these poor people blocked off in one part of the city?  What's inside that wall? Get in trouble with who?  I've got it! I know how we're gonna see the Earth King! The King is having a party at the palace tonight for his pet bear.  (duly) No, it just says "Bear".  Just..."Bear". The palace will be packed. We can sneak in with the crowd.  Why not? (hands on her hips)  Excuse me? I've got no manners? You're not exactly lady fancy fingers. We'll get in the party, and then find a way to let you in through the side gate. Sir I'm sorry to bother you, but my cousin lost our invitations. (whispering) She's blind. Do you think you could help us? Our family's inside and I'm sure they're very worried.  Nyah! Pssfft!! I'm Kwa mai, and this is Dung. (Toph frowns and tugs at a string hanging from Katara's headdress.) Ow! Um... I don't see 'em right now. But I'm sure we'll find them soon. Thanks for all your help. Sorry, but the guy who escorted us in, won't let us out of his sight.  So the King is just a figurehead. You can't keep the truth from all these people. They have to know. What happened to Joo Dee?
Sokka: Hey don't jinx it! We could still be attacked by some giant, exploding Fire Nation spoon. Or find out the city's been submerged in an ocean full of killer shrimp. I'm just sayin', weird stuff happens to us. He's a giant bison. Where could someone possibly hide him? Oh. What's the problem? It's amazing! Yes. We have information about the Fire Nation army that we need to deliver to the Earth King immediately. Augh! Maybe you missed what I said. We need to talk to the King about the war, it's important. Yeah, we met a Professor from Ba Sing Se University. He took us to an ancient underground library where we discovered information about the war that is absolutely crucial for the King to hear! Is that woman deaf She only seems to hear every other word I say. And who are the mean looking guys in robes?  (stunned) A month! I think we'd enjoy it more if we weren't staying so long. Can't we see the King any sooner?  (agitated)Where's the black market? Who runs it? Come on, you know! (points an accusing finger at the owner)  Right. And which of your professors could we ask about the war with the Fire Nation?  (whispering) Hey, come with me. So Pao, what's goin' on with this city? Why is everyone here so scared to talk about the war? Certainly you mean his pet Skunk-Bear. Ah-Ha, but you learned it. You could teach us. (mimicking a typical high class snob)  Avatar Aang, how you do? Go on.  But I feel so fancy. Fire! Augh! Ooh! Look, I came up with a backup plan. (picks Momo up by the armpits  We dress Momo like a ghost, OK? (begins waving Momo through the air) He flies by the guards creating a distraction, then we blast a hole in the wall... (Aang stands up and peers over the pedestal)  OK, but remember that Momo ghost plan. I think it's a winner.  Forget about them, just keep an eye out for the King.  You know, "royal", flowing robe, fancy jewelry.  (sarcastically) Thanks for letting us in. What guy? Not until we see the King. (whispering)You keep their attention while I look for the King.  Aang, the Earth King.  Hey, let me go. Why won't you let us talk to the King? We have information that could defeat the Fire Nation! But we found out about a solar eclipse that will leave the Fire Nation defenseless. You could lead an invasion...
Zuko: This city is a prison. I don't want to make a life here. Ridiculous. Uncle, that's what all tea is. We've been working in a tea shop all day. I'm sick of tea! You want a show? I'll give you a show. You're the one who needs help.
Toph: You been hitting the cactus juice again?  (sighs) Back in the city. Great. Just a bunch of walls and rules. You wait; you'll get sick of it in a couple of days. It's called "being handled". Get used to it. We don't need a babysitter. (Toph stands up and begins heading for the door.)  I can feel you shaking. How are we supposed to do that? "One doesn't just pop in on the Earth King" (mimicking Joo Dee).  Or his Armadillo-Bear. This place is weird.  (lying down) Won't work.  Well, no offense to you simple country folk, but a real society crowd would spot you from a mile away. You've got no manners.  I learned proper society behavior and chose to leave it. (throws the half eaten pastry off to the side) You never learned anything. And frankly, it's a little too late.  Katara might be able to pull it off, but you two would be lucky to pass as busboys. Don't talk to the commoners, Katara. First rule of society.  I think this will do. (irritated) Look, the Pangs and the Yum Soon Hans are waiting in there for us. I'm going to have to tell them who didn't let me in.  Nyah! Pssfft!! Another crab puff please. I'd know your little footsteps anywhere Twinkletoes. (furious) He's your puppet!

episode_title: The Tales of Ba Sing Se
Aang: (Kneeling down and holding his hand out) Hey there, fella. You look hungry. (The creature roars loudly causing Aang to jump back in surprise) Ahh! (Looking into a cage) What kind of animal is that? (Smiling) Let's do it! There's a big open space right outside the walls of the city. (Grinning) Don't worry. I'm great with animals. (Scratching his head) This was so much easier in my head! Well, Mr. Zookeeper, how do you like your new facilities? (Laughs nervously)
Katara: Huh! Toph, aren't you gonna to get ready for the day? You're not gonna wash up? You've got a little dirt on your... everywhere actually. Hmmm. You know what we need? A girl's day out! It'll be fun. Are you ready for some serious pampering? Hahaha! (Cut back to show them both walking together, Katara's face has make-up as well.) I'm glad, it's about time we did something fun together. Don't listen to them, let's just keep walking. Let's go Toph. Now that was funny. Those girls don't know what they're talking about. That's what I really admire about you, Toph. You're so strong and confident and self assured. And I know it doesn't matter, but... you're really pretty. Yeah. You are. (Laughs)  Ow!
Sokka: What's this? (His head resting on his hands, looking pleased) Ahh, poetry. I am so sorry. Something struck me in the rear. I just... wound up... here? (Looking annoyed, then ponders this for a second.) They call me Sokka, that is in the Water Tribe, (counting the next five syllables on his fingers as he says them) I am not an oaf. You think you're so smart, with your fancy little words, this is not so hard. I calls it easy! Like I paddle my canoe, (Turns around and paddles his behind once) I'll paddle yours too! (Making different arm motions) Squish-squash, sling that slang. I'm always right back at ya, like my... (drawing and presenting his boomerang to her face) boomerang! (Sheathing his boomerang and making more arm movements) That's right I'm Sokka, it's pronounced with an "okka", young ladies, I rocked ya! ...poetry.
Zuko: Uncle, we have a problem. (Iroh descends the ladder,) One of the customers is on to us. Don't look now, (Cut to a shot of a very attractive girl sitting in the corner of the shop sipping tea.) but there is a girl over there at the corner table. She knows we're Fire Nation. (Cut back to the pair, Zuko forces Iroh to turn around as he had turned to look. Iroh sports a grin on his face.) Didn't I say don't look! (Reeling back in surprise) What?! (Turning back to her) My name's Lee. My Uncle and I just moved here. It took my Uncle ten minutes to do my hair. It's ok. Nothing. (Shouting and pounding the table with his fist) She is not my girlfriend! (Trying to find something to say) You have... quite an appetite for a girl. Um, well, we've been traveling around for a long time.  We were uh, apart of this traveling circus. Yes. I juggled. Whoah! I haven't practiced for awhile. (He wipes the shards of pottery from his hair.)  Close your eyes and don't peek.  Ok. Now you can look. I brought you something. It's a coupon for a free cup of tea. (He takes a few steps away from her.) Don't thank me. It was my Uncle's idea. He thinks you're our most valuable customer. It's complicated. I have to go. It was nice.
Toph: I'm ready. You call it dirt. I call it a healthy coating of earth. Do I have to? The Fancy Lady Day Spa? Sounds like my kinda place. Sure Katara, whatever you say. As long as they don't touch my feet. Arrrr! Rrrrr! Errrr! Hahaha! Well, that wasn't so bad. I'm not usually into that stuff, but I actually feel... girly. Thanks. No, no. That was a good one! "Like your poodle-monkey"... Ha ha! You know what else is a good one? It's ok. One of the good things about being blind is I don't have to waste my time worrying about appearances. (Cut to her frowning face.) I don't care what I look like. I'm not looking for anyone's approval. I know who I am. (They stop walking, shot cuts back to show the both of them.)  (Smiling) I am? I'd return the compliment, but I have no idea what you look like. Thank you, Katara. (She punches her in the shoulder in a friendly way.)

Aang: (shouting) Appa! Appa!  (yelling) Appa! (he looks out over a seemingly endless expanse of empty desert, lowers his face sadly) No... NOOOO! (lying on his back)  Ugh! I guess this mean we'll always be together. (he laughs as the calf begins licking him again)  (smiling in his sleep) Always.
Zuko: (roused from sleep) Uncle? What are you looking at? Is there something out there?
Azula: (holding out a clump of white fur) My, my, you're easy to find. (tosses it aside) It's really astounding my brother hasn't captured you yet.  (mockingly) Who are you, the Avatar's fan girls? No Avatar huh? (shrugs) Well that's ok, any friend of the Avatar, is an enemy of mine. Afraid of fire I see. That's good, you should be!(contemptuously) Don't you know that fans just make flames stronger?
Toph: (straining) No, stop sinking! Don't make me put this down!  I'm sorry Appa. (she is grief-stricken, and closes her eyes sorrowfully)

Aang: (perplexed) Sokka, the arrow is on Appa's head. (Katara struggles to contain her laughter) (enthusiastically) Come on, let's get busy! (holds up two stacks of leaflets)  I just finished dropping all the leaflets. Has anyone come in with news about Appa? (popping up eagerly) Wow, you're right! Patience really pays off. (rushes to open the door) Joo Dee?! Why are you here? (red faced and steaming with frustration, shouting) WE DON'T CARE ABOUT THE RULES, AND WE'RE NOT ASKING PERMISSON!! (flails his arms in outrage, starts backing an alarmed Joo Dee out the front door) We're finding Appa on our own and you should just stay out of our way! (slams door shut)  (glaring at the door) I don't care. From now on we do whatever it takes to find Appa. (turning from the leaflet back to Katara) Katara, we have to give him a chance. (beseechingly) Katara, we don't have any leads. If Jet says he can take us to Appa, we have to check it out.  There's nothing here. (stroking the clump of fur sadly) We missed him. (frantically catching up with him) What island?! Where's Appa?! (anxiously) We've gotta get to Whaletail Island. (turns to the others, where Sokka is reading a map) Where's Whaletail Island? (standing) I don't care. We have a chance to find Appa. We have to try. (cheerfully) Don't worry, on the way back, we'll be flying! (looking to her) I bet they have Appa here in the city. Maybe he's in the same place they took Jet. (turns back to Jet) Where did they take you? (Jet is seen sitting on a stool, his head hanging low)  We need to find a way to jog his real memories.  (peeved) A bad one. Long Feng is escaping!  (outraged) You do have Appa. Tell me where he is! (brandishing his staff) You're definitely not! (desperately) Jet, it's me Aang! You don't have to do this. Jet, I'm your friend! Look inside your heart! (Jet, gasping, seems conflicted) He can't make you do this! You're a Freedom Fighter. (sitting at his side) Don't be. Appa's gone. Long Feng beat us here.  I don't think it's gonna matter. What is it Momo?  Appa! (head pressed in his fur, crying) I missed you, buddy.
Katara: We found a printer to make our posters. (holds up a poster with an expert rendition of Appa, picture of Aang, and dense script, while Aang smiles and points to it)  (taking it to study up close) Why are feet coming out of it? Let's just stick with the professional version. (studying her cards) It's only been a day, just be patient.  But then they replaced you with some other woman who also said her name was Joo Dee. Tell it to some other girl, Jet!  Jet's back. (resolutely) We can't trust anything Jet says. (with a hostile tone) I don't care why he's here. Whatever the reason is, it can't be good. (bitterly) You're lying!  (shoulders sagging in resignation) Alright... (suddenly stabbing a finger at Jet) but we're not letting you out of out sight!  (angrily) If this is a trap...! (she readies an attack)  Aang, It'll take us weeks just to get to the tip of the Earth Kingdom. And then we'll need to find a boat to get to the island. (crossly) Don't you have some more hair to clean up? You're right Aang. (places hand on his shoulder) Right now, our first concern has to be finding Appa. We can come back when we have him. (firmly) We don't need you help.  (arms crossed) Gee, I wonder? (turns and raises her head in a huff)  (startled) What? No! (turns her head the other direction)  (accusingly) I thought you said you didn't have your gang anymore? (aghast) The Dai Li?! That's impossible. The Dai Li must have sent Jet to mislead us, and that janitor was part of their plot too. (annoyed) Maybe you should kiss him, Sokka. Close your eyes. Picture it. Maybe this will help. (turning to the others) This isn't good. We're not going to leave you.
Sokka: Hey, I thought designing "the lost Appa poster" was my job. I've been working all day on my Appa. (holds up a crude drawing with a proud smile)  (pointing to the sketch) This IS his head. (snatching the sketch back indignantly) Those are his horns! (hangs his head) I haven't seen him awhile ok?!  (flattered) Thank you, I worked really... (realization sets in) Why do you feel the need to do that? Grrrr! (violently rips the drawing to tiny shreds)  What happened to you? Did the Dai Li throw you in jail? (annoyed) We can't wait around to get permission for everything.  (thoughtfully) That might come back to bite us in the blubber. Well split up to cover more area. Toph, I guess you should just come with me. Katara, what is it? But we don't even know why he's here. How can you tell? (glumly) Far. Very far. (lays the map of the world on the floor, pointing) Here it is. It's near the South Pole almost all the way back home.  (Everyone kneels around the map.)  (setting off) All right, let's get moving. We can take the train out to the wall, but then we'll have to walk. (thoughtfully) No, it's not. Toph can't tell who's lying because they both think they're telling the truth. Jet's been brainwashed. (points at Jet accusingly)   (provokingly) Maybe Katara could kiss him. That should bring something back.  (slyly) Hey, just an idea. Oo, wait. I got it. (Sokka plucks a straw from his mattress, pokes it into Jet's mouth in trademark fashion, then regards him thoughtfully)  Wait! Remember what Joo Dee said?  She said she went on vacation to Lake Laogai. So where's this secret headquarters? (as everyone stares up) Now that's something different. If we keep moving, maybe we can catch up to him.  (running beside Aang) Do you think we can out run them? (hugging his leg) Yeah! Appa!
Zuko: (gravely) I'll try to contain my joy. (steps outside)  The Avatar's here in Ba Sing Se. (holds out the leaflet) And he's lost his bison.  (spins around to face Iroh, clearly irate) Good things that are happening for you. Have you ever thought that I want more from life than a nice apartment and a job serving tea? (turning to look outside again) I want my destiny. Expecting someone else? (stepping into the chamber, he draws a sword, while Appa shifts nervously in his chains)  (removing his mask) What are you doing here? First I have to get it out of here. (heatedly) I would have figured something out! (looking away in anguish) I know my own destiny uncle. (in torment) Stop it Uncle. I have to do this. (turns away, toward Appa)
Toph: (ironically) It looks just like him to me. But you disappeared at the Earth King's party. (raising arms in the air) YEAH! Let's break some rules!  (peevishly)Why because you think I can't put up posters on my own?  (dolefully) It's upside-down isn't it? I'll just go with Sokka. (she hands him back the brush, and they all split up)  He's not lying.  I can feel his breathing and heart beat. When people lie, there is a physical reaction. He's telling the truth. (Toph, Aang and Sokka turn to Katara)  (offscreen) He was here!  (standing beside her) Was this guy your boyfriend or something? (teasingly) I can tell you're lyyyyying.  (with exaggerated relief) We're finally leaving Ba Sing Se. (thows her arms wide) Worst city ever! (kneeling down, with a palm on the street between them) This doesn't make any sense. They're both telling the truth. Try to think of something from your past that triggers your emotions.  (pointing to her right) There's a tunnel right there near the shore.  (softly) He's lying.

Aang: (ardently) I missed you more than you'll ever know, buddy. (leaping into the scene) But now that we have Appa back, there is nothing stopping us from telling the Earth King the truth about the conspiracy and the war. (urgently) We need to talk to you! (attempting charm) See, we're friends, your Earthiness. Over here. (effortlessly escaping his bonds, Aang raises up his arms, then allows them to be bound behind him again)  (approaching the throne) Well, sir, there is a war going on right now. For the past 100 years, in fact. The Dai  Li's kept it secret from you. It's a conspiracy to control the city, and to control you. (accusingly) Long Feng didn't want us to tell you, so he stole our Sky Bison to blackmail us. And blackmail is the least of his crimes, he brain washed our friend! Right there! Appa bit him. Oh yeah. (Aaag vaults upward, to land in front of the departing King) If you come with us to the outer wall, we can prove to you that the secret war is real! (under his breath) I wish it wasn't.
