It's still there! (earnestly) We don't have much time. There's a comet coming this summer. Its energy will give the fire benders unbelievable strength. They'll be unstoppable. (Momo hops to sit atop Bosco, as the Earth King leans forward intently)  Secret files? (reading) It's from the Eastern Air Temple. (reading his scroll) I can't believe it. There's a man living at the Eastern Air Temple. He says he's a Guru. (Momo seems to study the scroll beside him)  (eagerly) No, a spiritual expert. He wants to help me take the next step in the Avatar journey. He says he can teach me to control the Avatar State. (distraught) Split up? We just found Appa and got the family back together. Now you want us to separate?  (smiling) Well, if I'm going to the Eastern Air Temple. Appa and I can drop you at Chameleon Bay to see your Dad. (softly) Katara, I need to tell you something. I've been wanting to say it for a long time. (blushes and looks down)  (hesitantly, still blushing) Katara, I... Yeah. (love-struck) Yeah, girls are waiting for us. Thanks "positive attitude".
Katara: (critically) One good hour after weeks of trouble isn't much of a roll. (unconvinced) Sokka, Long Feng is control of the city. His conspiracy with the Dai Li is too powerful. I think we should just keep flying and leave this horrible place behind us. (thoughtfully) Well, I guess if the Earth King knew the truth, things could change. (both boys smile again)  (pauses, then decisively) Let's fly! We have to be careful. Long Feng's probably warned the King that we're coming. Sorry! (winces at the soldiers cries of pain)  Sorry! We just need to get through to see the Earth King.  (appealing) You have to trust us. (astonished) So you've never been outside the upper ring before? The Dai Li must have known we were coming and destroyed the evidence. (suddenly inspired) The wall! They'll never be able to cover that up in time! (sarcastically) Really Then perhaps you can explain why there's a Fire Nation insignia on your construction project. (gestures toward the drill, which bears the symbol clearly upon its back)  (unrolling and reading) It's a letter from your mom. You mom's here in the city, and she wants to see you. (Toph's face lights up in surprise)  (hopefully) Is there a letter for me and Sokka by any chance? (reading) A small fleet of water tribe ships... (in rising excitement) Protecting the mouth of Chameleon Bay, led by Hakoda. It is Dad! (happily) And I can't believe we know where our Dad is now. (holds the report)  I hate to say it, but...we have to split up. (firmly) You have to meet this Guru, Aang. If we're gonna invade the Fire Nation, you need to be ready. (rises) No Sokka, I know how badly you want to help Dad. You go to Chameleon Bay, I'll stay here with the king. (pushes him back) Easy there, big brother. (pleased) Though you're right, I am. (curiously) What is it Aang? (turning to the departing Avatar) Wait, Aang.  Me too.
Sokka: (confidently) Look, we escaped from the Dai Li, we got Appa back, I'm telling you, we should go to the Earth King now and tell him our plan. We're on a roll. We can build on it. If we want to invade the Fire Nation when the eclipse happens, we need the Earth King's support.  I know, but I've got a good feeling about this. This time will be different. See, Aang's with me. (puts arm over smiling Aang's shoulder, flashing a wide grin) It's the whole reason we came here in the first place, we have to try.  That's probably the Dai Li searching for us. (turns to Katara) So? There it is. That whole thing is the palace. The Earth King's chambers should be in the center. (another shot of the palace, and the vast open plaza in front)  Why would you assume that? If you ask me, I think we're just gonna sail right in....Ahhh!  (shouting in alarm) Surface to air rocks! (below, several rows of massive, puck-shaped boulders are being launched skyward by teams of earthbending troops) More incoming! Ahhh! Seriously, we're actually on your guys' side. (soldiers continue to slide past) Sorry. In there. Toph, which way to the Earth King? (closing door behind him) Sorry, wrong door. Now that's an impressive door. It's gotta go somewhere. A little warning next time! (rubs the back of his head as he rises) No, we're on your side. We're here to help. (confused) But we dropped our weapons. We're your allies. Uh, no, him. (nods his head toward Aang)  Wait, I can prove he's lying. Long Feng said he's never seen a Sky Bison, ask him to lift his robe. (smugly) Never met a Sky Bison , huh? Of course there is! Underneath Lake Laogai, Your Kingliness. To the Dai Li's secret headquarters. You're about to see where all the brainwashing and conspiring took place. (raises hands to his face in dismay) Oh, don't tell me.. (slumps, then recovers and flashes a thumbs-up) That's ok, still got my positive attitude. Hey, if anything, this proves the conspiracy exists even more. (rushing up) If you come with us, this time you can ride on Appa.  It's a drill. A giant drill made by the Fire Nation, to break through your walls. (shouting after him mockingly) Looks like Long Feng is "long gone"! Ha...Oh, yeah, I've been waitin' to use that one. (rubs a tear from one of his eyes)  (stepping forward) That's why we came to Ba Sing Se, Your Highness. Because we think you can help us end the war. (Momo perches on the King's shoulder)  But there is hope. Before the comet comes, we have a window of opportunity. A solar eclipse is coming. The sun will be entirely blocked out by the moon, and the fire benders will be helpless.  (decisively) That's the day we need to invade the Fire Nation. The Day of Black Sun. You're already vulnerable. The Fire Nation won't stop until Ba Sing Se falls. You can either sit back and wait for that to happen, or take the offensive, and give yourself a fighting chance.  (everyone waits anxiously as the King considers his options)  (both siblings exchange sorrowful looks) Oh. (eagerly) What? That could be Dad. What's a Guru? Some kind of poisonous blowfish? (scratches the back of his head)  This is all such big news. Where do we even start? (resigned) Someone has to stay here with the Earth King and help him plan for the invasion. I guess that's me? (rises to his feet with a glum expression) (tears welling in his eyes) You are...the nicest... sister...ever. (does a strange little happy dance, throws his arms around her and kisses her cheek)  (abruptly interrupts, throwing Aang in a headlock) Alright! Who's ready to get going on our little men-only man trip (gives Aang a head-noogie, as Katara wears a incredulous expression)  (shocked) That's Suki!! (freezing while climbing Appa's side, he slips and falls to the stone plaza, sits up, and begins rubbing his sore back)  ( rising, speaking confidently) Oh yeah. The Kyoshi warriors are a skilled group of fighters, trust worthy too. They're good friends of ours. (embarrassed)Ahhh! Great! That's enough! Ok, we love each other. (pats Katara and Aang's head)  Seriously. (cheerfully) Everything's gonna work out perfectly, from now on and forever. (Aang turns and shares his smile)
Zuko: (feebly) I don't feel right. (feebly) So thirsty. (tries to sit up, but is pushed back down by Iroh)  I'm not tired. (disorientated) What? What's happening? What's that mean (collapses in a fit of coughing)  Ahhhh! (sitting up in a jolt, he breathes heavily, eyes wide)
Azula: (her voice is steady, her eyes cool and deadly)  We are the Earth King's humble servants.
Toph: What makes you think we'll get it? I don't know if you've noticed, but things don't usually go that smoothly for our little gang.  I'm with sweetness. I've seen enough of Ba Sing Se, (raises arms and opens eyes wide) and I can't even see! (rising to feet) I don't trust the new positive Sokka. (points accusingly) Long Feng brainwashed you, didn't he! (pleading) Can we please buy a new saddle? Riding bareback is terrifying! (buries face in Appa's back)  (shouting over the wind) What was that?! How should I know? I'm still voting that we leave Ba Sing Se. (sardonically) He has a good point. It's gone! (irreverently) First time flying? Yeah, I hate it too. (disgusted) Long Feng intercepted our letters from home? That's just sad. (reassured) I know what you mean. My Mom's in the city, and from her letter it sounds like she finally understands me. (quietly) I'm really gonna miss you guys. Hello? Mom? Anyone home?  (frightened) Hey! Who do you think you're dealing with?! (outside, two figures drop down from above)

Aang: (enthusiastically) You haven't seen your Dad in over two years. You must be so excited. (reassuringly) Don't be nervous, he's going to be so happy to see you. (places arm on Sokka's shoulder, causing him to smile slightly) (confidently) Not at all. I'm ready to master the Avatar State. I'll do whatever it takes. (Sokka drops off of Appa's back, looks up at Aang) See you in a week. Yip Yip! (uncertainly) Um, hello? (hops down, starts up stairs) You're Guru Pathik, right? The person who attached the note to Appa's horn? (sits facing the Guru) In your note, you said you could teach me to gain control of the Avatar State. How? (appalled) Ugh! It tastes like onion and banana juice! (rubbing an eye) What are chakras? So chakras are pools of spiraling energy in our bodies? The creek can't flow? (eagerly) The energy flows!  (pauses momentarily) I'll do whatever it takes. (recoiling in terror) Ahhhhh!  Water chakra?(voice-over) I ran away.  (sadly) I hurt all of those people. (holding his stomach) My Fire chakra would like to eat something other than onion-banana juice. (softly) I'm never going to fire bend again. I can't. (belching loudly) Urrp! Tastes like onion and bananas, but strangely something else. Pickles? (voice thick with emotion) Can I have some onion banana juice please? Because I never wanted to be. Like the four nations.  We're all connected. (opens his eyes) Everything is connected. This is the last chakra isn't it? (confident) Let's do this. (startled) What? Why would I let go of Katara? I...I..I love her. (crossly) Why would I choose cosmic energy over Katara? How could it be a bad thing that I feel an attachment to her? Three chakras ago, that was a good thing. I'm sorry, but I can't let go of Katara. (reluctantly) Okay, I'll try. (rising in alarm) Katara is in danger! I have to go.
Katara: (amused) Or we could send in Momo to do some damage. (laughing) Cause the... (continues to laugh, then notices the grim expressions of the Council)...sorry.  (respectfully) I'll get these scrolls to him right away. Thank you, General How.  Why didn't you tell us you were the Avatar? (The scene shifts back to the sitting Aang)  What do you say Momo? A cup of tea before we get back to the king? (steps inside the entrance) Table for two please. Thank goodness you are here, Suki. Something terrible is going on. The Fire Nation has infiltrated the city. I just saw Prince Zuko and his Uncle! (Azula's eyes snap open at this news, and she smiles) We have to tell the Earth King right away!
Sokka: (visibly nauseous) I know I should be, but I just feel sick to my stomach.  So what about you? Are you nervous to meet this Guru?  (voice thick with emotion) Hi Dad. Destructive, buoyant, and (takes a smell of the cap, recoils in disgust) terrible smelling. (laughing hysterically) Ha ha! Good one Dad! (uncertain) Uh, what should I do, Dad? (earnestly) You don't know how much this means to me dad. I'll make you proud, and I'll finally prove to you what a great warrior I am. Really? (apprehensively) This can't be good news.
Zuko: What's that smell?  (Iroh is seen stirring a thick white paste in a steaming pot.)  (pleasantly) Actually, it smells delicious. I'd love a bowl, Uncle. (The banished Prince picks up and holds out a bowl.)  (optimistically) It's a new day. We've got a new apartment, new furniture, and today's the grand opening of your new tea shop. Things are looking up Uncle.  (cheerfully) Congratulations Uncle. (confidently) You deserve it. The Jasmine Dragon will be the best tea shop in the city. (enthusiastically) Now let's make these people some tea. Uncle, I need two jasmine, one green and one lychee!  (walking over) What is it Uncle?
Azula: (smoothly) It's terrible when you can't trust the people who are closest to you. (feigning enthusiasm) Really? Now that sounds like a fascinating and brilliant plan.  We have been presented with an extraordinary opportunity, girls. (walking to a window) I'm talking about conquering the whole Earth Kingdom. (the two girls turn with shocked looks) (staring out the window) For a hundred years the fire nation has hammered away at Ba Sing Se from the outside. But now we are on the inside, and we can take it by ourselves. From the inside we're in the perfect position to organize a coup and overthrow the Earth King. The key is the Dai Li. Whoever controls the Dai Li, controls Ba Sing Se.  Good work girls. (glances up toward the roof) I am sure the Dai Li will deliver the message.  (rising to her feet) Oh, don't worry. I'll be sure to let him know.  So, Zuzu's in the city too. I think it's time for a family reunion.  (outraged) What is this about? Your agents show up in the middle of the night and drag me down here? You will not treat a Kyoshi Warrior this way! (struggles against her captors)  (stops struggling) What do you want? Oh?  (warily) Why should I help you? I'm listening. (both smile wickedly)
Toph: (urgently shouting) Hey! Can you two old ladies quit your bickering for a second? I gotta go to the bathroom! (she is seen standing inside the dark box)  (furious) Let me out of here, so I can kick both your butts! (bangs on walls)  (straining) Come on metal.... budge.  Whoo! Toph, you rule! (does a double fisted strike at the wall)  It's not! It's the real deal! (triumphantly) I am the greatest earthbender in the world! Don't you two dunderheads ever forget it!

Aang: (worried) I don't know. In my vision, I just knew she needed help. Oooo! (smiling sheepishly) I'm great. It went great with the Guru. I completely mastered the Avatar State. Heh heh...heh. Yeah. But, in my vision. I felt so sure that she was in trouble.  Ok, maybe you're right. Momo! Katara is in trouble! I knew it! Huh uh ! (shocked) You guys know each other! She must have Katara. Then we'll work together to fight Azula, and save Katara and Zuko.  Katara is in trouble. All of Ba Sing Se is in trouble. Working together is our best chance. So, Toph thinks you give pretty good advice. And great tea.  Well, I met with this Guru who was supposed to help me master the Avatar State, and control this great power. But to do it, I had to let go of someone I love, and I just couldn't.  What happens if we can't save everyone and beat Azula? Without the Avatar State, what if I am not powerful enough? Saving you, that's what. There's too many. (sadly)I 'm sorry Katara.
Katara: (surprised) Zuko! (accusingly) Why did they throw you in here? Oh wait. Let me guess. It's a trap. So when Aang shows up to rescue me, you can finally have him in your little Fire Nation clutches.  You're a terrible person, you know that? Always following us, hunting the Avatar, trying to capture the world's last hope for peace! But what do you care? You're the Fire Lord's son. Spreading war and violence and hatred is in your blood.  (growing angrier) I don't?! How dare you! You have no idea what this war has put me through. Me personally (turns her back to Zuko and crouches down). The Fire Nation took my mother away from me. I'm sorry I yelled at you before. It's just that for so long now, whenever I would imagine the face of the enemy, it was your face.(regretfully) No, no, that's not what I meant. Maybe you could be free of it.  I have healing abilities. This is water from the Spirit Oasis at the North Pole. It has special properties, so I have be saving it forsomething important. (walks up to Zukoand faces him) I don't know if it would work, but...Aang! Aang, I knew you would come. We've got to find Sokka and Toph. I thought you had changed!
Sokka: So, what kind of trouble is Katara in? It would be nice if your Avatar powers could be just a little more specific from time to time.  What is that?!  Need a ride?  Oooo! Aang, are you ok? See Aang? She's with Suki. They're probably back at our apartment right now, talking about make up or something. Oh no. Huh uh ! Woah there. You lost me at, "Zuko". Good inside of him isn't enough. Why don't you come back when it's outside him too, okay?  (angrily) My sister! Where are they keeping Katara? (points his machete at the Dai Li agent)  We should split up. Aang, you go with Iroh to look for Katara and the angry jerk...no offense. And I'll go with Toph to warn the Earth King about Azula's coup. There's General How! The coup is happening right now! We've got to warn the Earth King! Thank goodness we're in time! (sweating)  Uh, I'm kinda involved with Suki. Nope. All clear.  Let's go!
Zuko: (cheerfully) It sure is Uncle. What's taking so long?  Something's not right.  (standing to his feet) Azula! No. I'm tired of running. It's time I faced Azula! (angry and determined) Yes! I challenge you! You don't know what you're talking about. I'm sorry. That's something we have in common. It doesn't matter. My face. I see (turns away and places a hand to his scar). It's ok. I used to think this scar marked me. The mark of the banished prince, cursed to chase the Avatar forever. But lately, I've realized I'm free to determine my own destiny, even if I'll never be free of my mark.  What? It's a scar. It can't be healed. (upset) Uncle, I don't understand. What are you doing with the Avatar!! (points a finger at Aang)  (hurt) Why Uncle?  Release him immediately! I have changed. (regretfully)  I betrayed Uncle. But I don't have the Avatar. What if Father doesn't restore my honor?
Azula: The Earth King and The Council of Five do not trust the Dai Li. They imprisoned your leader, Long Feng. Soon they will turn on all of you, and eliminate you. Seizing power today is a matter of life and death. (Cut to a close up of a Dai Li lowering his head in anxiety. Azula steps down from the pedestal and comes closer to the agents.) The coup must be swift and decisive. The Earth King, and each of the five generals, must be taken out simultaneously. Long Feng has placed you in me command while we overthrow the government. (Azula walks toward a Dai Li agent with a scar on his cheek and look him in the eyes.) If I sense any disloyalty, any hesitation, any weakness at all, I will snuff it out. That is all.  There are still a few loose ends. The Avatar, and my brother and Uncle. (mockingly) It's tea time. Have you met the Dai Li? They're Earthbenders, but they have a killer instinct that is so Firebender, I just love it! (examining her nails and speaking in a bored tone) I'm not interested in a lengthy anecdote, Uncle. You're so dramatic. What, are you going to do, challenge me to an Agni Kai? (smiling mockingly)  No thanks.This fight... is over. Get them all out of my sight. It's because they haven't made up their minds. They're waiting to see how this is going to end. I can see your whole history in your eyes. You were born with nothing. So you had to struggle and connive and claw your way to power. But true power...the divine right to rule...is something you're born with. The fact is, they don't know which one of us is going to be sitting on that throne and which one is going to be bowing down. But I know. And you know. (Long Feng begins to sweat. His face is full of hesitation and uncertainty. Azula sits on the Earth King's throne and crosses her legs.)  Well?Don't flatter yourself. You were never even a player. I expected this kind of treachery from Uncle, but Zuko, Prince Zuko...you're a lot of things, but you're not a traitor, are you?It's not too late for you Zuko. You can still redeem yourself. Why don't you let him decide, Uncle? I need you Zuko. I've plotted every move of this day. This glorious day in Fire Nation history. And the only way we win is together. At the end of this day, you will have your honor back. You will have your father's love. You will have everything you want.  You are free to choose. We've done it Zuko. It's taken a hundred years, but the Fire Nation has conquered Ba Sing Se. No, he betrayed you. Zuko, when you return home, father will welcome you as a war hero. He doesn't need to Zuko. Today, you restored your own honor.
Toph: Ahhh! So how did it go with the Guru? Did you master the Avatar State? There's no one else here. Wait, someone's at the door. (points back at the door. A moment later, someone knocks on it.) Actually, I know who it is. It's an old friend of mine. (Toph walks to the door and slides it open to reveal Iroh.)  Glad to see you're okay. I met him in the woods once and knocked him down. Then he gave me tea and very good advice. Well whaddya know. There is an ancient city down there, but it's deep. They're not the real Kyoshi Warriors! See any Dai Li agents near by? That is a nice trick.

Aang: (clutching his stomach) What happened?  Oh no! (confused) Momo? Are you sure? (rubs his eyes) I feel like I'm dreaming. (Aang is caught off guard when Katara runs up and embraces him.)  (confused) Sokka? Ughh. (off screen) Why are we on a Fire Nation ship? Why is everyone dressed this way? And why am I the only one out of it? (shocked and feeling his scalp) I have hair? How long was I out? Nice to officially meet you, Chief Hakoda (offers his hand). Are you mad at your dad or something? Mmm-emmm (shrugs, but almost immediately groans and holds his side in pain).  A little higher.  Wow, you are definitely in the right area there. I went down! I didn't just get hurt, did I? It was worse than that. I was gone. But you brought me back. You saved me. So, what now? Me? The world thinks I'm dead? How is that good news? That's terrible! No, no, no, no, no. You have no idea. This is so messed up!  I'll handle this. The Avatar is back!  (whispering) I hate not being able to do anything. I can't just stand by and do nothing!(Aang rushes outside.)  Fine! Well, I am pretty hungry. Maybe dinner's a good idea. I'm not going out if I can't wear my arrow proudly.  You're right, I don't. But the problem is, I did fail. It is true. I was in Ba Sing Se. I was there, but I lost. And now, the Earth Kingdom has fallen for good.  (angry) And I hate the invasion plan, too! I don't want you or anyone else risking your lives to fix my mistakes. (grabs the tapestry above his bed and rips it off its hanger, throwing it to the floor and knocking over his staff) I've always known that I would have to face the Fire Lord, but now, I know I need to do it alone. Katara, please. Just go, please. I need to redeem myself. I need my honor back. Blockade. I'm not gonna make it. I failed. Roku? But everyone thinks I am dead again. They think I've abandoned them, and I'm losing this war. I'm letting the whole world down.  I don't know. You're right. I won't give up. I have so much to do.  What about the invasion? That's okay. If someone saw it, it would give away my identity. It's better for now that no one knows I'm alive.
Katara: Aang, you're awake! You're not dreaming. You're finally awake. (Katara lets go and the person dressed as a Fire Nation soldier walks up to Aang and gives him a quick hug.)  You need to take it easy, o.k? You got hurt pretty bad. I like your hair. A few weeks. (looking away) We're fine, Dad. (annoyed) He knows who you are. I just called you "Dad", didn't I? (annoyed) Great, great. Now you guys have finally met, so would you mind giving us a little privacy? What? Not at all, why would you say that? Maybe we should go upstairs. You need a healing session. Tell me where your pain feels most intense. (Aang's eyes are squeezed shut and he gives a soft grunt of pain.)  I can feel a lot of energy twisted up around there. Let me just see if I can... I just used the spirit water from the North Pole. I don't know what I did, exactly.  (places a hand on Aang's cheek) You need to rest. (annoyed) It's Sokka's invasion plan. Aang, wait. Remember, they don't know we're not Fire Nation. This is water from the Spirit Oasis, at the North Pole. It has special properties, so I've been saving it for something important. I'm gonna give us some cover!  You guys go ahead without us. We'll catch up with you. I think I understand why being a secret bothers you so much. (places a hand on Aang's shoulder The camera tilts up to Katara) You don't want people to think you failed. Aang, that's not true. Remember, there's still an invasion plan. Aang. Is there anything you need?  I brought you some food.  Oh no! He left.  (frustrated)Aang. He just took his glider and disappeared. He has this ridiculous notion that he has to save the world alone. That it's all his responsibility.  (angry) It's not brave. It's selfish and stupid. We could be helping him. And I know the world needs him, but doesn't he know how much that we need him too? How could he just leave us behind? (crying) How could you leave us, Dad? I mean, I know we had Gran Gran, and she loved us, but...but we were just so lost without you. (crying)I understand why you left. I really do, and I know that you had to go, so why do I still feel this way? I was so sad and angry, and hurt. You're ok! I know, but you'll have our help.
Sokka: Aang, good to see you back with the living, buddy. After what happened in Ba Sing Se, we had to get you to safety.  (voice over) We flew back to  Chameleon Bay, where we found my father and the other Water Tribe men.  (voice over) The Earth King decided he wanted to travel the world in disguise, so he set off alone.  (voice over) Well, not completely alone.  (voice over) Soon, the bay was overrun with Fire Nation ships. Rather than fight them all, we captured a single ship and made it our disguise.  (off screen) Since then, we've been traveling west (points to Chameleon Bay and moves his finger across The Serpent's Pass). We crossed through The Serpent's Pass a few days ago. We've seen a few Fire Nation ships, but none have bothered us.  So we're planning a smaller invasion. Just a ragtag team of our friends and allies from around the Earth Kingdom. We already ran into Pipsqueak and The Duke. And the best part is, the eclipse isn't even our biggest advantage. (whispering) We have a secret (looks left and right). You! Yep, the whole world thinks you're dead! (stands up and raises his arms triumphantly) Isn't that great?! No, it's great. It means the Fire Nation won't be hunting us anymore. And even better, they won't expect you on The Day of Black Sun. Aang! No!  You're still hurt, and you have to stay secret. Just let us handle this. Things couldn't get much worse. The Universe just loves proving me wrong, doesn't it? Thank you, The Universe! (pulls out a red headband) Here, tie this around your head. It'll cover your arrow. Aang, be practical. We'll join up with my dad and the invasion force on the day of the eclipse.
Zuko: I've got a lot on my mind. It's been so long. Over three years since I was home. I wonder what's changed. I wonder how I've changed. I haven't seen Dad yet. I haven't seen him in three years, since I was banished. So, I didn't capture the Avatar. No. There's no way he could've survived. What did you hear? Why'd you do it? Why did you tell Father That I was the one who killed the Avatar? (sternly) It can't But why?  You're lying. You have another motive for doing this. I just haven't figure out what it is.
Azula: You seem so downcast. Has Mai gotten to you already? Though actually, Mai has been in a strangely good mood lately.  So what? (gesturing) Who cares? The Avatar's dead. Unless you think he somehow miraculously survived. Well, then I'm sure you have nothing to worry about. (eyes closed) You're going to have to be a little more specific. Can't this wait until morning? (Sighs, opens her eyes and sits up) Fine. You seemed so worried about how father would treat you because you hadn't captured the Avatar. I figured, if I gave you the credit, you'd have nothing to worry about. (gets out of bed)  Call it a generous gesture. I wanted to thank you for your help, and I was happy to share the glory.  (walks past Zuko) If you say so.  Please, Zuko. What ulterior motive could I have? What could I possibly gain by letting you get all the glory for defeating the Avatar? Unless somehow, the Avatar was actually alive. All that glory would suddenly turn to shame and foolishness. But you said yourself that was impossible. Sleep well, Zuzu.
Toph: (off screen) Twinkle-Toes, that's got to be you. Uh-oh! Somebody catch him, he's gonna... Hopefully, you won't need to. They know! Load the Toph! How we doing?You make it so easy! Hey, Aang, we're going into town to find some dinner. You didn't think you could get out of training just by coming to the Fire Nation, did you? Hey, what's... (grabs Aang's broken and burnt glider from out of the water) Oh...it's your glider.

Aang: I think I see a cave below. Yeah, blending in is better than hiding out. If we get Fire Nation disguises, we'll be just as safe as we would be hiding in a cave. I don't know about this. These clothes belong to somebody. But if it's essential to our survival...then I call the suit! Uh...your mom's necklace. I used to visit my friend Kuzon here a hundred years ago. So everyone just follow my lead and stay cool. Or as they say in the Fire Nation - "Stay flamin'"! (He saunters out, the kids following. A man is eating a meat shish kebab on the sidewalk. Aang waves to him as they walk by.) Greetings, my good Hotman! Oh, we're going to a meat place? (unconvinced) You guys go ahead. I'll just get some lettuce out of the garbage. Hotman. Hotman. Hotman. Hotman. Hotman. Heh, heh. Uh!  That's right. (He knocks himself on the head to indicate its lack of contents.) Let the molding begin. (relieved) Yeah, the colonies. Of course. The Fire Nation colonies in the Earth Kingdom. Sorry ma'am. Um, I have a scar. It's really embarrassing. (chuckling) Just "Slob" is fine. (This doesn't go over well. He tries a different tack.) Or, uh... Kuzon. We made it through the day, Momo. And...it was pretty fun! (concealing Momo and turning around with an innocent grin on his face) What monkey? (amiably)Wow. (He bows, Fire Nation style.) You must be one of those popular kids I've been hearing about. It was nice meeting you. (modestly) I guess I'm just lucky. I'd love to! (covered in burn marks) I got invited to play with some kids after school. (happily) I enrolled in a Fire Nation school, and I'm going back tomorrow. Every minute I'm in that classroom. I'm learning new things about the fire nation. I already have a picture of Fire Lord Ozai.  (deviously) I guess we'll never find out about the secret river then. It goes right to the Fire Lord's palace. We were supposed to learn about it in class tomorrow... Flamey-o, Hotman! (He runs off in excitement.)  Fire Lord...forefathers... (desperately) Firebenders...Fire Lord...blah, blah, blah, blah. (rising) Is that a trick question? The Air Nomads didn't have a formal military. Sozin defeated them by ambush. (thinking better of it and sitting down) I'll just write down my best guess. (stops playing) I know. I'm a terrible Tsungi hornist. I was just dancing. You do dances here in the homeland, right? But what about expressing yourself? Thanks, On Ji. I could show it to you again, if you'd like. I'm not ready to leave. I'm having fun for once, just being a normal kid. You don't know what it's like, Sokka. You get to be normal all the time. Listen, guys, those kids at school are the future of the Fire Nation. If we wanna change this place for the better, we need to show them a little taste of freedom. I'm gonna throw them...(he does a quick tap dance flourish ...a secret dance party! Don't think of it as a dance party, but as a cultural event celebrating the art of fancy footwork. (approaching Appa) Sorry, buddy. You should probably wait out back. (Appa grumbles and shuffles into a tunnel at the back of the cave.) I know, you've got fancier feet than anybody...and six of 'em! Ladies and gentlemen, The Flamey-os! Yeah, this ought to get everybody moving. This is when you start dancing. Oh, boy. Listen, guys...dancing isn't something you think about. It's a form of self-expression that no one can ever take away from you. Sure you do. You have for generations. It just so happens that I know several classic fire nation dances. A hundred years ago, this was known as "The Phoenix Flight." And this was the "Camelephant Strut". And this is how they do it in the ballrooms of Ba Sing Se. Yeah, that's it. That's the sound of happy feet. All right, go with that. Everybody freestyle! Don't worry about them. It's just you and me right now. Uh-oh. I don't know. It was just a dance party, that's all.
Katara: Sokka, we don't need to become cave people. What we need is some new clothes.I call the silk robe! (She leaps from the rocks, runs to her prize and snatches it from the line.) (partially visible in the right side of the screen, from behind) How do I look? Where have you been? We've been worried sick! (shrugging her shoulders) Mmm-mm? Sapphire Fire, nice to meet you. My goodness! That doesn't sound like our Kuzon. I don't know, Aang. These shoes aren't really right for dancing, and I'm not sure that I know how to... Okay.  Aang, everyone's watching. We're safe, Sokka. You can take off the moustache, now. Well, that was some dance party, Aang.
Sokka: Shhush... keep quiet! (The cloud disperses with a blast of airbending to reveal the kids, riding Appa. Sokka dismounts and begins a furtive reconnaissance.) Great job with the cloud camo, but next time, let's disguise ourselves as the kind of cloud who knows how to keep its mouth shut. Hey! We're in enemy territory. Those are enemy birds.  Well, this is it. This is how we'll be living until the invasion begins. Hiding in cave after cave...after cave...after cave... (His head drops further to his chest with each repetition of the word.) (to Momo) Looks like we got out voted, sport. (To the kids) Let's get some new clothes. (standing up, flummoxed) After what? Enrolled in what?! Aang, I'm trying to be mature and not immediately shoot down your idea. But it sounds...really terrible. Impressive, I admit. But I still think it's too dangerous.  Hmm... I am a fan of secret rivers. (relenting) Fine, let's stay a few more days. (turning to Katara) Flamey-o?? Fire! Wang Fire. This is my wife, Sapphire. Don't you worry, Mr. Headmaster. I'll straighten this boy out somethin' fierce. (He blusters in Aang's face.) Young man, as soon as we get home, you're gonna get the punishment of a lifetime! That settles it. No more school for you young man! What could you possibly do for a country of depraved little fire monsters? (pointing) Go to your room! (arranging candles) I can't believe we're having a dance party. It seems so... silly. Wow, they look pretty good together. (smugly) Oh, no, I can't. It's permanently glued to my skin. (He strokes it, unaccountably pleased with himself.)  (rocking lazily back and forth and clapping his hands slowly like a tranced-out beatnik) Flamey-o, sir. Flame-ee-o.
Zuko: (in a tone of insolent menace) I'm going in for a visit. You're gonna stand guard here, and no one is going to know about this. Uncle. It's me. (standing at the bars) You brought this on yourself, you know. We could have returned together. You could have been a hero! (Iroh turns a shade further away from Zuko.) You have no right to judge me Uncle. I did what I had to do in Ba Sing Se, and you're a fool for not joining me. (Iroh is silent.) You're not gonna say anything? (Enraged, he kicks a stool and bends a blast of fire at the wall.) Argh! You're a crazy old man! You're crazy, and if you weren't in jail, you'd be sleeping in a gutter! (snickering) You're so beautiful when you hate the world. I don't hate you, too. (They kiss.)  Can't you see we're busy? (He and Mai resume their "business".)  (standing, incensed) That guard told you.  (sitting back down) Okay, you caught me. What is it that you want, Azula? I brought you some komodo-chicken. I know you don't care for it, but I figure it beats prison food. (Iroh, sitting down, is silent, his back to his nephew.) I admit it. I have everything I always wanted, but it's not at all how I thought it would be. The truth is, I need your advice. (He clenches the bars.) I think the Avatar is still alive. I know he's out there. I'm losing my mind. (desperately) Please, Uncle, I'm so confused! I need your help. (Iroh is motionless. Zuko stands, enraged.) Forget it! I'll solve this myself! Waste away in here for all I care! You're sure you weren't followed? (Cut to a side view. Zuko is speaking to an ominous looking figure twice his height.) I've heard about you. They say you're good at what you do. And even better at keeping secrets. The Avatar's alive. I want you to find him. (Cut to a close-up of Zuko's face.) And end him.
Azula: (off-screen) Ahem! (The two lovers look up at her in irritation.) Zuko, could I have a word with you? (not to be put off) Oh, Mai... Ty Lee needs your help untangling her braid. So...I hear you've been to visit your Uncle Fatso in the (smugly) No, you did. Just now. (solicitiously) Actually, nothing. Believe it or not, I'm looking out for you. If people find out you've been to see Uncle, they'll think you're plotting with him. Just be careful, dum-dum.
Toph: (sarcastically) Yeah, we wouldn't want a bird to hear us chatting up there and turn us in. Plus...they have real food out there. Does anyone wanna sit in the dirt and eat cave-hoppers? (She punches the cave wall and several hoppers hop out. Momo catches one and begins chowing down. The kids appear revolted.)  Hmm...I should probably wear shoes, but then I won't be able to see as well. Sorry shoes! (Sitting down, she brings her knee up to her chest, pulling on the shoe's upper and popping out the sole with her foot, which propels it into Sokka's face. She stands up and evaluates her new customized footwear.) Finally, a stylish shoe for the blind earthbender. Yeah, we got our outfits. What do you need to go to school for? (mockingly) Ha, ha. They're coming! Everyone stop bending! Who knew Twinkletoes could dance?   (Katara smiles.  Way to go, Dancypants. I think you really did help those kids. You taught them to be free.

Aang: (playing hide-and-go-seek) Momo! (He ducks underwater before Momo sees him, resurfacing nearby.) Oh Momo! (He ducks again, surfaces again, and the lemur finally spots him.) Ah! Ha ha, you found me, buddy. (It seems to finally dawn on Aang that he is swimming in toxic filth. He airbends himself up into the saddle.) Hey guys, I think this river's polluted. Hey, maybe we can get food there. Now you look just like a little hill with horns. Bye buddy! Thanks for the ride!Let's just get what we need and go. But we just saw you. You're even wearing the same clothes. The only difference is your hat.I don't get it. What?  What's the matter, Katara?  He doesn't look sick. You okay, buddy? (He pulls Appa's tongue out.) His tongue is purple! That can't be good. Katara, can you heal him?  Yeah, are the people...happier?  Is that why this place seems so festive? Spirit magic doesn't work that way, Sokka. It's more like...(He does an elaborate dance to one-up Sokka) Woooooo.... Wooooooo..... What's the matter, buddy? (He spots Katara just as she is slipping out of sight.) It's her! (He runs after her.) Hello, Painted Lady spirit! (Katara, shocked, begins running away, but she is only barely able to keep ahead of a determined airbender.) Excuse me, I don't mean to bother you, but my friend's sick and we're on kind of a tight schedule. Wait, but I'm the great bridge between your world and mine. I know Hei Bai, we're close personal friends. (He chases her across the landscape, over the river and into the village. Running along a rooftop, he shouts to her...) Heeeyy!!My name's Aang. I'm the Avatar. Yeah, me too. I hate that. (He takes a peek under her hat brim.) You know, you're really pretty for a spirit. I don't get to meet too many spirits, but the ones I do meet...not very attractive. (suspiciously)You seem familiar, too. No...you really seem familiar. Katara ! You're the Painted Lady ! But how? So you've been sneaking out at night? Wait...is Appa even sick  I can't believe you lied to everyone so you could help these people.No, I think it's great! You're like a secret hero. You want to destroy this factory? (triumphantly) Ha ha! (He imitates the sound of an explosion.)  Hey, I just found out this morning.Fire Nation soldiers are heading to the village. (overcome) He really does have a heart, doesn't he? Aha, I knew it! I knew you were the same guy. You're the shop owner and the boat guy. (exasperated) No, I just saw you! You switched hats and called yourself a different name!
Katara: It looks like we'll need to go somewhere else to get food. (A long scroll of paper unrolls in front of her.) Assuming that'll fit into Sokka's master schedule. We're, um, from the Earth Kingdom colonies. Why do you guys live on the river?  Look at this place. It's so sad. We have to do something to help. These people are starving, but you turn your back on them?! How can you be so cold and heartless?  (relunctantly) I guess so. (sadly, giving him a fish) I wish I could spare more.Forty-three minutes? No way. I think Appa's sick. It looks like he needs some medicine. Maybe we can find the right herbs in town. The Painted who now?Looks like we need to stay another night so Appa can rest. Can you believe how much an entire village can be affected by one lady? I mean... spirit? (indignantly) Why would you say that? Look how much better off these people are. (in a ridiculous fake voice, and attempting to hide her face) Well, hello, Avatar. I wish I could talk, but I am very busy. (chuckling nervously) Thank you, but... A lot of people say that. Look, I really should get going... (defeated) Hi, Aang.I wasn't at first, I was just trying to help the village. But since everyone thought that's who I was anyway...I guess I just kind of became her. He...might be sick of the purple berries I've been feeding him, but, other than that, he's fine. I'm sorry, I know I shouldn't have. Well, if you want to help...there's one more thing I have to do.Yes. Sokka was just kidding, but he was right. Getting rid of this factory is the only way to help these people permanently. Shhh, we don't want to wake Sokka. (It is a little late for this; Sokka and Toph are waiting for the pair as they walk into camp. Katara is all innocence.) Hi! Sokka! We were just...out on a...morning walk! (guiltily) I...kind of destroyed their factory.It was your idea! Well, what was I supposed to do? (dramatic close-up) No. I will never, ever turn my back on people who need me. (She gets up to leave.) I'm going down to the village, and I am gonna do whatever I can. I thought you didn't want to help.Sokka. You really do have a heart. (They hug.)  Leave this village and never come back. Sokka, it's okay. (to the villagers) I shouldn't have acted like someone I wasn't, and I shouldn't have tricked you. But I felt like I had to do something. It doesn't matter if the Painted Lady is real or not. Because your problems are real, and this river is real. You can't wait around for someone to help you. You have to help yourself. So, Dock, are you gonna help us clean?
Sokka: (fishing pole in hand) Well, that explains why I can't catch a fish around here. Because normally my fishing skills are... off the hook! Get it? Like a fishing hook?  Hm...it's doable. But that means only two potty breaks today! It's in the middle of the river!No, we can't waste our time here! We have a bigger mission that we need to stay focused on. These people are on their own! I'm not turning my back, I'm just being realistic! We can't go around helping every rinky-dink town we wander into. We'll be helping them all by taking out the Fire Lord! (a little quieter) Come on, Katara, be reasonable about this. You know our mission has to come first. Hey, Dock. You work here too?  We'll just take the fish. Mind telling your brother we need a ride back to shore? Our detour into town today has completely thrown off our schedule. It's gonna take some serious finagling to get us back on track. Well, for starters, it looks like we'll need to wake up forty-three minutes earlier every day. Look, we only have a few weeks to get to the Fire Lord in time for the invasion and the eclipse - which, by the way, only lasts for eight minutes. And we just lost a whole day. So if we want to make up the time and stay on schedule, we have to wake up early! Or we could just cut out all of our eating breaks. I got it, how's this From now on, we'll take food breaks and potty breaks at the same time.  Hey, it might be gross, but it's efficient. Either way, we have to leave here first thing tomorrow morning. What, Appa's sick? That's awful! Of course I care. I might as well just throw our schedule away now. (The rest of the gang gives him the evil eye and he quickly changes his tune, rushing solicitously to Appa's side.) And I'm concerned because my big, furry friend doesn't feel well. Hey, Xu, what's going on with everyone today?  See, we don't need to help these people, they already have someone to help them. All we need is medicine for our sick friend. (exasperated) I guess you're right. You got any more food to sell? (mulling it over briefly) Two-headed! (The kids are revolted.) What? You get more for your money that way. Hi, Dock. Is Xu around?  (the eternal skeptic) And maybe she'll cook us a midnight snack, and we'll all have a sing-along. Well, I hope she returns every night. Otherwise this place would go right back to the way it was. Yeah, now, but without her they wouldn't be able to fend for themselves. If she really wanted to help, she would use her spirit magic to blow up that factory. (He makes gestures to indicate explosive spirit magic.) Oooooo... pow. Wooooooo..... Oh, really? A morning walk? (He dumps the dry grass from her sleeping bag onto the ground.) I know you're the Painted Lady. I know you've been sneaking out at night, and I know you've been lying about Appa and feeding him purplizing tongue berries! (Toph sticks out her now-purple tongue and holds up a bag of berries as evidence.) Katara, what you did put our whole mission in jeopardy. We're leaving right now. (He turns to Aang.) And how long did you know about this? (to Katara, angrily) What did you do?!You what?! I was joking. I also said to use spirit magic and made funny noises. Did you even think this through? The army's gonna blame the villagers. They're headed there right now to get revenge. Leave! Do nothing! Wait. I'm coming too. You need me, and I will never turn my back on you. Maybe she is a waterbender, but she was just trying to help you. Because of her, that factory won't be polluting your river, and the army is gone. You should be down on your knees thanking her. She helped fill the void that was left by our mom. I'm gonna tell you something crazy. I never told anyone this before, but honestly, I'm not sure I can remember what my mother looked like.
