Hey, my lips are sealed. I was just wondering the same thing. We'd better check it out.  (Leaving, he admonishes Hawky and Momo.)  You two behave. Appa's in charge.  Where do you think they might be?  You know, I'm starting to think that name doesn't quite fit. This guy is too good. He shoots fire from his brain! Hey, I got it. The perfect name for that guy! "Combustion Man"! See? It fits so well.  Well, I'm exhausted. Hawky, how about you, buddy? (affectionately) Yeah, you're such a lazy little bird. Hey, where'd Hawky go?
Toph: How could you do this to me? You betrayed me! Good job, twinkle-toes. Visualize - then attack! (obnoxiously) What's the matter? Can't handle some dirt, Madame Fussy Britches? Hungry for a mud pie? (derisively) While Katara cleans up, let's go have some fun! (jokingly) I gotta say, I like the idea of not talking to you. We can get more money. Right there. (She points to a street below, where a con man is fleecing a crowd of Fire Nation citizens with a shell game.) This is where you seeing people are at a disadvantage. Everyone guesses wrong because the dealer moves the rock at the last minute. But I can feel it with my earthbending. How could I possibly play? I'm blind. More interesting? How?  I'll do it for forty silver pieces. I won! Hey, I only cheated because he was cheating. I cheated a cheater. What's wrong with that? Why? Because its fun, and you hate fun? Could you for once stop being such a sourpuss and just lighten up?  Yeah, maybe. Maybe then, you'd see how great we have it. I mean, look at us. We're traveling around the world, making easy money, having fun, with no parents to tell us what to do. (dismissively) Whatever. I do hate them! Look. I ran away to help Aang! I'll stop when I want to stop, and not when you tell me! Well, it sounds like a sheet of paper, but I guess you're referring to what's on the sheet of paper. (enthused) A wanted poster. That's so great. "The Runaway". I love my new nickname. Is there a picture of me? Does it look good? Don't be such a worrywart like your sister. Think of it this way. Now you have plenty of money to help with the invasion plan! Here's a little extra so you can get yourself a nice map of the Fire Nation. You know what? Make it an atlas. Of course you do. And that's why this wanted poster is going to stay our little secret. Yes, we were. No, I don't. Yes, really. (exasperated) I don't know! I mean, seriously, what's with you people I'm blind! Where did you get that?! You went through my stuff! You had no right. That's a lie! You're lying, Katara. Oh, really, Mom? Or what are you going to do? Send me to my room? Well, you can't. Because you're not my mom, and you're not their mom. No, but you certainly act like it. You think it's your job to boss everyone around, but it's not. You're just a regular kid like the rest of us, so stop acting like you can tell me what to do. I can do whatever I want! I can't be around you right now! So let me guess. You brought me out here to tell me your sister's not as annoying as I make her out to be. Yeah, I don't know how you can deal with it. I don't understand. I guess I never thought about that. The truth is, sometimes Katara does act motherly, but that's not always a bad thing. She's compassionate and kind, and she actually cares about me. You know, the real me. That's more than my own mom. (Katara lowers her head, in sadness or perhaps shame.)  Don't ever tell her I said any of this. Katara, stop. You don't need to apologize. I was the one being stupid. These scams are out of control, and I'm done with them. What? You want to pull a scam? You know I'm in! Now what's this idea of yours? How could you do this to me? You betrayed me. (alarmed) Hey, what kind of cell is this? Wait. It's a trap! Not for us, Katara. We're the bait. He wants Aang. But...this was your idea.  Katara, you are fun. If nothing else, you're at least fun to argue with.  It's ok. I was really mad when you said that because; well, because maybe it's true. I try not to think about it, but when I left, I probably really hurt them. I don't know! I wish we had some earth or water. We need bendables! I left it back at camp. I was worried they would take it. (Katara wipes sweat from her forehead... and has an idea. She stands up and begins running in place. Toph is understandably puzzled.) Um, Katara...are you ok? Well, what are you doing? Katara, you're a genius! A sweaty, stinky genius! Let's get out of here. Good job, Sokka. Now let's get out of here before "Combustion Man" catches us! Katara, I need your help. I need you to write some things down for me. I want to send a letter to my parents.

Aang: I think I liked "the man with a sword for a hand" better. All right, now I'm getting scared. I bet if we take a little walk around town, we'll find out what these people did to the environment to make the spirits mad. Helping people...that's what I do.She could be home any minute. Ok, that's pretty creepy. We shouldn't be doing this. (nervous) Guys, I don't know about this. (grimaces in utter disgust) Great. I'd steer clear of the "sea prunes". Close enough. This has gotta be the nicest, natural setting in the Fire Nation. I don't see anything that would make a spirit mad around here. Excuse me, sir. Can you tell us anything about the spirit that's been stealing people? (off screen) Old Man Ding? Did you get a good look at the spirit that took you? I didn't know that spirits made prisons like this, who brought you here? We have to stop Hama! Give up, you're outnumbered. This feels weird. (off screen) It's ok.
Katara: No, wait, I've got one, and this is a true Southern Water Tribe story. No, it happened to Mom. (everyone focuses their attention on her) One winter, when Mom was a girl, a snowstorm buried the whole village for weeks. A month later, Mom realized she hadn't seen her friend Nini since the storm. So mom and some others went to check on Nini's family. When they got there, no one was home, just a fire flickering in the fireplace. While the men went out to search, Mom stayed in the house. When she was alone, she heard a voice, (little girl's voice) "It's so cold and I can't get warm." Mom turned and saw Nini standing by the fire. She was blue, like she was frozen. Mom ran outside for help, but... when every one came back, Nini was gone. No one knows. Nini's house stands empty to this day. But sometimes, people see smoke coming up from the chimney, like little Nini is still trying to get warm. You're probably just jumpy from the ghost stories. Thanks for letting us stay here tonight. You have a lovely inn. That Mr. Yao seems to have a thing for you. Maybe we should go back and see if he'll give us some free komodo sausages. That's ridiculous. She's a nice woman who took us in and gave us a place to stay. She kind of reminds me of Gran-Gran. (sarcastically) Gee, I don't know. Maybe because she found four strange kids, camping in the woods at night? Isn't that a little mysterious? Sokka! Sokka, what are you doing? You can't just snoop around someone's house. (nervous) Sokka, you're gonna get us all in trouble, and this is just plain rude. (closes the doors) So... she's got a hobby. There's nothing weird about that. Sokka, you've looked enough. Hama will be back soon. (angry) Probably to keep people like you from snooping through her stuff. Sokka, what are you doing? You're breaking into a private room. This is crazy, I'm leaving. You're from the Southern Water Tribe? How did you know? I knew I felt a bond with you right away. You're a Waterbender! I've never met another Waterbender from our tribe. We completely understand. We lost our mother in a raid. I can't tell you what it means to meet you. It's an honor, you're a hero. (excitedly) Yes, yes of course! To learn about my heritage, it would mean everything to me. I know, when we were stranded in the desert, I felt like there was almost nothing I could do. I've even used my own sweat for waterbending. Wow, these flowers are beautiful. I met a Waterbender who lived in a swamp, and could control the vines by bending the water inside. That was incredible. (stares down at the flowers sadly) It's a shame about the lilies, though. But isn't that dangerous? I thought people have been disappearing around here during the full moon. (uneasy) But, to reach inside someone and control them? I don't know if I want that kind of power. I know. It's you. You're the one who's making people disappear during the full moons. (defiant) I won't! I won't use bloodbending, and I won't allow you to keep terrorizing this town. Stop...please. You're not the only one who draws power from the moon. My bending is more powerful than yours, Hama. Your technique is useless on me! I'm sorry, Aang. No!
Sokka: Suddenly, they heard something down the hall, in the dark. Oooh... It came into the torchlight. And they knew the blade of Wing - Fun was haunted! Aah-ah... Is this one of those "a friend of my cousin knew some guy that this happened to" stories? Where'd she go?  Pft, nice try. Yes, please. What do you mean, disappearing? I know Momo, this place is creepy. I don't know if I'm gonna be able to fall asleep. People disappearing in the woods, weird stuff during full moons... this just reeks of spirit world shenanigans. And then you can sew up this little mystery, lickety-split, Avatar-style. This is a mysterious little town you have here (looks right into Hama's face).  That Hama seems a little strange. Like she knows something, or she's hiding something. But what did she mean by that comment, "mysterious children"? I'm gonna take a look around. It'll be fine. I'm not finished yet. [grunts] Come on... Just an ordinary, puppet-loving innkeeper, huh? Then why does she have a locked door up here? We'll see. (peers in through the keyhole. Cut to his perspective. The camera zooms in on a small chest, sitting in the light shining through the attic window) It's empty except for a little chest. I have to see what's in there. Maybe there's a key here somewhere. Come on, come on! Suit yourself. Do it, Toph. (disbelief) An old comb? But why didn't you tell us? And I knew you were keeping a secret, so I guess we're both right. (Katara punches him in the arm) But I'm sorry we were sneaking around. So how did you end up out here? How did you get away? And why did you stay in the Fire Nation? (furious) The moon spirit is a gentle, loving lady. She rules the sky with compassion and... lunar goodness. (takes the hammer and nail and proceeds to nail the board down) We wanted to ask you about that.  Why would a spirit want to take people to a mountain? I can't see anything down there. A witch, what do you mean? (angry) Hama! I knew there was something creepy about her.  We know what you've been doing, Hama! Katara, look out! It's like my brain has a mind of its own. Stop it, arm, stop it!
Toph: Water Tribe slumber parties must stink. Wait. Guys, did you hear that? I hear people under the mountain, and they're screaming. No, I'm serious, I hear something. It just stopped. (excitedly) Maybe it's treasure. Oh, hand it over.  This isn't as easy it looks. I thought they were ocean kumquats. Maybe the moon spirit just turned mean. Where does Old Man Ding live? Oh, no! (she startles Aang and Sokka) I did hear people screaming under the mountain. The missing villagers must still be there. I can hear them, they're this way. This is the place. (takes Sokka's hand) That's why you have me, let's go. I'll get these people out of here, you go.

Aang: (shocked) Wait, (shoots out of bed and high into the air) four days! (close up of Aang's horrified face) The invasion's in four days!  Uh.. (looks around frantically but everyone seems to be asleep) I guess. (continually making a series of comically fast and dramatic ninja-like moves during this speech) Your days of tyranny are over Fire Lord. I'm bringing you down! (cut to shot of Aang waking up startled) Uah! (Aang feels all around to make sure he is wearing pants, and then sighs with relief. Momo approaches him) It was just a dream Momo, I still have my pants. (cut to wide ground shot of Aang getting up) Well, I better keep training. A couple hours. (Aang circles the tree, doing some fancy footwork and varying the type of punches) I got a lot more skills to refine if I'm going to fight Ozai. You don't get it, do you? (Aang circles Katara, who looks half frightened half amused, as Aang does a variety of air punches and defensive maneuvers) My form is bad. I'm sloppy. And I still don't know any firebending, not even the basics.  Okay, (raises his arms and then begins a series of comic and sloppy attempts at chops, punches and kicks) well, I still have to work on everything else. I'd better spend the whole day training. (wide shot of the group on the cliffside) Good night Katara. Good night Sokka. Good night Toph. Good night Appa. Good night Momo. Good night Appa and Momo. (He points coolly) Your days of tyranny are over Fire Lord. I'm bringing you down... and this time I brought pants. (The camera pans down to reveal the chains are meant to lock on the pants)  (close shot of Aang in a panic) Math test?! Oh no! (he turns toward the camera) I forgot all about the math test! (Aang falls through the air yelling, and is crushed between the giant abacus beads. He wakes up startled, sweat dripping from his brow.) I've got to be ready! (ground level shot of Aang looking wild and still concentrated on the Koala-Sheep) But I forgot my pants and my math test. Sokka get up! I need to know what day it is! (Aang pulls on Sokka's eyelids and lips in a comedic fashion.)  (cut to Aang hopping around the sleepy Sokka, tugging on various limbs) Sokka, you've got to get up and drill your rock climbing exercises. (cut to close shot of Aang, looking unfocused and tired. He makes overly large comedic gestures during his speech and often looks confused) In one of my dreams, you were running from fire nation soldiers, trying to climb this cliff, but you (cut to close shot of Sokka looking disgruntled) were too slow and they got you. (Sokka springs up to stand before Aang)  (points upward) Then climb that cliff. Climb it fast!  (Yells, causing Sokka to startle and slip down the cliff face) Don't drink that! In my dream, we were right in the middle of the invasion, and you had to stop to use the bathroom. We died because of your tiny bladder. (Aangmimics holding his bladder) And you (addressing Katara) need to start wearing your hair up. (Aang gestures his hair and then starts pulling and stretching his forehead) In my dream, your hair got caught in a train, and... You're right. I'm losing my mind.  It's like every time I think about how stressed I am, (Cut to shot of Aang twittering his fingers in a nervous fashion) I just end up more stressed. (Cut to wide shot of Aang pacing back and forth. His friends sit in the background. They are absorbed in their own tasks and seem to be ignoring Aang's ravings) I'm like a big, growing snowball of nerves. (cut to close up shot of Aang upside down. The camera spins and pans inward, in a dizzying motion) I feel...really warm. Like there's the warm feeling all around me. This heat... like I'm in the Fire Lord's palace, and he's shooting a bunch of fire balls at me. And the whole world is being engulfed in flames. (flames shoot across the scene and spiral inward. There is a flash. Cut to Aang rolling out of the yoga position and on to his back. Katara looks up and the tired and out of breath Aang)  (close aerial shot of Aang looking disgruntled) You know what's bothering me. I have to fight the Fire Lord in a few days. (The camera pans over a wider aerial shot of Aang, Sokka and the Koala-Sheep) You said it yourself. He's the baddest man on the planet. I'm supposed to defeat him and save the world. Okay, but what can I do to feel better? Pound away. (Toph begins to stomp her feet causing the pillars to pummel Aang) Ahh! Ow! Uh! Toph! (close shot of Aang in serious pain) I ... think ... this ... is ... bruising ... me! (Toph stops and Aang falls off the bed of rock pillars)  (Aang looks at the porcupine, screams and runs away) Ahhhh! Thanks for everything guys. (close shot of Aang looking confused) Uhh...I kinda think I sorta might ... slightly feel a little better ... maybe. (Aang turns away from his friends and slumps over, bowing his head to the ground) It's the nightmares. They just get worse and worse. (Aang looks up at him, disgusted and then turns around and speaks angrily) No, that won't help. Nothing helps. (close shot of Aang looking determined) There's only one thing I can do. I'm going to stay awake straight through to the invasion.  Invasion. All aboard for the invasion. (cut to close up shot of Aang turning towards Katara) I told you, I can't go back to sleep. Actually staying up all night has given me some time to think. (Aang walks toward the ocean, Katara follows him) And I've realized some big things Katara. (looking out into the sunset) I see everything so clearly now... what really matters. Why I'm really doing this. I'm doing it to save the world, (turns toward Katara) but more than that. I'm doing it for the people I love. (close up shot of Aang stepping right up to Katara) I'm doing it for you Katara. I'm saying...I love you.  What our hearts (lifts arms into the air in a grand gesture) have been telling us to do for a long, long time. Baby, (swings Katara on to her back and goes in for another kiss) you're my forever girl.  Huh? Oh, (straightens up and faces Katara) I guess I kinda drifted off into a day-dream. (looks embarrassed) Uhh, living under water?  (close up shot of Aang breathing a sigh of relief) Heh. Phew. Put 'em up, Fire Lord. (close up shot of Aang, his arm reached out in front of him at some imaginary enemy) Ozai's defense is impeccable. I'll have to try a different approach. (Aang jumps up into the air with a yell and beings to shoot balls of air down at the noodle Ozai. All 4 shots miss.) You think you're untouchable, don't you Mr. Fire Lord.  Momo, did you hear something. Uhh. (Aang bends in toward Momo looking very confused. Cut to close shot of Momo)  That's more like it. (pets Momo) I'm so tired, that for a second there I imagined you were talking to me. (Momo cocks his head to one side as if he is confused) Oh, Momo... let me explain. Uhh. (bows his head, frustrated, and then lifts his finger to make a point. Cut to wide scene of Aang talking to everyone. Appa is still standing there like a human) I appreciate what you guys are saying. But the stress and the nightmares, they were too much. Staying awake is the best way for me to deal with it. Guys...come on. Oh, you don't like i?  Well let's go right now. Sokka, what should we do? About that! (turns toward Appa and Momo)  Come on guys, (cut to shot of Momo and Appa fighting with a ring of Koala-Sheep cheering around them. Aang stands outside the ring trying to get everyone's attention)  we're all on the same side! Huh? Huh! (yelling) I just need a jump in a cold waterfall.  Oh look, another hallucination. An imaginary bed, made out of clouds. Look, you guys keep telling me I need to sleep, but I can't, the invasion's tomorrow. (determined) No Katara, there's still so much I haven't learned. I don't need sleep. What I need is practice. Quick, hit me. (raises his fists in a feeble attempt)  (close shot of Aang turning to Katara) You really think so? Thanks guys. (close shot of Aang smiling. He yawns and Katara helps him onto the fluffy Koala-Sheep wool bed.) You know what? I think I am ready. (standing on the ledge below the Fire Lord) Your days of tyranny are over, Fire Lord. (smiles slyly) No Fire Lord Ozai, (raises his sword) you're not wearing pants.
Katara: (cut to close-up ground level shot of the gang preparing for bed) Nice choice Sokka. And we're here four days ahead of schedule. Sokka's got the right idea Aang. We're here, we're ready... (lays down on her mat) the best thing we can do now is get plenty of rest. Hey, how long have you been up? (close shot of Aang, very out of breath) You know there is such a thing as over-training. Aang, it's the middle of the night. You need to go back to sleep. (Katara sighs, and then breathes in deeply, she moves forward and grabs Aang's shoulders. Aang's very bloodshot eyes turn toward her) Aang, sleep. Please...for me. (cut to Katara holding Aang's cheek) Aang, I know you're just trying to help. But you really need to get a grip. You're unraveling. Sokka, you're not helping! You know what? I've got just the thing. (places her arms on Aang's shoulders, smiling) Get ready to be "de-stress-i-fied". (Cut to wide shot of the outside of a steaming crater. Cut to shot of Aang and Katara standing beside the steaming water inside the crater) These yoga stretches can really work wonders if you do them in extreme heat. Reach up. (Aang and Katara reach upward) Reach for the sun. (Aang and Katara sway from side to side) Feel your chi paths clearing. (They bend over and touch their heads to the ground) Now close your eyes. How are you feeling?  Good, good. Go on. Maybe your stress is the kind you need to talk out. (Cut to shot of Katara and the others looking toward Aang with smiles) So do you feel less stressed? Ready for a good night sleep? (worried) What happened Aang? You don't look so good. (approaches Aang) You sure you can't just lie down for a little nap? Aang, staying up can't be good for you. (close up shot of Katara) What big things? Aang, what are you saying? What are we doing? Aang? I was just saying you should take a nap. What was your dream about? (looks skeptical, then smiles) Sounds neat. Aang (Aang and Momo look up in surprise. Cut to shot of Katara.) We're all starting to get a little worried about you. (imploringly) Aang... I'm not going to hit you. Listen to me, (grabs Aang's shoulder) you've been training for this since the day we've met. I've seen your progress. You're smart, brave, and strong enough.
Sokka: (looking at a map) This is it, the official rendezvous point for the invasion force. Before we split up, my dad and I found this island on a map. It's (close shot of the inside of Sokka's mouth, which pan's out to reveal him yawning) Whatever. (nonchalant) That's like... four days from now. (lays back onto his mat) Let's just calm down, and ... (snore)  That's okay Aang. The eclipse will block all firebending anyway, you don't need to know any. (he looks toward Aang) Plus it's a stupid element. What?! (jumps up) Who's talking?! (Sokka thrusts forward with his sword, but hits a rock head-on before he can complete his swing. He falls back on to his sleeping mat, his body stiff, frozen in the swinging position)  What?  But that was just a dream, (points at Aang) I'm a great climber.  (annoyed) Stupid Avatar. Stupid cliff. Stupid dream! I can climb fast! Ahhh! (turning toward Aang) Of course you are. That's 'cause you've got to fight the Fire Lord, (extreme close shot of Aang's horrified face) the baddest man on the planet. And you better win, or we're all done for. (The camera pans left to reveal an angry Katara standing up and turning to Sokka)  (standing up) What? It's true. That's the deal, he knows it. (Katara pushes Sokka to a sitting position angrily)  (speaking in a mocking, old man sounding, psychiatric tone) Why don't you get right down to business and tell me what's been bothering you. Mhm. (nods and gestures toward Aang) Tell me more about this, 'Fire Lord.' Why are you so afraid of him? Hmm. (close shot of Sokka with his eyes closed and nodding deeply) Life does feel that way some times, doesn't it? (cut back to shot of Aang, now getting frustrated) Like we're all trying to save the world from evil. Want to try screaming into this pillow? (cut to shot of Sokka) Then our work here is done.  (cut to close shot of Sokka) Looks like it's time for... (he spins around and now dons the 'Wang Fire' beard) another therapy session. Hey, I'm trying to build Appa some armor here so he doesn't have to go into the invasion naked. He's your bison ... (camera pans right to Sokka) You've been awake too long. About what?  We made it for you. (the camera pans further right to reveal a herd of recently shaved and shivering Koala-Sheep.) A good night sleep will probably take the crazy away... we hope. (cut to Toph and Sokka. Sokka's arms open) We all do. You can do this. You're ready.
Zuko: I'm just going to Mai's house, it's not far. Tell me, if you can have anything you wanted right now, what would it be? (cut to close up shot of Zuko and Mai) You know, being a prince and all, I might just be able to make that happen. Do you think (the guards turn towards the couple and bow) you can find a fresh fruit tart for the lady, with rose petals on top. (Zuko sits up completely, surprised, and turns toward Mai, who is also surprised) War meeting? What are you talking about?  (closes his eyes and turns away) I guess I wasn't invited. So I guess there's a big war meeting coming up, huh. And apparently I'm not welcome there. (close shot of Zuko, perturbed) Oh yeah? I guess that's why no one bothered to tell me about it. (close up on Zuko, questioning) Well, were you invited?  (annoyed) And I'm the Prince! Forget it, I'm not going.  I don't. (sighs)I know. (Zuko and Mai approach him) What?  (close up shot of Zuko and Mai. Mai is smiling) So, my dad wants me at the meeting? When I got to the meeting, everyone welcomed me. (cut to close up shot of Zuko)  My father had saved me a seat. He wanted me next to him. (cut to wider shot of Zuko and Mai walking) I was literally at his right hand. During the meeting, I was the perfect prince. (close up shot of Ozai's face in the picture) The son my father wanted. But I wasn't me. (close up shot of Zuko, he bows his head. Cut wide shot of them standing in the wide empty palace hallway.)
Azula: Hello Zu-zu. If you've come for a royal hair combing, I'm afraid you'll have to wait. What do you mean? Of course you're welcome there. Oh Zuko, don't be so dramatic. I'm certain Dad wants you there. You probably weren't invited, because it's so obvious that you're supposed to be there. (close shot of Azula, looking smug) Of course. I'm the Princess. Exactly, so stop acting (gestures) like a paranoid child. (close up shot of Zuko looking annoyed) Just go to the meeting.
Toph: How did you pick this place? (yelling) Go to sleep already! (cut to Toph sitting up, Katara visible in the background) Relax, it's still two days before the invasion. (perturbed) Why, is it poisoned? (an annoyed Katara water bends the water off herself)  Alright, what you need is a good old fashioned back poundin' to relieve your stress. Sorry, I forgot you have baby skin. (close shot of Toph looking pensive) Well, there's one other thing we can try... (Toph stomps and a porcupine flies into her hand from a nearby bush. It uncurls and bears its needles. Toph gives a large grin) acupuncture! (camera pans right to Toph) And you're acting downright weird. Hey! It's real! We spent hours working on it. (eager)You want me to do it? You're the man, (points at Aang) Twinkle-toes.

episode_title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
Aang: (Momo scurries to his shoulder) Top of the morning, Momo! Like a baby mooselion. I'm ready (in an attacking position) to face the Fire Lord. I can't. When Azula shot me with lightning, my 7th chakra was locked, cutting off my connection to all the cosmic energy in the Universe. (walking towards Haruand giving an introduction) Toph, this is Haru. When we met him, his town was controlled by the Fire Nation. So we had to hide his earthbending. (Camera zooms out to reveal Aang admiring his new glider) A new glider! This is amazing. Oh well, I'm sure that will come in handy. We've been looking everywhere for you. The boats are ready to leave. What? Sokka, (walks up to him and places a hand on his shoulder) that speech wasn't your moment of truth. That was just public speaking and nobody's really good at that. Look, your moment of truth isn't going to be in front of some map. It's going to be out there, (points to the vast ocean in front of them) on the battlefield.  Because I already failed the world once at Ba Sing Se. I won't let myself fail again.  So, this is it huh? I'm ready. (Sokka grasps his arm, wishing him luck. The gang and Momo gather around for a group hug.)  Katara, I. You go first. Everything is going to be different after today, isn't it?  (uncertain) What if... what if I don't come back? What did you know? It did come in handy. (Cut back to the shadow of him flying. Aang adds more speed and flies towards the Fire Nation capital.)  That's strange.  The Avatar is back!  Hello? (looks around and walks slowly towards the inner palace doors) Anyone home? No... (drops glider and kneels on the floor in shock.) No, no, (shakes head) NO! Fire Lord Ozai, (raises voice in anger) where are you?! (His voice reverberates slightly throughout the empty throne room. Camera zooms out to show the empty throne room again. Fade to white.)
Katara: Sounds like you slept well. Oh no. Sokka, do you think the fog will delay the invasion? You made it Dad! Haru, (runs and embraces him) it's so good to see you. (quietly to Aang) Wow, he says beginning, he means beginning, beginning. (voiceover) I don't see any gates.  Aang, I. We've been through so many things together and I've seen you grow up so much. You're not that little goofy kid (Cut to a shot of Aang blushing.) I found in the iceberg anymore. I guess what I'm trying to say is, I'm really proud of you.  Yes, it is.  Aang, don't say that. Of course you'll... (Aang cuts off the conversation with a kiss, much to the surprise of Katara. They part and Katara blushes as she looks away sadly. Aang opens his glider and flies off as Katara watches him go.)  (snaps out of her dazed mood) What? Right, I'm on it.  Dad? How does that feel, Dad? You're hurt. Badly. You can't fight anymore.  I'm doing everything I can. (Cut to Sokka looking away before closing his eyes to make a decision.)  No offense Sokka but you're not exactly Mr. Healing Hands. Don't be crazy, Sokka. I still think you're crazy but I'm proud of you too.
Sokka: No, that is the invasion.  Were you able to locate everyone I told you to find? Was that a new invention? You're making peanut sauce bombs? Were you able to complete work on the plans I sent you? Good morning, everyone!  Uhm... So, as you know today we're invading the Fire Nation. I mean I know you know that. (laughs nervously) Because otherwise why else would you be here Anyway... (Clumsily drops more scrolls. He picks themup and places it on a board.) The Fire Lord's palace is here. (Points to the map) Uh no, uh wait, (flips to another map) uh wait (flips again), uh wait (flips for the final time). It's here (points to the correct map. Cut to a shot of Due, scratching his head and looking rather confused) and uh there's an eclipse today and Aang's going to fight the Fire Lord (he starts to panic) and the firebenders won't have any fire to use so that's good for us and uhm... (Cut to Teo and The Mechanist who look bored.) I'm sorry, let me start at the beginning.  (rapidly) Katara and I discovered Aang frozen in an iceberg. Now I didn't like Aang at first but I grew to love him over time. Then we went over to the Southern Air Temple where Aang used to live and then ...and then Aang's friend was a crazy old man and then Katara got Haru arrested and then now he's grown a mustache (Camera pans out to reveal Hakoda approaching Sokka) and if you look in the front row you can see him... (still disappointed with himself) I messed up, Aang.  The invasion plan was my moment of truth. And I completely flopped it. I just fell apart. My Dad is. He explained the plan perfectly and inspired everyone. Like a real leader should.  You seem so confident about everything. How do you know we're going to win? Well, I just came up with the idea but The Mechanist did all the work.  Are you ready for the Fire Nation to know the Avatar's alive?  (Cut to Katara looking into the sky and still blushing. The entrance to the submarine opens.) Katara, what are you doing? It's time to submerge. Dad, look out! (Looks up at a battlement and narrows his eyebrows) I've got an idea.  Dad!  Can't you heal him any faster?  I'll do it. No. (stands up) I'll lead the invasion force.  Maybe I am a little crazy but the eclipse is about to start and we need to be up that volcano (looks at the volcano) by the time it does. Yip yip.  (raising his voice) Listen up everyone, (Cut to Teo looking at Sokka inside the tank) I want the tanks in wedge formation! (his arms open upin a V-shape) Warriors and benders in the middle. (Toph and the Earth Kingdom soldiers are seen moving into action.) We're taking that tower (points at it) and headed for the royal palace!  (grabs his sword and points toward the enemy) Charge!
Zuko: I'm sorry, Mai. (He walks towards Mai's bed and places a scroll on the pillow as the camera slowly zooms out.)  I know I made some bad choices. But today, I'm going to set things right. (He grabs his broadswords and backpack before looking at his Mother's portrait for one last time. He throws on his cloak and walks away.)
Toph: So what's your strategy for taking him down? Going to get your glow on (her fingers flutter in front of her eyes) and hit him (punches the air repeatedly) with a little Avatar State action?  You know what I just? heard Blah blah spiritual mumbo jumbo blah blah something about Space. No way. (Gets into a defensive stance) Is that...  (A pair of huge hands appear on screen and carries Toph up. Camera pans out to reveal The Hippo.)  (angrily) You guys here for a re-match? Sweet. (smiles)  (Cut to Toph who is holding her head down.) Yeah. Congratulations, Sokka. (Lifts her head up. There's a look of discomfort on her face.) You managed to invent a worst way of travel than flying.  (Cut to a close-up of Toph smiling.) I hope you kick some serious Fire Lord butt, twinkle toes.

episode_title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
Aang: He wasn't home. No one was. The entire palace city is abandoned. It's over. The Fire Lord is probably long gone. Far away on some remote island where he'll be safe during the eclipse. We can still do this. We can still win the day. I've got to try. Do you feel anything down there? Stay safe. We'll be back soon. How was that careful? Climb aboard and hold on tight. (suddenly smiles cheerfully) Thanks. I'm ready. I'm ready to face the Fire Lord.  Where is he? Where is the Fire Lord?  I can't pin her down. She's too quick. Okay, so what do we do? Just ignore her?  (grabbing Sokka's shoulder) Sokka, she won't talk.  Maybe it's not too late. The eclipse is over but I can face the Fire Lord anyway. But I'm ready! I came here with a job to do and everyone's counting on me.  I guess you guys are right. (off screen) They've got air power, but so do I! (opens his glider) I'm going to do what I can to slow them down.  Let's join the others. They're headed for the beach. They're going to destroy the submarines! Thank you all for being so brave and so strong. I'm going to make this up to you.  I know just the place for us to go where we'll be safe for a while. The Western Air Temple.
Katara: Yeah... Is that... is that Aang? Wait. If they knew we were coming, it could all be a trap. Maybe we should use the time we have left to make sure all of us get out of here safely.  We can wait here if you want. It's not over yet.  They're back! Appa, you and I can help too. We can't keep them all back. They're too many of them!  Why aren't they turning around to attack us again?  What? We can't leave you behind. We won't leave anyone behind.  We'll miss you Dad.
Sokka: Dad! You're on your feet again. Everything's going smoothly and the eclipse hasn't even kicked in yet. What? Please tell you're here because the Fire Lord turned out to be a big wimp and you didn't even need the eclipse to take him down? They knew. No. My instincts tell me he wouldn't go too far. He would have a secret bunker. Somewhere he could go so it'll be safe during a siege but still be close enough to lead his nation. The Mechanist gave me this timing device. It looks like we've got about 10 minutes until the full eclipse. 10 minutes to find the Fire Lord.  What do you think? You're the one who has to face the Fire Lord. Whatever you decide, I'm with you. Anything else? Is there a structure somewhere? Sounds like a secret bunker to me. What would we do without you? Yeah, pretty much. We'll have to be fast but careful.  I was wrong. We need to be fast, careful and lucky. There's no floor! It's just a river of lava.  That's some door! I am so glad we added you to the group. Only 30 seconds until the total eclipse. (brandishes his sword) Stop wasting our time and give us the information. You're powerless right now so you're in no position to refuse.  Wait! Aang, Toph, stop attacking. (Aang, Toph, and Azula all stop running) Don't you see what she's doing? She's just playing with us. She's not even trying to win this fight!  She's just baiting you again.  We don't have a choice. We just have to get out of here and find the Fire Lord on our own somehow. (spreading one arm wide over his head in a gesture of dismissal) Ignore! Where is Suki?! (angry) Where's Suki?! Answer me!  (hesitates, then turns back to Azula) Where are you keeping her?! I fell for it! I used up all our time.  (hopeless) And now it's too late.  No. I don't think that's a good idea.  (putting a hand on Aang's shoulder) You'll have another chance. I know you will. It was all a trap. Azula knew we were coming and she's plotted out every move. (he and Toph jump down from Appa)We just got to get to the beach as fast as we can. If we can make it to the submarines, maybe we can get away safely.  Everyone, let's get back to the subs!  Try and find cover! I think we're about to see some bombs. How are we all going to escape? Then our only choice is to stand and fight. We have the Avatar, we could still win!  They're at the beach already! Bye Dad. We won't be apart for too long this time. I promise.
Zuko: I'm ready to face you.  I'm here to tell the truth.  First of all, in Ba Sing Se, it was Azula who took down the Avatar, not me.  Because the Avatar is not dead. He survived.  In fact, he probably is leading this invasion. He could be on us right now.  That's another thing. I'm not taking orders from you anymore.  Think again! I am going to speak my mind and you are going to listen.  For so long, all I wanted was you to love me, to accept me. I thought it was my honor that I wanted but really, I was just trying to please you. You, my father, who banished me just for talking out of turn. (points a sword at Ozai) My father, who challenged me; a 13-year-old boy to an Agni Kai. How can you possibly justify a duel with a child?  It was cruel! And it was wrong.  No, I've learnt everything! And I had to learn it on my own. Growing up, we were taught that the Fire Nation was the greatest civilization in history and somehow, the war was our way of sharing our greatness with the rest of the world. What an amazing lie that was. The people of the world are terrified by the Fire Nation! They don't see our greatness, they hate us! And we deserve it. We've created an era of fear in the world. And if we don't want the world to destroy itself, we need to replace it with an era of peace and kindness. (closes his eyes for a second) Yes. He has.  After I leave here today, I'm going to free Uncle Iroh from his prison and I'm going to beg for his forgiveness. He is the one who has been a real father to me.  But I've come to an even more important decision. (pauses I'm going to join the Avatar. And I'm going to help him defeat you.  Because I know my own destiny. Taking you down is the Avatar's destiny. (sheathes his swords) Goodbye.  What happened that night?  (a tear streams from his eye) So she's alive. Uncle!  Where is my Uncle?
Azula: So, you are alive after all.  I had a hunch that you survived. It doesn't matter, I've known about the invasion for months. (sarcastically) Hm, you mean I'm not good enough for you? You're hurting my feelings.  Are you sure? I'm a pretty good liar. (her face becomes completely expressionless) I am a 400 foot tall purple platypus bear with pink horns and silver wings. When I left Ba Sing Se, I brought home some souvenirs. (two Dai Li agents drop from the ceiling and land in front of her) Dai Li agents. (sarcastically) Not true, I'm giving it my all.  Um, right. I think your friend just said that genius. And since you can't see, I should tell you I'm rolling my eyes.  It's a trap. Don't say I didn't warn you. (in a slightly bored tone) So, Sokka's your name right My favorite prisoner used to mention you all the time. (Sokka stops and turns around) She was convinced that you were going to come rescue her. Of course, you never came and she gave up on you.  (under her breath, dripping with malice) Come and get it... Oh. Sounds like the firebending's back on.  Dad's all the way at the end of the hall and down the secret stairway on the left. I'm sure he'll be more than happy to see you now.  No. They're too fast. It doesn't matter, they'll be back.
Toph: If it's an underground secret bunker we're looking for, I'm just the girl to find it.  (her hand to the ground) Yep. There are natural tunnels criss-crossing through the inside of the volcano.  (she extends her hands to each side before plunging them into the ground, gripping the earth with her fingers) There's something big, dense, and made of metal deep in the heart of the volcano.  This way! That one's a dead end. Perish and burn in hot magma. The tunnel continues on the other side and it leads right to the bunker. Not a problem.  And stick to the truth. I'll be able to tell if you're lying.  (after a brief pause) Okay you're good, I admit it. (bends the earth underneath Azula so that it encases her is a conical shape)  But you really ought to consider telling the truth anyway. You're trying to keep us here and waste all our time! (angry)I 'll roll your whole head! It's not your fault, Sokka. Azula was ready for us. She had every move planned out.  The Fire Lord knew we were coming this time. We thought we had surprise on our side but we didn't. It just wasn't our day. What we need to do now is go help our friends.

Aang: Sorry guys, but Appa (he stretches his hand out and affectionately scratches the area under Appa's eye) gets tired carrying all these people. (off screen) No, (Cut back to Aang with Sokka in the background) she's right, (Sokka looks up at Aang, stunned) we are here. Why can't I go? Fair enough. So, what's the new plan? (sarcastically) Oh, yeah, that's great. (He picks up a pebble and tosses it into the air nonchalantly) No problem, (He continues fidgeting) I'll just do that. (He lays the pebble on the bench and flicks it away.) (continuing his little tantrum) Well, it's not even gonna be possible. Where am I supposed to get a firebending teacher? Yeah right, (He lies down on the bench without a care) like we'll ever run into Jeong Jeong again. Oh well, guess we can't come up with anybody. Why don't we (He jumps over Sokka's bench) just take a nice tour (He proceeds to run off screen as Momo follows him) around the temple? (Cut to a close up of Aang as he feigns deaf) What? The wind is too loud in my ears. Check out this loop. Ok, we can do that while I show you the giant Pai Sho table. (Cut to a frontal shot of an excited Aang as the remainder of the Gaang descend from Appa behind him) Oh, you're gonna love the all-day echo chamber. There's no way we can trust you after everything you've done. (Cut back to Zuko who listens intently) We'll never let you join us. (Zuko's expression changes to surprise) (off screen) I kind of (Katara turns her head towards him) have a confession to make. (Cut to Aang's back) Remember when you two were sick and I got captured by (turns his body slightly so his side is facing the camera) Zhao? Anyway, when Zhao had me chained up, it was Zuko (the siblings turn towards him) who came in and got me out. (Cut to a close up of Aang's face) He risked his life to save me. (Cut to a sideview of the 3 as Katara steps forward) You're probably right. Or when he tried to capture me (Cut back to Toph) at the fire temple. (Cut back to a frontal shot of the 3 again) I'm not having Zuko as my teacher. (He walks off screen and Toph's expression changes to surprise. Cut to a full view of the Gaang as Aang walks to an area behind Katara with his back towards them.) (shocked) You what!? So he attacked you? But he did firebend at you? (disappointed) I hate to go looking for a fight, but you're right. After what he did to Toph, I don't think we have a choice. I can't believe I'm saying this... but thanks Zuko. I think you are supposed to be my firebending teacher. When I first tried to learn firebending, I burned Katara. And after that, I never wanted to firebend again. But now I know you understand how easy it is to hurt the people you love. (he bows to Zuko) I'd like you to teach me. Not so fast. I still have to ask my friends if it's ok with them. Toph, you're the one that Zuko burned. What do you think? Sokka? Katara?
Katara: This is humiliating. (She turns her head back) Both. (off screen) Uh, I think your feet need their eyes checked. You guys go... (Aang catches his glider and Katara lays a hand on his shoulder) I think we need to talk about some things. (Cut to a serious Katara) We need to decide what we're gonna do now. And since you're the Avatar, maybe you should be a part of this. Aang, no one said it's gonna be easy. (deep in thought) We could look for Jeong Jeong. Aang, can we talk about you learning firebending now? You can't possibly think that any of us would trust you, can you? I mean, how stupid do you think we are? (off screen) Or when you stole my mother's necklace (Cut to a sideview of the siblings) and used it to track us down (she takes a step forward with her fists clenched) and capture us? (off screen) You need to get out of here, now. (Cut to an angry Katara) No, we won't! (off screen) Get out of here (Zuko rolls himself onto his back and the camera pans up towards the Gaang) and don't come back. And if we ever see you again...Well, (Sokka takes a step towards Zuko) we'd better not see you again! Why would he try to fool us like that? (Katara starts walking into the chamber) This is just like when we were in prison together in Ba Sing Se. (Cut to a sideview of the 3 to show the siblings each holding a sleeping bag while Aang holds a jar) He starts talking about his mother, (Aang proceeds to walk off screen) and making it seem like he's an actual human being with feelings. (Cut to a back view of Sokka with his sister still in sight) The thing is, it worked. (kneels and sets the sleeping bag down) I did feel sorry for him. I felt like he was really confused and hurt. (looks around) But obviously when the time came, (stands up) he made his choice, and we paid the price. (Cut to a close up of Katara as she turns angry) We can't trust him. (off screen) Sokka, (Sokka turns towards his visibly annoyed sister as his uvula flaps around slightly) I looked at it and told you there was nothing there. No way, (brings her arms up and thrusts them to the side) I'm sure (punches her fists down) he only did it (crosses her arms) so he could capture you himself. And what was (punches her fists down again) all that crazy stuff about setting Appa free? (crosses her arms once more) What a liar. You're right, (thrusts her arms down as Aang looks towards her) Toph, let's go find him (raises her arms up) and give him a medal. (She says this with sarcasm) The "not as much of a jerk as you could have been" award. (standing her ground) Easy for you to say, you weren't there (takes a step forward and points to the side) when he had us attacked by pirates. Why would you (brings her hands up and throws them down rapidly in hot anger) even try to defend him? Well, (crosses her arms) I guess that's settled. (passing the bowl to The Duke) Has anyone seen Toph? (worried) I think we should go look for her. Toph, what happened? (examining Toph's feet) Oh, no, what happened? I meant how. (shocked) Zuko? (cut to a close up of Toph's feet as Katara bends the water away and back into her water skin) It's gonna take a while for your feet to get better. I wish I could've worked on them sooner. You are a master of surprise, Sokka. I can't step out to waterbend at him without getting blown up. And I can't get a good enough angle on him from down here. I'll go along with whatever you think is right. (venomously) You might have everyone else here buying your "transformation". But you and I both know you've struggled with doing the right thing in the past. (walks up to Zuko and leans forward threateningly) So let me tell you something right now. You make one step backward, one slip-up, give me one reason to think you might hurt Aang... and you won't have to worry about your destiny anymore. Because I'll make sure your destiny ends right then and there... permanently.
Sokka: Do you mean getting thoroughly spanked by the Fire Nation, (Katara turns her head towards her brother) or having to walk all the way to the Western Air Temple? I miss not having blisters (Cut to an overhead shot behind Appa) on my feet. Well, if you ask me, the new plan is the old plan. You just need to master all four elements, and confront the Fire Lord before the comet comes. There's got (brings up his hands to his chin and thinks) to be someone who can teach him firebending. (straining his voice against the rushing wind) Aang, (Appa continues to fly behind Aang) I think we should be making some plans about our future. (Cut back to a shot of the hour glass fountain as Aang and Appa land on the platform.) Not really, since you've followed us all over the world. Yeah, all you've ever done is try to hunt us down (Cut to a sideview shot of Zuko) and capture Aang. He probably just covered himself in honey or something so that Appa would lick him. I'm not (swipes his arm aside in a "No" gesture) buying it. (off screen) Like when you attacked our village? (interrupts) Wait, you sent (unsheathes his boomerang and holds it towards Zuko) Combustion Man after us? (off screen) Oh, sorry. (Cut back to a frontal shot of Toph and Sokka as he remains in a defensive position) I didn't mean to insult your friend. Either you leave, or we attack. Obviously, he wants to lead us into some kind of trap. He wants you (Katara turns towards him) to trust him and feel sorry for him, so you let your guard down, then he strikes. (punches his fist out) (Cut to an outraged Sokka) And you made us suck on frozen frogs? How could I forget? (throws down his sleeping bag) I had a wart on the flap that hangs down from the back of my throat for a month! (Cut back to a frontal shot of Sokka as he argues) I could feel it! It's my throatal flap. (Cut to outside the chamber looking in at the Gaang) Yeah, (steps towards Aang) face it Aang. You're nothing but a big prize to him. (Cut back to the siblings) Oh, hooray. (throws his arms up sarcastically) In a lifetime of evil, at least (brings his hands to his cheek and puts on a mocking friendly face) he didn't add animal cruelty to the list. (He brings his hands down and looks back at Toph angrily) (clenches his fist) Or when he burned down Kyoshi Island. You're darn right (Sokka takes a step towards his sister and it appears like a 3 versus 1 standoff) you're not, buddy. I haven't seen her since she stormed off yesterday. Oh, let her have fun with her rocks. I'm in no rush to have her yelling at us again. (shocked) Ugh! See, you trusted Zuko and you got burned... literally. Zuko's clearly too dangerous to be left alone. We're gonna have to go after him. He's crafty, but we'll find a way to capture him. Yeah... get him to come back and say he'll be our prisoner. Then we'll jump him and really make him our prisoner. He'll never suspect it. (thinks for a moment, then comes up with an idea) I know how to get an angle on him. All right buddy, don't fail me now. (jumps and catches the boomerang triumphantly) Yeah, boomerang! (he and Katara look up smiling, but quickly frown. Cut to a shot of Combustion Man standing back up and putting a hand to his forehead. Cut back to Sokka as he looks at his boomerang disappointedly) Aw, boomerang... Hey, and what about me? I did the boomerang thing. (gestures)  (closes his eyes and hangs his head a second, then shrugs) Hey, all I want is to defeat The Fire Lord. If you think this is the way to do it, then I'm all for it. So here you go, home sweet home. I guess, you know, for now. (cut to a shot looking through the window of Zuko inside the bare room and Sokka looking in through the door) Unpack... lunch soon. Uh...welcome aboard? (Zuko turns and smiles at Sokka. Cut to a close up of Sokka staring back before turning away.)Yeah. (cut to a shot outside the room as Sokka walks up to Aang) Ok, this is really, really weird.
Zuko: The only view I'm interested in seeing (Iroh's expression changes into sadness) is the Avatar in chains. First, we'll check each of the air temples. (takes a few steps forward, looking around) Then we'll scour the world, searching even the most remote locations until we find him. (turns around and raises his voice) What else would I expect to hear from the laziest man in the Fire Nation? (Cut to a close up of Iroh's slightly appalled face as he looks down and sighs) The only way (Cut back to a frontal shot of uncle and nephew) to regain my honor is to find the Avatar. So I will. Hello, (raises an arm in greeting) Zuko here. But I guess (rubs his hand against the back of his head nervously) you probably already know me... sort of. Uh...so, the thing is, (He puts his arm down and looks to the side hesitantly) I have a lot of firebending experience, and I'm (places an arm on chest with pride) considered to be pretty good at it. (He continues smiling) Well, you've seen me... you know, when I was attacking you? (His eyes widen at his verbal mistake) Uh, yeah...I guess (places his fingers against his forehead in embarrassment) I should apologize for that. But anyway, (waves an arm to the side dismissively) I'm good now. (clenches both fists and places one on his chest while the other arm is raised) I mean, I thought I was good before, but now I realize I was bad. (He gets visibly uncomfortable and drops his arms into a slouch) Ugh, but anyway... I think it's time I joined your group, and taught (straightens up with a sincere expression on his face) the Avatar firebending. (Cut to a close up of a frustrated Zuko) Well, what's your answer?! Yeah, that's what I'd say too. (Cut to a far shot of Zuko's campsite as he raises his arm to his head in despair) How am I supposed to convince these people I'm on their side? What would Uncle do? (He proceeds to imitate Iroh's voice and pretends to hold an imaginary beard on his chin as he starts pacing.)  (Cut to a close up of Zuko's face) Hello, (raises his arm up in greeting) Zuko here. Hey, I heard you guys flying around down there, so I just thought (raises his shoulders) I'd wait for you here. I know you must be surprised to see me here. (Cut to a sideview shot of the Gaang as they wear hostile expressions on their faces) (Cut to a visibly uncomfortable Zuko) Right... Well, uh... anyway, what I wanted to tell you about is that I've changed, and I uh, (Cut to a slight overhead shot behind Zuko as the camera slowly pans upwards to show the Gaang) I'm good now. And, well, I think I should join your group.(Cut to a close up of Zuko's apprehensive face) Oh, and I can teach firebending... to you. (Cut to a confused Aang as he lowers his staff further. Cut to Katara in disbelief. Cut back to Zuko.) See, I uh... (defensive) I've done some good things. (walks forward) I mean, I could've stolen your bison in Ba Sing Se, but I set him free. (He thrusts both arms out towards Appa to prove his point) That's something. (Cut to a remorseful Zuko with Appa licking its lips in the background) I can understand why you wouldn't trust me, and I know I've made some mistakes (looks to the side in shame) in the past. (Cut to a close up of his face) Look, I admit I've done some awful things. I was wrong (lowers his head down and presses a palm against his temple) to try to capture you, and I'm sorry that I attacked the Water Tribe. (Camera pans across the Gaang who are still not pleased with his presence) And I never should've sent that Fire Nation assassin after you. (Sokka and Toph widen their eyes in shock) I'm gonna try to stop him. (Cut back to a slightly panicking Zuko) Well, that's not his name, but... (raising his voice) He's not my friend! (Cut back to Zuko who closes his eyes and opens them as he angles his head diagonally) Why aren't you saying anything? (Cut to Aang's back with Zuko still in view) You once said you thought we could be (Zuko shrugs) friends. (Aang looks down to the side, pondering) You know I (Cut to a frontal shot of Aang as he remains deep in thought) have good in me. (closes his eyes for a moment before opening them and staring back at the group with determination. Cut to back the slight overhead shot behind Zuko again.) I'm trying to explain (raises both arms in frustration and takes a few steps towards them) that I'm not that person anymore. (He continues to walk to the group but Sokka takes a step forward and thrusts his boomerang out as a warning. Zuko takes a step back.) (aghast) If you won't accept me as a friend, (Cut to a shot of the ground in front of Zuko as he kneels down with his head bowed) then maybe you'll take me (raises both arms out as if he was holding an offering but his fists are clenched) as a prisoner. Argh, I can't believe how stupid (thrusts both arms outwards as he exits the screen) I am. I mean, (walks back into screen) what was I thinking?
